Äi vá» khuya ko tiá»‡n láº¯m', 'phÃ²ng sáº¡ch sáº½, Ä‘á»‹a Ä‘iá»ƒm thuáº­n lá»£i', 'I had an amazing stay at Saigon Hotel , so impressed with staff here , specially those at Front Desk whose names as I remembered like Vicky and Eric are very attentive and caring. They were trying to accommodate  my needs with lovely spacious and clean room which every single traveler may expect, a glass mirror for razor should be better.The breakfast is full of choices which I am satisfied with what I paid for, highly recommend this hotel.', 'The Front desk bent over backwards to attend to our needs, very friendly and professional. I really appreciate your kindness & courtesy.  Rooms are fully equipped and comfortable. Definitely is our first choice in this city for when I get back.', 'I enjoyed my stay here. Breakfast is good but small, elevators are slow. The pillows could be softer. I would be fine staying here again if I ever went back.', 'The hotel is very comfortable. Very helpful staff. Location is very convenient for guests to go to very where in HCM city.', 'Very convenient location! Only thing concerned is that you can hear outside noise from door very obviously..', 'Good hotel', 'Overall a very good stay marred at the end by charges for a small towel which apparently disappeared. We had two rooms and stayed a week and I feel that this was uncalled for. Very petty.Other than this, the staff was courteous and efficient and the rooms were nice. Excellent location', "The room was lovely and very clean. Linens were great. The bathroom awesome with a nice tub. The free breakfast buffet was lovely with both western and asian food. Everything a tourist or a return visitor would want was in the area. Plenty of good restaurants and shopping for tourist or those living in VN. I'm an expat returning from the US on my way to Da Nang and will return regularly. Highly recommend Sai Gon Hotel!", 'Hotel was located strategically in the Dong Khoi district and was really convenient as there are many eateries and 24 hour-convenience shops around. Excellent massage place down the street. Room was big and very spacious, and the toilet was really clean. Will definitely recommend to friends!!!', 'The stay was very comfortable. It was such a nice hotel, well suited our needs;1) Saigon Hotel staffs are very polite. We are allowed slightly early check-in. As we travel on Ramadhan, they even provide Halal breakfast pack for especially for us every early morning.2) It is located opposite to the Ho Chi Minh Main Mosque, with few Halal restaurants around the same street. It makes it convenient for Muslim travellers.3) Cab ride to spot places such as Ben Tanh market, Saigon Square, etc is just between 5-10 minutes taxi ride.4) Convenient Store, ATM, are available on the same street.5) Room was very clean, well equipped, well designed, and very comfortable for the price.Will surely stay here again in the future.', 'Need to diversify breakfast', "Good location, room is clean However the lower floor with street facing is quite terrible. It's really difficult to sleep due to the terrible noisy from street until early morning. Try not to take these rooms if you want to have a good night.", 'All staffs are very friendly and nice.Location is also very convenient and good.Breakfast is delicious.But,because the front of the hotel many people are gathering at night everyday,hotel room is little noisy.', 'The hotel is clean and great access to most of the sightseeing places in the city. They also offer good breakfasts everyday. But more than anything, the staffs are great. They are all kind, friendly and very helpful, especially a woman named Jolie of the reception desk who kindly helped me when I had a trouble with a bike driver. (There is one more person I would like to tell my gratitude but I forgot to ask his name... ) I would definitely recommend this hotel.', 'Staff is  helpful and friendly. Great hotel to stay in. I will be back to stay in the hotel.', 'Very close to the Mosque & several halal food resto']

PhÃ¹ há»£p cho Ä‘i cÃ´ng tÃ¡c.', 'TÃ´i khÃ´ng Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t cÃ³ nháº­n xÃ©t gÃ¬ vá» khÃ¡ch sáº¡n nÃ y, phÃ²ng sáº¡ch sáº½, thiáº¿t bá»‹ á»•n nhÆ°ng hÆ¡i nhá». PhÃ¹ há»£p cho Ä‘i cÃ´ng tÃ¡c.', 'A good value and friendly hotel in the heart of District 1.', 'Front desk personnel are friendly, helpful, and speak English well.  No other hotel personnel speak English.  Stayed at this hotel multiple times over last 2 years and always receive warm and pleasant reception.  Small unique hotel with approximately 28 rooms (7 floors).  Rooms are small but adequate for 1 -2 people. Great location within walking distance to many City Central destination points.  Limited breakfast options available.', 'Cherry Hotel is a simple hotel that is worth the value. The staff is quite friendly with great English for Vietnam, it is in a fun and convenient part of town, and has the essentials. Things to note: walls are thin so it is easy to hear the TV or noise from neighboring rooms, and the breakfast is rather limited after 8:00am.', "Nice place, the room was decent for the price, although the 'park view' was reminding me of the fawlty towers 'sea view when standing on the toilet' scene! Nice big window though.Breakfast was decent for this price range. And they kept it topped up with fresh hot dishes. Milk was even cold which is rare!", 'This is a good hotel in the city. Hotel staff can speak English well and helpful. Breakfast quite good. Hotel area is clean. Price is not expensive compare with other hotel in the same area. I will stay there again next time I go to Ho Chi Minh. Hotel is near night club bar etc. can walk from hotel. Also it is near shoping center and tourist place like post office and church.', 'the hotel is situated in the city can walk to tourist place easily. the room is clean and has space enought for 2 persons. Breakfast is ok compare with hotel price.Hotel staff can communicate in English well. I can check in check out very fast and can check out late until 4pm. I will stay this hoel again next time.', 'the hotel is situated in a relatively quiet area\rwith plenty of good restaurants and bars, though some are pricey compared to local restaurants\rthis area is known and catered to japanese and korean tourists/businessmen', 'the hotel was clean, it was quite spacious. Staff was friendly and helpful. the bed was super comfortable. Only thing was there was a smell in the room once in a while but overall, everything was fantastic. the hotel is value for money! Location was also good', 'a neutrally decorated hotel in central saigon. if you are to go to the usual night clubs your way back at the end of the night will be most convenient. the hotel is very centrally located for shopping and all sights  can be reached on foot. the rooms of the hotel are furnished comfortably in a neutral decor. bed was very comfotable and staff helpful without pushy as i found in some other parts of northern vietnam.', 'When we asked the Staff about the nearest available massages and hair salon services,they told us to go to a beauty spa that were much farther than what we would haave wanted.  We were in the taxi going to the place they suggested, but found several available spas on they way. After we passed the fourth spa, we decided not to go further but to stop and try it. The place and service was so good.  A couple of days later, we again went for another massage, this time, to the first spa we saw and the services and prices were even better, cheaper than the place where the hotel staff suggested at first.', 'we stayed here for three nights and it is indeed a good place to base. very near to everything yet in a quiet street. the color scheme is light and bright and the rooms are spotless. most hotels in these area are mid priced but cherry is more affordable and has good service. the real kicker for me is the location as it is two blocks away from opera house, convenience store, good restaurants and shopping areas.']

NÆ¡i Ä‘Ã¢y gáº§n chá»£ Báº¿n ThÃ nh vÃ  Ä‘iá»ƒm trung chuyá»ƒn bus HÃ m Nghi - nÆ¡i cÃ³ thá»ƒ báº¯t xe Ä‘i kháº¯p nÆ¡i (Suá»‘i TiÃªn, sÃ¢n bay,...) nÃªn ráº¥t thuáº­n tiá»‡n.  GiÃ¡ tá»‘t khi xÃ©t vá» vá»‹ trÃ­, khÃ´ng gian vá»«a pháº£i, tiá»‡n nghi bá»Ÿi  giÃ¡ á»Ÿ quáº­n 1 thÆ°á»ng cao hÆ¡n háº³n.', 'NhÃ¢n viÃªn ráº¥t táº­n tÃ¢m, khÃ¡ch sáº¡n sáº¡ch sáº½ vÃ  á»Ÿ vá»‹ trÃ­ ráº¥t tiá»‡n lá»£i ! xin cÃ¡m Æ¡n ráº¥t nhiá»u áº¡', 'hÃ i lÃ²ng, gáº§n trung tÃ¢m, tiá»‡n lá»£i Ä‘i tham quan cÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹a Ä‘iá»ƒm lÃ¢n cáº­n, gáº§n chá»£ báº¿n thÃ nh', 'Firstly, there was a constant urine smell in our room. Secondly, we booked for connected room but ended up we stayed in different floors. Thirdly, the picture shown online was totally different from the actual room which i really felt disappointed about it.', 'The pictures of the rooms on their hotel page is false and misleading. I was shocked to find out my room was not the same room as advertised.  The receptionist showed me a few rooms and they all have not been renovated. My room had exposed wires and unfinished paint. There were no security lock and amenities were missing. The whole place smells terrible because the receptionist explained that they were fixing the plumbing pipe, so overly-heavy air freshener was used to cover up the bad smell.  This was probably one of my worst experiences at a hotel and I had to stayed there because the room was not refundable, not to mentioned it wasnâ€™t safe with exposed wires.', '-very near to ben thanh market/malaysian street-bilik yg complete dgn water heater/mini refrigerator/hair dryer-mereka sediakan servis iron...sehelai 10000vnd-hotel ni ke dalam sikit...simpang berhadapan dgn bloom hotel atau belah blakang bali boutique hotel...so selesa xbising...', 'Smell something like shit..donâ€™t know where the smell coming from...overalll hotel all good..near the Malaysian street and Ben thanMarket..halal food..staff really helpful..can speak english..but tell me late to check out  early because before I check in..I tell them want to check out late around 4 to 5 pm and I will pay extra charge..and they say ok..when the day I check out.they ask me to check out early...so for me make sure tell me before the day I want to check out...overalll all good...', 'Moc Huong Hotel is located in an alleyway so you will need to be vigilant when trying to find the hotel for the first time. I booked the superior room with no window. The bed, towels and linen provided were clean. The bedroom itself was quite modern. However the bathroom is another story. It was very old and had traces of ants. For the first time I felt uncomfortable and had to wear thongs while showering. If they upgrade their bathrooms it would actually be quite a good hotel. The hotel is currently under renovations, mainly evident in the lobby area. Staff was very friendly.', 'I was very excited to stay in M&H after seeing positive reviews. When i arrived the staff were very kind and accommodating. The room that ww stayed in looked exactly like the one in the photo gallery. AC was also cold, my concern since i went during a hot summer time. Blankets and towels were clean. Most importantly, when my friend misplaced his passport and thought it was lost, the hotel staff volunteered to assist. Language barrier was a factor that helped along the way in finding the passport. Luckily my friend found his passport and we cant thank the hotel enough for their assistance. Good value for money, good location. Much recommended! ğŸ‘ğŸ¼', 'In the centre of town with a basic need, room same as photo provide, no window,  drainage pipe inside the room for upper floor without acoustic wall to block the noise. Mini bar with leftover food from previous hotel guest, less power point supply.BTW, overall still acceptable if you need the hotel at town central.', 'The hotel is nice and smell pleasantly. Itâ€™s just that you need to walk through the alley since this hotel is located behind the ben thanh night market. But donâ€™t worry since there are police/army which is safe. If you travel by yourself, please search for â€œIDRIS HALAL FOODâ€ instead of searching  the hotelâ€™s name through google maps/waze. Once you were there. Try to talk with one of the staff in the tour agency office. They will guide you. Overall I happy with my stay', 'I love this hotel. Eventhough it looks like a cheap hotel (cheap and affordable indeed)..but I really satisfied staying at this hotel. Near by the Ben Thanh Market..and quite place..eventhough it is situated at the small road but you will feel very safe...trust me...', 'Stayed there on december. It was a great hotel as the facilities are all perfect. maybe the room a bit small but it is what you pay.  Attraction are within walking distance. The worker there are helpful even theres a language barrier. They even explain by drawing me a map just to show the direction from hotel to attraction place. definitely will stay here again.', "very good rate for a budget traveler, room is small but adequate, in small alley and conveniently walking distance to ben thanh market, pham ngu lao backpacker nightlife area. hard to find, make sure you write down the address and phone number for direction if you don't speak vietnamese.", 'i chose this hotel due to its value for money and ideal location, very close to shopping areas and bars. the hotel was not what i actually expected, although the location of this hotel was a bit hard to find, i find the place very well maintained like it was just recently renovated. it has a great lobby area. the room is very clean and spacy. even though my room has no windows, i had a balcony, which made me very happy.\rthe bathroom is okay as well. and ventilation was fine, very very cool. i would like return here again. \r\rstaffs were fine, not very accomodating though, must be shy in speaking english.. but i find them okay.', 'Good location but too bad vehicles cant go in to the hotel. Need to walk till the main road with luggage. Overall the hotel is good.', "We take suite room for 3 person, its quite big enough for 3 person. The location is near to everywhere, very convenient.The room doesn't really look like in the picture, the toilet in the room doesn't show in the picture ( i guess because the design of the toilet and the room are slightly different,  but the toilet were clean, its just doesn't match with the room design, it might because they renovated all the room except for toilet)Staff were friendly, they lend us umbrella when its rain, share some information with us about the famous place to go in HCM. Overall is good for vacation, value for money we spent for 3 nights.", "Consider good location where all the food stall and convenience store just a few step from the hotel. The picture slightly different from the actual but still acceptable, all the staffs quite helpful, and the hotel not facing the main road, so will not so noisy and can have a perfect sleep at night.  The bed and pillow superb comfortable and personally felt that it better than some 5stars hotel. The hotel main door will close at 12midnight, but there have staff sleep over there (on duty), so that's no any problem if you late back to hotel.", 'The hotel is located inside an alley but worry not, there is a security post in front of the alley with CCTV. You have to request for room cleaning. Didnâ€™t see the bell boy around. We have to carry our own luggages during Check in and Check out.']

NgoÃ i ra khÃ¡ch sáº¡n khÃ´ng cÃ³ ngÆ°á»i giá»¯ xe ráº¥t nguy hiá»ƒm.', 'vá»‹ trÃ­ Ä‘á»‹a lÃ½, giÃ¡ cáº£ vÃ  phÃ²ng á»‘c Ä‘á»u okie', 'Thiáº¿t káº¿ láº¡', 'PhÃ²ng á»‘c khÃ¡ má»›i vÃ  sáº¡ch sáº½, giá»‘ng nhÆ° trÃªn áº£nh, á»Ÿ trung tÃ¢m thÃ nh phá»‘ nÃªn thuáº­n tiá»‡n di chuyá»ƒn tá»›i nhiá»u Ä‘á»‹a Ä‘iá»ƒm. GiÃ¡ cáº£ há»£p lÃ½. Láº§n tá»›i quay láº¡i SG sáº½ tiáº¿p tá»¥c book phÃ²ng á»Ÿ Ä‘Ã¢y', 'Not an ideal place if you like to rest and sleep. Hotel is surrounded by neighbors with birds. They are extremely loud in the morning. Internet connection is incredibly slow. There is no elevator and hotel staff wont carry your luggage upstairs. Be mindful of that. Mattress is not comfortable.The only good thing is the room is quite spacious. Would not come back here', "Everything here is good except for the location. It's in the alley & not in the center of the city/tourist area but still with in the area.", '- The ceiling light was not working - Bed lights are too big and no covers so very annoying if using it.- The shower is leaking and I was not able to control water direction.Good thing is that in the morning can hear birds chirping', 'The hotel is perfect for a solo traveler. Everything was good except the fact that there were so Many spider webs, like you can find them in every single corner. I really like the layout of the room. The bathroom has that enough space you need. They have kettle and hairdryer which is quite convenient. They also have bathrobe which I dont usually expect from a 1star hotel. The experience was definitely more of a 2-3 star one. I had bread  and omelete for bfast. The omelete was a bit too oily for me. The sausage and bread were ok. The lady even gave me some pineapple to try since it was my first trip to HCM and she tild me that the pineapple tastes different there. Very friendly.', 'Clean room, friendly staffs, but the price of the drink and snack available in the room are quite bitter compared to other hotels that i went before. But overall it is value for money', 'The hotel is located in a small alley but easy to find. The room is spacious and very clean. Highly recommend', 'Located in small alley near the city center. The hotel is clean, quiet and the staff is so friendly', 'So convenient, lovely decor and very welcoming staff... our home base to explore Ho Chi Minh!', 'Good:- spacious room, comfortable bed and pillow- bathroom dry-wet separation, well functioned flush, hot water shower easy to adjust accordingly- amenities provided (face towel, bath towels, bathrobes, shampoo and shower gel) (bottled water, minibar in room!) - near to Cho Tan Dinh (Tan Dinh market) - near to pink church (Tan Dinh church)- only 15mins from TSN airport (non-peak)- less touristy than Ben Thanh area- good pricing- friendly reception staff, simple English is okto take note: - need take bus/grab (average d20.000-d40.000) (depending on peak hours) to Ben thanh area - located in an alley, sighting of cockroaches and rats (but seen it elsewhere in saigon also, itâ€™s not that uncommon) - bring/buy your own toothbrush & toothpaste Overall, had an enjoyable stay and trip at hcmc with Junction Hotel. Strategically plan the day, go out during non-peak and come back during non-peak, avoid traffic frustration and save traveling costs too. Surely Recommended!', "I've seen this situation a lot recently in D-1 areas of HCMC near my office. This explains why I change hotels often. :) A small, modern, 5 floor walk-up, guesthouse-style hotel (8-10 rooms).  The layout and furniture modern, but the upkeep already failing. Over 3 days I stayed in 2 different rooms. In each room the 'new' bedside light fixtures were literally falling off the wall.  Immediately I get the sense management doesn't care  how the property is maintained. Too bad. This place has promise", 'á»•n Ã¡p áº¡', 'Nice place to stay, modern design. Lots of restaurant and shopping nearby. Will definitely come back again.', 'Only good feelings about this placeLaundry 5kg - 50.000 ğŸ‘', "Nice little room with a modern design to it. Very clean and well-maintained. The bathrooms were the nicest hotel bathrooms I've used in vn so far!", 'We only stayed for one night and the room is nicely designed, clean and spacious. However, our sleep was interrupted due to the constant call of rooster in the early  morning.', 'The hotel is nice and the room is fine - quite modern. There is an honesty bar on the top floor which is a nice touch. My only fault with the room is that the windows offer minimal soundproofing. the neighbourhood cockerel woke me up both mornings and people talking outside could clearly be heard,My main problem with the hotel is the location. We wanted to try somewhere different having always stayed in district 1 Pham Ngu Lao area before. There were a couple of nice restaurants nearby for dinner and munch but not much else. We found that we needed to take taxis everywhere. The area around the hotel is completely shut down around 10.30pm. There were people sleeping in doorways nearby and we felt a little uncomfortable when walking back to the hotel. I would suggest always taking a taxi to the gate at night if possible. Whilst the hotel is nice enough we will not stay there or in this area again.']

I would ask for window maybe but not that big of a deal', 'Rooms small but adequate area is fine and breakfast selection good and pool on rooftop small but fine and staff friendly with small bars and wine within metres from front door', "Awesome location, $5 min walk from Ben than, short Grab rides out. Rooms are as described, it is clean with good AC. Pool is not swimmable, but good for a dip.A nice surprise was the breakfast. Coffee is not watered down, iced to make ca phe sua da. There's an egg station, where you can order your eggs any way you like, + omlette option, and they make pho/ bun bo hue depending on the day!The entire staff is awesome. Dexter at the front, the front desk ladies, and the cook who makes your omelettes/pho.Overall? Awesome staff and overall great experience for a couple that came in to town for the first time.", "Looks like a new small petite boutique 3 star hotel, very clean, white/cozy with modern facilities & great location - away from filthy & noisy area yet closed to all the landmarks. I didn't get the chance to use the rooftop pool coz busy looking for another hotel for my 2nd night as hotel is fully booked so can't extend.\r\rAs for lightless small window, please note that it has no indication on any hotel agents  website except direct hotel's website which says window with internal view (mine literally a few inches to another bedroom and I didnt see this till way after) which I wish hotel agents are not discreet about such thing & indicate this. I hate dark room or windowless which I can't really draw curtain out here because of another room facing and Saigon is full of windowless rooms throughout.", 'The breakfast was very bad . The bacon is poorly cooked and I would recommend to not eat it . The pillows were horrible . I had a sore neck for the rest of my trip . The staff were great and the roof top pool is nice .', 'We upgraded the room to include an extra bed for 3rd adult. Felt the bed was unstable and not safe to sleep on, we called for Housekeeping to check and ensure bed was set up securely.  Housekeeping came and left. We called front desk, only to have her insist â€œall extra beds are like that, cannot be like normal bedsâ€. We went to front desk to explain the situation and asked for someone to come and see the bed so they can understand. Front desk insisted the same, told the manager to repeat the same to us â€œall extra bed are like thatâ€, refused to allow the bellboy who offered to help to come up.Since hotel staff didnâ€™t want to check, we lifted the bed and found a wheel had fallen off... couldnâ€™t fit it back. The helpful bellboy, Dexter John, was sent up to help us fix it back. The poor service from the front desk made the otherwise good experience distasteful. Clean and seemingly new rooms and amenities, tasty and good variety breakfast, toddler friendly rooftop pool.', 'I stayed here for two nights during my training in HCMc. And it was a fantastic experience. You can find many good local restaurant and cafe nearby after a long working day. The room is comfort and clean. And the hotel is only a few walks from Ben Thanh market, Takashimaya shopping center and other main attractions. I will definitely come back here agai.', 'This was a couples holiday so therefore I judge things slightly differently from my solo trips. This is a very nice hotel for a couple to stay in. The room we had did not have a window but it is nice and quiet and perfect for a deep sleep. The pool and the gym are quite basic but they make use of their limited space so they are not bad at all, just nothing special. The gym is a small room on the bottom floor which has a limited set up. The pool on the roof is super small but actually very nice. The only problem we had is that during the day it was literally full, which is not ideal but empty in evening times. Staff are very lovely and helpful and it is in a nice central area. We actually wanted to extend our stay, which means we liked it, but it was full so we went to another hotel after it. We would stay again.', 'Some sounds are easily heard from corridor or neighbors. But no noise from streets outside which is good.', 'While Checking In i Reached at 9.30am instead of 12am check in time - they insisted I pay extra money for early check in - even tough they had rooms readyWORST case at 1am while sleeping - I got up to worst nightmares - 6- 7 BED BUGS CRAWLING ALL OVER THE BED - ONLY CHANGED THE ROOM.No Hot Water for Shower not even medium hot water to de-stress after workEven after point out at reception no proper action or communication they paid for my fare to airport - which I categorically told I do not need them to pay No proper responsiveness - also inside small lane to getting taxis a bit difficult or need to wait']

It's in the alley & not in the center of the city/tourist area but still with in the area.", '- The ceiling light was not working - Bed lights are too big and no covers so very annoying if using it.- The shower is leaking and I was not able to control water direction.Good thing is that in the morning can hear birds chirping', 'The hotel is perfect for a solo traveler. Everything was good except the fact that there were so Many spider webs, like you can find them in every single corner. I really like the layout of the room. The bathroom has that enough space you need. They have kettle and hairdryer which is quite convenient. They also have bathrobe which I dont usually expect from a 1star hotel. The experience was definitely more of a 2-3 star one. I had bread  and omelete for bfast. The omelete was a bit too oily for me. The sausage and bread were ok. The lady even gave me some pineapple to try since it was my first trip to HCM and she tild me that the pineapple tastes different there. Very friendly.', 'Clean room, friendly staffs, but the price of the drink and snack available in the room are quite bitter compared to other hotels that i went before. But overall it is value for money', 'The hotel is located in a small alley but easy to find. The room is spacious and very clean. Highly recommend', 'Located in small alley near the city center. The hotel is clean, quiet and the staff is so friendly', 'So convenient, lovely decor and very welcoming staff... our home base to explore Ho Chi Minh!', 'Good:- spacious room, comfortable bed and pillow- bathroom dry-wet separation, well functioned flush, hot water shower easy to adjust accordingly- amenities provided (face towel, bath towels, bathrobes, shampoo and shower gel) (bottled water, minibar in room!) - near to Cho Tan Dinh (Tan Dinh market) - near to pink church (Tan Dinh church)- only 15mins from TSN airport (non-peak)- less touristy than Ben Thanh area- good pricing- friendly reception staff, simple English is okto take note: - need take bus/grab (average d20.000-d40.000) (depending on peak hours) to Ben thanh area - located in an alley, sighting of cockroaches and rats (but seen it elsewhere in saigon also, itâ€™s not that uncommon) - bring/buy your own toothbrush & toothpaste Overall, had an enjoyable stay and trip at hcmc with Junction Hotel. Strategically plan the day, go out during non-peak and come back during non-peak, avoid traffic frustration and save traveling costs too. Surely Recommended!', "I've seen this situation a lot recently in D-1 areas of HCMC near my office. This explains why I change hotels often. :) A small, modern, 5 floor walk-up, guesthouse-style hotel (8-10 rooms).  The layout and furniture modern, but the upkeep already failing. Over 3 days I stayed in 2 different rooms. In each room the 'new' bedside light fixtures were literally falling off the wall.  Immediately I get the sense management doesn't care  how the property is maintained. Too bad. This place has promise", 'á»•n Ã¡p áº¡', 'Nice place to stay, modern design. Lots of restaurant and shopping nearby. Will definitely come back again.', 'Only good feelings about this placeLaundry 5kg - 50.000 ğŸ‘', "Nice little room with a modern design to it. Very clean and well-maintained. The bathrooms were the nicest hotel bathrooms I've used in vn so far!", 'We only stayed for one night and the room is nicely designed, clean and spacious. However, our sleep was interrupted due to the constant call of rooster in the early  morning.', 'The hotel is nice and the room is fine - quite modern. There is an honesty bar on the top floor which is a nice touch. My only fault with the room is that the windows offer minimal soundproofing. the neighbourhood cockerel woke me up both mornings and people talking outside could clearly be heard,My main problem with the hotel is the location. We wanted to try somewhere different having always stayed in district 1 Pham Ngu Lao area before. There were a couple of nice restaurants nearby for dinner and munch but not much else. We found that we needed to take taxis everywhere. The area around the hotel is completely shut down around 10.30pm. There were people sleeping in doorways nearby and we felt a little uncomfortable when walking back to the hotel. I would suggest always taking a taxi to the gate at night if possible. Whilst the hotel is nice enough we will not stay there or in this area again.']

The staff were great and the roof top pool is nice .', 'We upgraded the room to include an extra bed for 3rd adult. Felt the bed was unstable and not safe to sleep on, we called for Housekeeping to check and ensure bed was set up securely.  Housekeeping came and left. We called front desk, only to have her insist â€œall extra beds are like that, cannot be like normal bedsâ€. We went to front desk to explain the situation and asked for someone to come and see the bed so they can understand. Front desk insisted the same, told the manager to repeat the same to us â€œall extra bed are like thatâ€, refused to allow the bellboy who offered to help to come up.Since hotel staff didnâ€™t want to check, we lifted the bed and found a wheel had fallen off... couldnâ€™t fit it back. The helpful bellboy, Dexter John, was sent up to help us fix it back. The poor service from the front desk made the otherwise good experience distasteful. Clean and seemingly new rooms and amenities, tasty and good variety breakfast, toddler friendly rooftop pool.', 'I stayed here for two nights during my training in HCMc. And it was a fantastic experience. You can find many good local restaurant and cafe nearby after a long working day. The room is comfort and clean. And the hotel is only a few walks from Ben Thanh market, Takashimaya shopping center and other main attractions. I will definitely come back here agai.', 'This was a couples holiday so therefore I judge things slightly differently from my solo trips. This is a very nice hotel for a couple to stay in. The room we had did not have a window but it is nice and quiet and perfect for a deep sleep. The pool and the gym are quite basic but they make use of their limited space so they are not bad at all, just nothing special. The gym is a small room on the bottom floor which has a limited set up. The pool on the roof is super small but actually very nice. The only problem we had is that during the day it was literally full, which is not ideal but empty in evening times. Staff are very lovely and helpful and it is in a nice central area. We actually wanted to extend our stay, which means we liked it, but it was full so we went to another hotel after it. We would stay again.', 'Some sounds are easily heard from corridor or neighbors. But no noise from streets outside which is good.', 'While Checking In i Reached at 9.30am instead of 12am check in time - they insisted I pay extra money for early check in - even tough they had rooms readyWORST case at 1am while sleeping - I got up to worst nightmares - 6- 7 BED BUGS CRAWLING ALL OVER THE BED - ONLY CHANGED THE ROOM.No Hot Water for Shower not even medium hot water to de-stress after workEven after point out at reception no proper action or communication they paid for my fare to airport - which I categorically told I do not need them to pay No proper responsiveness - also inside small lane to getting taxis a bit difficult or need to wait']

We never would have been able to book a penthouse suit for that price anywhere else. 5 â˜†'s in my opinion.", 'Booked the pent house room and soon realized it was biggest mistake. The hotel has no elevator. The staff didnâ€™t even offer to bring your luggage to your room. Had to drag my luggage up 5 level of stairs. Was in a rush and asked the staff to bring a package to the room. They rejected my request and said they will keep it at the lobby. On the day of check out, left the hotel for breakfast and the staff rudely reminded that check out time is 12pm. At 11:45am, knocked on my door and asked me to leave. Never ever was treated this poorly.', 'Didnâ€™t clean my room in 2 nights! Not even replenish water. Bathroom floods on taking a shower. Room window faces a wall. No intercom. Located in the midst o nothing touristy.', "The hotel entrance is at a small alley but it's very easy to find. It looks modern and new. Downstairs is a cafe and co-working space, and staffs are really friendly and helpful. My room is huge with two queen size bed and a small kitchen with dining area. It's very clean and comfortable. They even provide a media box with Netflix access for entertainment!Please take note that there's no lift in the building and you'll have to climb stairs. I would definitely come to stay again next time!", 'If u have an elevator or a lift, itâ€™s must be perfect.', 'Pros, great location not far from city center, easy check in. Accessible staff. Nháº¥t Ä‘á»‹nh sáº½ quay láº¡i nÆ¡i Ä‘Ã¢y náº¿u láº§n tá»›i tÃ´i Ä‘áº¿n SG.', 'co cam nhan hai long va thoai mai voi su tien loi toi uu', 'Clean, comfortable, quiet, well located, well priced.  My third stay here.', 'Great location very quite at night for sleeping but in the heart of resturants and bars', "Got an upgrade for free. Just on the side of  Bui Vein street, but won't hear much noise and you'll still get quality sleep at night.", 'Hotel is OK and good location. The staffs are very kind and helpful except the water heater malfunction.', 'Very clean excellent staff.  rj', 'Rooms infested with ants and cockroaches. Dank, dark and depressing. Man on reception rude and condescending. Donâ€™t waste your money or time here. Book elsewhere.', 'One of our group hit a few problems and the staff went out of their way to help, top work ğŸ‘', 'The staff in this hotel were extremely helpful and friendly.  They made sure that myself and my two friends were prioritized even at their own inconvenience to ensure we had a comfortable stay. Mr Tom was especially helpful to ensure I had a bucket of ice each night so that I could begin my night with a few pre drinks in my room.', 'Got put in a room with mold on the walls that smelt terribly musty. The staff were very helpful and offered us a different room. The different room also melt musty, but was fine once we aired it out. The staff were helpful and friendly, but the hotel needs a bit of work. Donâ€™t stay here if you need a soft bed.', "reception is very kind.\rFacility is little old.\rcompare with price its ok.\rit's clean.\rjust for sleep for cheap price it's good", 'Good place and nice hotel', "I won't go there EVER again.", "Value for the little money you pay for this small hotel. So cheap! Close to Buvien St and the bus stop. I'd stay again.", 'I would use this hotel again for a short duration ,the location is good and easy to access  all attreactions.It was a good fast check in.the room I had was a standard double ,but it was so tiny .the bathroom was minute and difficult to enter and shut the door..Therte was no kettle or water or shampoo ,this is the first hotel in Vietnam that has not provided these basic facilities ,thast i have visited.However the room was clean ,but very noisy during the night ,from outside ( late night drinkers etc )', 'tricky to find, but is a hidden gem', 'All are fair and will stay again', "The Saigon Amigo Hotel is well located in the heart of Saigon. You will need to go there walking though, as the hotel is located in a middle of a narrow alley. Our check-in occurred around midnight, as our flight landed one hour earlier from Japan.The other positive points are the friendly morning staff and the amenities that included a toothbrush. The elevator is new, clean and spacious. The price is good.I have to say that the access to enter the hotel was difficult, as a bunch of motorcycles lined up just at the entrance prevented us from getting in the hotel easily.As we had a late flight, we just bought some groceries/snacks at the nearest convenient stores, just a block away. We had bought noodle cups and went back to the hotel asking the night receptionist if we could have hot water for our noodles. It seemed to bother him, as he told us to come back the next day to have hot water! We insisted and he went to the kitchen. However, 20 seconds later he came back saying no hot water! I thought it wasn't difficult to boil hot waterâ€¦ Of course, we could have done that at the convenient store, but I didn't see myself carrying two noodle cups while avoiding getting hit by motorcycles and potentially burning myself.Anyway, I also found the blanket very small for two people, as it didn't cover my feet unto my shins. While the toothbrushes were a nice amenity, there wasn't any shampoo though.In conclusion, we will come back as it was an overall positive experience."]

The owners are probably leveraging on the location but refused to spend a cent to do it up until it needs to. Your money is better spent in so many places. Book immediately if you like a challenging place to stay and don't know what to do with your money.", 'A nice, conveniently located service apartment.  Staff are courteous.  Need to pay 145K dong for the usage of spa facilities though.  Mainly Jap food and pubs nearby.  Walking distance of around 5 mins to the Vincom shopping.  Facilities wise is not really 4 star but it is not significant.', 'Apartments are definitely a bit under furnished and staff dont fully understand how to run a "hotel" (When they showed us to our room, they flipped on the power at the fuse box...not such a welcoming room).  You are next to construction but its not really that bad.Great location with lots of Japanese restaurants right outside and a short walk to the central opera area. Would be greater for an extended stay of 1-2 weeks.Another thing is that 2 person rate is same for 2 BR and Studio. 2 BR is really oversized for a short trip, but no incentive not to choose.', 'Great location but the property is very tired. Lack of basics such as coat hangars. Repeatedly had to ask for iron that was supposedly in the room but was not. Staff helpful and well intentioned but this property feels it is managed by a property developer rather than a hospitality company. For the same price you can get much better service in more comfortable and modern rooms.', 'Not good breakfastInconvenient invoicingNot trendy interior vs priceSmelly working table', 'satisfy all of them', "It's a good Service Apartment.", 'Loved this place; spacious and convenient!', 'The location is good, right in cbd but i got bad experience when staying at Lancaster, reception at night shift is unprofessional, they let the security guy to check in for me, then they charged me deposit without holding function. When i entered to the room, furnitures look old and lights are white which is not preferable to me, after going out for drinking and back to the hotel i checked out right away and forgot my expensive sandals at there, i came back in the morning to check if my sandals still there and its gone, hotel support to keep the lost&found stuff in a few days in term of the guest come back to find it.', 'Great location but thats about it. The room was old and grubby. Hairs in the bathroom etc. The lifts are a pain, you can grow old waiting for them!!!Parking isnâ€™t free either. But the worst thing was that we were charged 5 USD when checking out because one of the flannels in the bathroom had make up on it!!!!', 'it was a pleasant stay. the staff is very helpful during the day. the room is clean, the kitchen is good to cook simple food, washing machine good to wash, but dryer not really working... and dont really have place to hang to dry... (but most place dryer always a issue, dont know why)...  anyway, all is good.', 'Stay was very enjoyable with very helpful and polite staff. Not the first time I have stayed at this hotel and will stay again. Food dinning score is not applicable. Only downside was construction work taking place next door which you could hear in morning from my room on the 11th floor.', "Great stay once again. I'm a business traveler, and I truly appreciate a Service Apartment located in a great part of town, with lots of restaurants, cafes, bars, and night spots located within walking distance. There's a truly fantastic little local cafe just a block away, with incredibly fresh mini-baguettes in the morning and a nice selection of breakfast choices. Great staff, too - friendly and helpful, and accommodating.", 'We were told that one of our 2 bedroom apartment was not ready due to some piping issues and given 2 studios instead. Requested for change of room but did not get it. Other than the small hipcups which we believe they can do better by upgrading us or discount, everything seems good.', "Lancaster was incredible value for money, in particular since we are a big group of 6 people in our family. Stayed in a 3 BR unit which had all the space and privacy we needed, with a fantastic view of Saigon River. Location was just next to all kinds of restaurants including Haagen Dazs which was my kids' favorite nightcap. Shops like Vincom, Parkson, Diamond and Union Square were within 5-10 mins walk away. We all had a fantastic relaxing vacation."]

My third stay here.', 'Great location very quite at night for sleeping but in the heart of resturants and bars', "Got an upgrade for free. Just on the side of  Bui Vein street, but won't hear much noise and you'll still get quality sleep at night.", 'Hotel is OK and good location. The staffs are very kind and helpful except the water heater malfunction.', 'Very clean excellent staff.  rj', 'Rooms infested with ants and cockroaches. Dank, dark and depressing. Man on reception rude and condescending. Donâ€™t waste your money or time here. Book elsewhere.', 'One of our group hit a few problems and the staff went out of their way to help, top work ğŸ‘', 'The staff in this hotel were extremely helpful and friendly.  They made sure that myself and my two friends were prioritized even at their own inconvenience to ensure we had a comfortable stay. Mr Tom was especially helpful to ensure I had a bucket of ice each night so that I could begin my night with a few pre drinks in my room.', 'Got put in a room with mold on the walls that smelt terribly musty. The staff were very helpful and offered us a different room. The different room also melt musty, but was fine once we aired it out. The staff were helpful and friendly, but the hotel needs a bit of work. Donâ€™t stay here if you need a soft bed.', "reception is very kind.\rFacility is little old.\rcompare with price its ok.\rit's clean.\rjust for sleep for cheap price it's good", 'Good place and nice hotel', "I won't go there EVER again.", "Value for the little money you pay for this small hotel. So cheap! Close to Buvien St and the bus stop. I'd stay again.", 'I would use this hotel again for a short duration ,the location is good and easy to access  all attreactions.It was a good fast check in.the room I had was a standard double ,but it was so tiny .the bathroom was minute and difficult to enter and shut the door..Therte was no kettle or water or shampoo ,this is the first hotel in Vietnam that has not provided these basic facilities ,thast i have visited.However the room was clean ,but very noisy during the night ,from outside ( late night drinkers etc )', 'tricky to find, but is a hidden gem', 'All are fair and will stay again', "The Saigon Amigo Hotel is well located in the heart of Saigon. You will need to go there walking though, as the hotel is located in a middle of a narrow alley. Our check-in occurred around midnight, as our flight landed one hour earlier from Japan.The other positive points are the friendly morning staff and the amenities that included a toothbrush. The elevator is new, clean and spacious. The price is good.I have to say that the access to enter the hotel was difficult, as a bunch of motorcycles lined up just at the entrance prevented us from getting in the hotel easily.As we had a late flight, we just bought some groceries/snacks at the nearest convenient stores, just a block away. We had bought noodle cups and went back to the hotel asking the night receptionist if we could have hot water for our noodles. It seemed to bother him, as he told us to come back the next day to have hot water! We insisted and he went to the kitchen. However, 20 seconds later he came back saying no hot water! I thought it wasn't difficult to boil hot waterâ€¦ Of course, we could have done that at the convenient store, but I didn't see myself carrying two noodle cups while avoiding getting hit by motorcycles and potentially burning myself.Anyway, I also found the blanket very small for two people, as it didn't cover my feet unto my shins. While the toothbrushes were a nice amenity, there wasn't any shampoo though.In conclusion, we will come back as it was an overall positive experience."]

Only downside was construction work taking place next door which you could hear in morning from my room on the 11th floor.', "Great stay once again. I'm a business traveler, and I truly appreciate a Service Apartment located in a great part of town, with lots of restaurants, cafes, bars, and night spots located within walking distance. There's a truly fantastic little local cafe just a block away, with incredibly fresh mini-baguettes in the morning and a nice selection of breakfast choices. Great staff, too - friendly and helpful, and accommodating.", 'We were told that one of our 2 bedroom apartment was not ready due to some piping issues and given 2 studios instead. Requested for change of room but did not get it. Other than the small hipcups which we believe they can do better by upgrading us or discount, everything seems good.', "Lancaster was incredible value for money, in particular since we are a big group of 6 people in our family. Stayed in a 3 BR unit which had all the space and privacy we needed, with a fantastic view of Saigon River. Location was just next to all kinds of restaurants including Haagen Dazs which was my kids' favorite nightcap. Shops like Vincom, Parkson, Diamond and Union Square were within 5-10 mins walk away. We all had a fantastic relaxing vacation."]

My third stay here.', 'Great location very quite at night for sleeping but in the heart of resturants and bars', "Got an upgrade for free. Just on the side of  Bui Vein street, but won't hear much noise and you'll still get quality sleep at night.", 'Hotel is OK and good location. The staffs are very kind and helpful except the water heater malfunction.', 'Very clean excellent staff.  rj', 'Rooms infested with ants and cockroaches. Dank, dark and depressing. Man on reception rude and condescending. Donâ€™t waste your money or time here. Book elsewhere.', 'One of our group hit a few problems and the staff went out of their way to help, top work ğŸ‘', 'The staff in this hotel were extremely helpful and friendly.  They made sure that myself and my two friends were prioritized even at their own inconvenience to ensure we had a comfortable stay. Mr Tom was especially helpful to ensure I had a bucket of ice each night so that I could begin my night with a few pre drinks in my room.', 'Got put in a room with mold on the walls that smelt terribly musty. The staff were very helpful and offered us a different room. The different room also melt musty, but was fine once we aired it out. The staff were helpful and friendly, but the hotel needs a bit of work. Donâ€™t stay here if you need a soft bed.', "reception is very kind.\rFacility is little old.\rcompare with price its ok.\rit's clean.\rjust for sleep for cheap price it's good", 'Good place and nice hotel', "I won't go there EVER again.", "Value for the little money you pay for this small hotel. So cheap! Close to Buvien St and the bus stop. I'd stay again.", 'I would use this hotel again for a short duration ,the location is good and easy to access  all attreactions.It was a good fast check in.the room I had was a standard double ,but it was so tiny .the bathroom was minute and difficult to enter and shut the door..Therte was no kettle or water or shampoo ,this is the first hotel in Vietnam that has not provided these basic facilities ,thast i have visited.However the room was clean ,but very noisy during the night ,from outside ( late night drinkers etc )', 'tricky to find, but is a hidden gem', 'All are fair and will stay again', "The Saigon Amigo Hotel is well located in the heart of Saigon. You will need to go there walking though, as the hotel is located in a middle of a narrow alley. Our check-in occurred around midnight, as our flight landed one hour earlier from Japan.The other positive points are the friendly morning staff and the amenities that included a toothbrush. The elevator is new, clean and spacious. The price is good.I have to say that the access to enter the hotel was difficult, as a bunch of motorcycles lined up just at the entrance prevented us from getting in the hotel easily.As we had a late flight, we just bought some groceries/snacks at the nearest convenient stores, just a block away. We had bought noodle cups and went back to the hotel asking the night receptionist if we could have hot water for our noodles. It seemed to bother him, as he told us to come back the next day to have hot water! We insisted and he went to the kitchen. However, 20 seconds later he came back saying no hot water! I thought it wasn't difficult to boil hot waterâ€¦ Of course, we could have done that at the convenient store, but I didn't see myself carrying two noodle cups while avoiding getting hit by motorcycles and potentially burning myself.Anyway, I also found the blanket very small for two people, as it didn't cover my feet unto my shins. While the toothbrushes were a nice amenity, there wasn't any shampoo though.In conclusion, we will come back as it was an overall positive experience."]

Do mÃ¬nh khÃ´ng quen vá»›i khÃ´ng gian chá»‰ 4 bá»©c tÆ°á»ng nÃªn ráº¥t nhá»©c Ä‘áº§u vÃ  cáº£m tháº¥y ráº¥t bÃ­.', 'Great location, just few minutes away from the Ben Tahn Market, surrounded by many restaurant and cafÃ©. The air-conditioning was superb and the room was very clean.  Definitely will coming back again when I visit to HCMC.', 'Pretty happy overall with this hotel. The rooms are comfy and spacious, although breakfast was pretty basic and there are no sun loungers on the roof pool, just chairs. Still, the price is fair, and the location is ideal.', 'Location is great - walking distance from Ben Thanh Market. Hotel staff is really helpful and room is clean. Overall - great value for money.', 'The hotel is really close to the central market and the night market. Itâ€™s a great location to move around. It also has a swimingpool in case you need it. Wifi is quite good and the breakfast has decent variety. One of the best things, the bath tub, which makes hydromassage.', 'Location was good, in the middle of everything. Breakfast were great, tne only cons were on the phone and when I come there to check out the room the staff tell me one thing and when I stayed there were good but when I checkout they charge me more money when they told me before that they wonâ€™t. I paid upfront at the hotel and When i checked out they make me pay more for 1 of the kid breakfast 1 day stay for an adult ( my brother in law were staying with his wife and his 2 kids) And I have to pay and that is sad because they dont fo what they told you!. So when you read the agoda ads for this hotel make sure you ask every little details or you will be charge more at the end!', 'Excellent location, the Front Office Manager was the best, great little pool on the top floor, amazing cable tv very clean and super comfortable bed and decent breakfast, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will book again next time, also round the corner from the Food Market where you can buy the most delicious food from a number of eateries which would be considered fine dining anywhere else in the world and very cheap!', 'Premium location as right in district 1 walking distance to all the historical part so very convenient.Very typical Vietnamese hotel in downtown of big cities size of the room was good, modern, simple and clean. Not noisy despite a main road a bit of traffic.Breakfast is average but fresh with all needed anyway plenty of options around that must be triedStaff is really nice, helpful, with a decent level of english. Small pool on the roof top to enjoy the view.Definitely a good value for money', 'I must share that the manager Tania made a difference to our great experience and stay in Joviale.She accommodated our change of rooms when we complained that the Housekeeping did not do a good job with the first room we were allocated to. She upgraded both our rooms to 603 and 604, which is more spacious, clean and put us side by side. She also helped us with booking an excursion to the Mekong Delta. Highly recommended.The breakfast selection is changed daily and assortment is good enough for our selection. The French toast and pho are to die for. You can also order your eggs in any style you  want.The location is a stone throw from Ben ThÃ nh market which we went 3 times!', 'Conveniently located one block behind Ben Thanh market.  Clean and well maintained hotel with good english speaking staff.  Our room was not ready when we arrived, however was served with welcome beverages while we waited.  Room was decent sized and clean, also equipped with safe deposit box for your valuables.  Hotel also provide airport transfers for a fee.  Overall, a good stay!', 'Strategic location just behind Ben Thanh market, few minutes walk to Saigon Square, Independence palace, city hall, Notre Dame Basilica and the backpacker street.  Take bus 109 from the airport, stop at Thanh Pho station 2 blocks from the hotel.  Pool is tiny, however the kids love it.  Room is clean and big.  Excellent Breakfast, different menu through out my stay.   Will definitely come back again, well done to all Joviale Hotel staff!!', 'Good location, hotel itself a bit oldfashioned and laminate parquet floor in room worn. In bathroom there is jacuzzi (!) , but it was so difficult to get off from it, shiny tile floor in bathroom was so slippery and even more when wet. Swimming pool in 9th floor was nice and clean but so small. Breakfast in hotel was good.Staff was very helpful and friendly and ready to help in any case.We dont know how often they used to make up the rooms, but our room was cleaned every second day, sometimes we wished to have more cleaning during 8 days there.A minus was the just begun construction site beside the hotel.  Even in the early morning a lot of bangs and bangs came into the room.', 'staff say my booking not confirmed n wait for 1 hour n still staff cannot help so i call to agoda n ask for help. staff  refuse to help. so i call to agoda  by my selfi will never back to this hotel n maybe worry book hotel from agoda again', 'the room is not clean and when i book online during my arrival they never fulfil my request of high floor room and send me to a level 2 was so noisy because of traffic. don;t think i will come to this hotel again', 'This is easily the worse hotel we had in Vietnam (among 5 others) and generally in Southeast Asia. Room is small, what they report as size includes the bathroom and WC, so its really much smaller. Pictures optimistically show light, none at all inside. Very noisy, not from outside, but from everything in the corridors, such bad quality. All night you hear the elevator. Cleaning bad. They needed reminder that if shampoo has been used, a new one actually is a good idea. Staff screams in the hallways from 7 a.m., what do they care about sleeping tourists...Swimming pool on the roof might have been cleaned last year. Now yellow and green water, ready to develop new forms of life. Breakfast: when fruit finished by crowd, bringing new not an easy achievemnt. Keeping your passport at reception, (because you are a potencial criminal, who will steall stuff from the hotel?). Give you only one electronic card as a key, even when you are 2 people and may not be siamese twins. Location: very good.']

It gets cleaned daily but it also depends on your roommates.- Nice rooftop chill area.Cons- Small locker. You can only fit small personal stuff. I prefer to place my big backpack inside.- Bathroom is in the room. So you can sometimes here people do there business. Also the door is very squeeky.- Beds shake a bit when somebody tries to climb on the top bed.']

You also can find a lot of restaurants around the hotel. The room is big enough for two, with strong hot water, cool AC. Their TV channel also complete enough with TV cable channel. The bed a bit old fashioned, better if they can change it to the modern oneBreakfast was okay. Wifi also very good. The staff also very friendly and helpful. But if they can have a quicker checkout process, I think it would be better. They changed my room but it is still the same, there's an ashtray and smells cigarette smoke. If you are a non-smoker, this hotel is definitely not a good idea to book into.", 'We got free upgrade to deluxe room as we requested for two single beds in Superior room which was not available at the time of check-in. Staff was friendly, cooperative and quite accommodating (just need to improve their English communication skills). They were flexible for early check-in and late check-out. They also arranged reliable taxi cabs whenever we requested and were always eager to greet us. Breakfast was quite reasonable and got pretty much variety. Only minus point which I observed during my whole stay was location as it was bit far from Ben Than market (around 20 mins walk) but it was still manageable since its in Japanese district where you got alot of options for restaurants and Ho Chin Minh square is also very near. Other things the Hotel can improve are as follows:i) Give better quality of soaps (minimum two) to maintain the hygienic condition;ii) Provide iron board either in room or at some central place in hotel. They do have laundry service which provide iron facility but rates need to be further discounted.Overall very happy with the stay, would definitely stay again!', 'reason price, good laction with le tanh ton, terrible staff', 'clean and cozy']

He hinted that I should tip him for showing me to my room. I didn't have any luggage and I had been to quite a few hotels.  I know how things work. There was also no parking at the hotel so it was inconvenient for guests with bikes. The only great thing about the hotel is its breakfast. Varied and delicious.", 'The breakfast is good, changing food every day and the room is clean also. But the hot water is not stable after 10 pm.', 'I booked this hotel very last minute and very happy that they had room available. Check-in staff very friendly, helpful.Great location as Circle K nearby and good coffee place on doorstep that does varied food menu.Less than 5mins to Ben Thanh market and agencies to book day trips outside HCM.Bed was very comfortable, very quiet.Shower had continuous hot water ... very relaxing. good choice of cable channels.Provided free bottles of water daily. There is a fridge and in-room safe.', 'Checkin:Staff very friendly and checkin process very fast. We reported issue with the aircon and was resolved quickly. Although temp set to lowest 18c, it still felt like 24c, took a while for it to kick in. Room is spacious, very comfy bed. good selection on cable tv, wifi very good.Bathroom - they provide toiletries, shampoo and shower gel. There was no hairdryer in room but was able to grab from a vacant room on same floor.Check out:We asked for a late checkout as we booked for 5dys and they said it was fine with no issues.Very speedy and efficient.Breakfast: Was incl in the price but did not try it.Location:5mins walk from Ben Thanh market. lots of foodie places nearby and even on your doorstep. And of course, there is Circle K if you need to buy snacks/toiletries/drinks.Negative:The aircon not that powerful. at times hard to sleep during the night.There is only one lift which is very slow but this is normal in Vietnam.']

I travel on bicycle through SE Asia and there was indeed a place for my bike with a guard 24x7. The breakfast is decent.', "If those criteria you are looking for, you can't go wrong with this hotel.Regarding the price, it is not among the cheapest hotels near Ben Thanh and Pham Ngu Lao street.Also, it is a bit far if you want to go for night life at Bui Vien and find good food at Pham Ngu Lao street.", 'Very impress with Dinh Phat hotel, since the location is really strategic.,, close to anything you need such as local - international restaurants, minimart, Ben Thanh Market where a bargain shopping and local food stalls are available, Pham Ngu Lao area where vibrant nightlife is, many sightseeing places are only 15-20 minutes by foot (or call taxi for just only 5 minutes drive), many tour agency are surrounded and local cafe for coffee relaxing (is one of activities that you should not miss in Ho Chi Minh City) .,, Hotel is really clean and comfortable .,, Staffs are very nice; friendly, informative and attentive. Wifi is very fast and trustworthy .,, My booking has not include breakfast or any hotel catering .,, So, no comment for that .,, Overall of my 3 nights here was very impress and valuable :)']

KhÃ´ng bao giá» quay trá»Ÿ láº¡i.', 'KhÃ´ng thÃ­ch', "Just a 10mins walk from the airport and we had no trouble searching for it (provided you have a google map). I love how they provide free airport transfer as we had an early flight, saving us the trouble to look for taxi. Would recommend only if you're having a long layover in HCM and need a decent place to sleep in.", 'I needed to rest between flights, as sleeping in airports is not often any fun. Love the free pick up service, made things very easy when I arrived late at night and extremely exhausted. Just needed to have a hot shower and get some rest before the next leg of my journey, and this fit the bill perfectly. Unfortunately, I did not get to try their breakfast, as had to leave again very early the next morning, but at least I was rested by then.', 'They provide free airport transfer and also you may store your luggage at the hotel for a small fee if you plan to travel out of HCMC.', 'Very clean and comfortable airport hotel.  Airport about a 10-15 minute walk from hotel, though hotel does provide a complementary shuttle to the airport.  Plenty of restaurants nearby.', "Throughout the pre-arrival communication, all seems good and relatively positive despite having read some bad reviews.. Airport transfers were great.. drivers and front desk were friendly and nice... SHOCK OF MY START OF TRAVEL... when I open the door to my room.. it was actually OCCUPIED!!! GOSH!!! Apparently one of the staff/member had utilised the room and in bed sleeping.. Proceeded back to front desk to request for change of room, instead of changing, the staff had vacated the room for me WITHOUT SHEETS BEING CHANGED!!! As I'll be departing early, merely a 4-5hrs in bed/room, I had given in.. well, at least the bed was tidied.. Just when I thought things will get better.. SPOTTED A GECKO IN THE ROOM! GROSS TO THE MAX! At this point, really regretted not paying just wee bit more for a more reputable sleep... All through the night, the toilet ceiling board was dripping (or rather drizzling) away.. noisy.. mouldy...No hot water for shower, imagine a cold shower at 5am...", 'The good: Location. Friendly staff.  Free airport pick up. Construction design (marble tiles in bathroom; walls newly painted; new furniture) The very bad: Hair on bed, pillows, floor, and clumps of hair in shower drain.  Pillow cases are shams, giving thought that they are not changed regularly.  Spoon for coffee was still dirty from previous use.  Rug by bathroom stained and dirty. If they hire a better cleaning staff, this place would have potential.', "We stayed here for a stopover night at SGN airport. It is about a 10 min walk from the domestic terminal. The staff were very nice, it was good value and it was fine for a short stop.The towels weren't clean, and the bed cloths are questionable - no duvet or sheets, so not sure how much they wash them. The bed was super hard and squeaky, but we slept ok. The room was big with a huge fridge/freezer and bathroom was basic but fine. Would recommend for a stopover night, but not sure it would be super good long term"]

hotel name: Cafe nhÃ  Nguyá»…n hÆ°á»›ng nhÃ  thá» há»“ng (The Nguyens Cafe Pink Church View)
address: 64 Dinh Cong Trang Street, Quáº­n 1, Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh, Viá»‡t Nam
reviews: ['Quay láº¡i vÃ  Ä‘c Æ°u tiÃªn nÃ¢ng háº¡ng phÃ²ng.QuÃ¡ tá»‘t vÃ¬ giÃ¡ há»£p lÃ½ vÃ  gáº§n cÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹a Ä‘iá»ƒm cáº§n tá»›i.', 'Váº«n tá»‘t nhÆ° nhá»¯ng láº§n Ä‘áº·t trÆ°Æ¡c .', 'ÄÃ£ quay láº¡i vÃ  tiáº¿p tá»¥c book phÃ²ng táº¡i khÃ¡ch sáº¡n. Táº¥t cáº£ váº«n Ok .', 'PhÃ²ng Ä‘áº¹p, yÃªn tÄ©nh vÃ  sáº¡ch sáº½,. Vá»‹ trÃ­ trung tÃ¢m. NhÃ¢n viÃªn thÃ¢n thiá»‡n. GiÃ¡ cáº£ dá»… chá»‹u. Sáº½ quay láº¡i khi cÃ³ dá»‹p .', 'This place is not so far from the city centre. Very friendly staff. The room I was staying in was facing the street but it was pretty quiet at night due to double glazed windows. It has a cafe downstairs and the serve pretty good coffee, both Viet and Western style.They also serve a very simple but delicious noodle soup.There are few local restaurants in walking distance which makes this place perfect.', 'Nice place to stay for a few days. I stayed for one day while I was looking for a new flat. The rooms are relatively new, very clean and easy check in and check out. Location is easy walking distance to shops and cafes. Big surprise was the  afternoon I checked in, I walked downstairs to where the cafe is and asked the hostess if she sold food, she said no, but since she was cooking, offered me dinner: chicken, rice, vegetables, very tasty and very hospitable!', 'Good coffee.  Good clean room, nice view of Pink Church.  All of the little details mentioned by others about hot water, air con, lack of elevator have been addressed.  Thereâ€™s an elevator.  Hot water fine, Air Con great.  Great local food nearby, you need to travel to get to the expat hangouts.  Lovely owners, there when needed and gone when not.  Daily cleaning is NOT automatic, but no trouble if you ask.I will be back.', 'After having problems with our other accommodations, we decided upon staying at The Nguyenâ€™s Cafe. It was a great choice and we had a wonderful stay. The room was modern and very clean, with all of the basic amenities youâ€™d need in a place. The location is in the corner of district 1 a bit further from main tourist attractions but still close. The service was outstanding, the owner of the place Ben is very helpful and friendly. He gave us some great recommendations and was very responsive to any comments or concerns. We didnâ€™t ask him too many questions but you can tell that he really goes above and beyond for his guests. I would highly recommend this place to anyone coming to Saigon!', 'It feels like home when I stayed in The Nguyens DCT. Room is extremely clean, and spacious. The building is located in a quiet street, near by local spots, where I can explore numerous of food, shopping stores... Highly recommended!', 'Cafe area is very good to relax and located good place for park and church', 'Room was clean. Staff were nice. A bit of a walk to get to places. Bed was very comfy in our room! English tv channels.', 'This  is more like a  private room than a hotelroom.  Arrived at 11 pm and because of roadwork, rain and closed shops, diificult to find in a dark alley.  But having found the doorbell all changed for the best. The owner,  an australian born vietnamese,  made us comfortable immediately. Excellent room without noise but still in the centre at the pink church. You get your own entry card for the gate and at daytime all the shops are open. From here we made several trips. We had a great stad for 2 nights.', "clean and clear room , nice and helpful staffs !!! \rreally like the bacony in the cozy morning near by the church, so peacefull .\rthere is a big market cloesed . for 5' to break out the hungry time as well. lets go for some owesome street foods, guys lol.", 'I recommend this place for your vacay in Saigon. Clean room, lots of food stalls around the area and very accomodating and friendly staffs. Sue (the owner) gave us some recommendations on where to go and where to eat. Kudos to Mai (staff) who even gave us a gift before we left.', 'The owner WhatsApp me a day before our arrival at HCM by telling us there is a renovation on the ground floor of the motel we booked. She proposed us 2 minutes walk nearby motel which is also own by her.  Pros: Staff is very helpful and speak Cantonese. Quiet motel inside a narrow street. Water pressure is strong with hot water. Nearby with the famous food stall always busy which is more secure walking back at night.Cons: Washroom with stain at the door. Bedsheet and sofa bed with stain. No breakfast provided. The balcony cannot be used as it filled with dust. No lift at the motel has to carry your luggage to the room.', "This place is immaculately clean and has a mattress that is actually comfortable and quality bedding. It was quiet, there was a lift, and the mini bar was a full fridge and freezer (with free water, too). Location is near a non-touristy market (can't buy little gifts etc) and lots of shops and some restaurants. Unlike staying right in the center it feels a lot less touristy and I dare say better. Uber or the bus or a 20min walk takes you where you need to go for the touristy stuff.Downsides: really slow internet, no hot water in shower, staff are friendly but don't speak English and check in and out is slow (so give yourself time).Overall, I recommend this place - if I come back to HCMC I will stay here again.Downsides", "The hotel and rooms felt like a big house with elevator. Room is roomy, the building is new, the cleanliness is very good. Would suggest this if you don't need to be in the middle of the city; therefore could save some budget and desire a really nice bedroom.", "Gorgeous accommodations! Just above a famous little coffee shop also owned by the Nguyens. Couldn't have been cleaner, and the bed was one of the comfiest we slept in while in Vietnam. This place is brand spanking new, which is why there aren't many reviews, search Agoda for 'The Nguyens Cafe NHC', which is right next door and is their first property to get a good idea of the great people running the hotel.Absolutely beautiful room and balcony, great neighbourhood, helpful family, excellent coffee, would recommend to anyone!", 'Good private house with well decorated room.', 'Private room with balcony i felt i was in my own home, I came and went without any hindrance, loved it.']

address: 2/17 Há»“ng HÃ , PhÆ°á»ng 2, Quáº­n TÃ¢n BÃ¬nh, Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh, Viá»‡t Nam, 700000
reviews: ['Ok', 'The hotel is very very close to the airport. The room comes with a mini kitchen area and a small balcony. Its only about 5 mins walk from the international airport if you are able to cut across the road, if not you will need to take a slight detour with will be about 10 mins. There is a mall near the hotel.The breakfast is at the cafe beside the hotel, the staff will bring you over.Place is clean and spacious. Good if you need a place to rest before going to the airport.', 'small hotel but cozy with big rooms, located just 5-10 mins walk from the airport. Located next to Ibis Airport hotel (which you see directly from the airport). Nice staff speaking fair English. We had big suitcases so the receptionist called us taxi. It was about 25.000 as per taxi meter but we were asked to pay 50.000.  local breakfast came in our plan with coffee / tea which was ok.', 'Great location as just across a busy road from the airport. Surpsingly quiet too. Fine for one night. Can catch 152 bus to central market for 5000 dong compared to taxi of 150000! 30 minutes on the airconditioned bus was quick and trouble free. Do it!', 'The room and the bed is very cozy and comfortable.  It can walk from the airport to this hotel  which is really nice.', 'Close to the airport,10mins walk from airport. Next to Ibis hotel. Clean and spacious room. Very friendly and helpful staffs. I stayed here because I had connecting flight,6hrs so I decided to stay for short period but I really appreciated their service and they let me checked in earlier. But if hotel provides airport transfer service it would be nice because I am not comfortable with local taxi in Saigon.', 'I needed to leave HCMC at 2:30am so booked into Doha hotel for 8 hours. The hotel was very clean and had all the amenities I needed - AC, wifi, shower and close to a mall. My only suggestion is to get a softer bed. It felt like a rock. The front desk were excellent and spoke good English.', 'I walked cross the parking lot at International arrival then go out from airport via parking entrance then cross the road 2x (be careful of crossing road in Vietnam), the hotel sign on ride side, go into small road then you will see this hotel.The staff quiet good English speaking. Room very big. Breakfast for selected menu only.Amazingly the owner drop me back to the airport by his own SUV car and free of charge.', 'We enjoyed our stay here a lot, but sadly we stayed here for a very short time. We were very surprised by the high standards, customer service, the quality of the room. And in the end of our stay they gave us a free ride to the airport, I recommend a lot', "We were able to walk to the hotel from the airport in about 10 minutes, which was great. And the elevator made it easy to get up to our room. Our quadruple room had only 3 pillows (okay for the 3 of us) but only 2 towels. The beds were the hardest we found in our 2 weeks in Vietnam, and came with only a bottom fitted sheet and a strange top layer that was sort of like a scratchy blanket - no top sheets on either bed. Hotel seems new and clean, and shower was good (though did NOT have any shower divider as was pictured on the site, so the whole bathroom got wet).  We managed for one night, but didn't sleep well.", 'Nice place for a transfer, well equipped with good facilities, the service is fine. Value for this price!', 'Everything was good, exept reception desk manager.', 'it was a short stay over since our flight was at midnight. the hotel was relatively clean and the staff were friendly. surrounding area had really good food.', 'If you want overnight, this hotel is is good, because you can walk to the hotel and the food around there is pretty good', 'A new looking hotel only let down by very thin walls and super noisy tenants.Location wise is great and the price value is really unbeatable compared to similar offerings nearby.', 'The hotel is locates pretty close to the airport. It feels like recently renovated. Everything is clean and tidy. Good place to stay over a night if you have an early flight the next day.', 'Great location if you have an early flight from HCM. Clean and OK breakfast. Few minutes walk to airport.We booke d thru Agoda a room with twin beads and we got a reply that our "special reguest" went was confirmed and OK. But when we came to the hotel they only had room with one double bed. That was no problem but still.', 'The rooms are clean but dated and the breakfast options for people who prefer a european breakfast are limmited (butter was rancid, no toaster, only a fried egg and some fruit available) and had to pay for the airport transfer from the hotel to the airport. Staff was very friendly', "We needed something within walking distance from the airport for a late night flight and were pleased with our stay at Doha.Walk straight through the airport parking lot and you'll see the names of hotels in lights - Doha being one of them. From there, carefully cross the street and you'll see a sign pointing you into the alley where Doha is located.The room was clean and well put together. We appreciated having a small kitchen with a sink and kettle to use. The free rooftop buffet breakfast was a great start to the day. Pho, coffee, eggs, and the best dragon fruit I've ever had.", 'Good enough.Breakfast in the other building (100m from hotel), with good view to the airport and surrounding area.']

Tuy nhiÃªn, trang thiáº¿t bá»‹ trong phÃ²ng khÃ´ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c má»›i.', 'Ok', 'CÃ¡c dá»‹ch vá»¥ tÆ°Æ¡ng Ä‘á»‘i tá»‘t, giÃ¡ cáº£ há»£p lÃ½, nhÆ°ng truyá»n hÃ¬nh cÃ¡p cháº¥t lÆ°á»£ng kÃ©m xem ti vi ráº¥t nhiá»…u.', 'PhÃ²ng chÆ°a sáº¡ch, yÃªu cáº§u lÃ m phÃ²ng thÃ¬ khÃ´ng tháº¥y Ä‘Ã¡p á»©ng, nhÃ¢n thiá»‡n nhÆ°ng phá»¥c vá»¥ cÃ²n chÆ°a tá»‘t.', 'KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n vá»›i má»©c giÃ¡ trung bÃ¬nh, nÃ³i chung lÃ  Ä‘Æ°á»£c, bá»¯a sÃ¡ng cáº§n phong phÃº hÆ¡n.', 'Would like to give the thumb up for the front desk staff especially Ms Linh Tran with a smile to welcome us while we arrived late due to flight delay.
