address: 283/21 Ä‘Æ°á»ng Pháº¡m NgÅ© LÃ£o, Quáº­n 1, Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh, Viá»‡t Nam, 70000
reviews: ['KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n sáº¡ch sáº½, vá»‹ trÃ­ trung tÃ¢m thÃ nh phá»‘ nÃªn dá»… dÃ ng mua sáº¯m, Äƒn uá»‘ng vÃ  tiáº¿t kiá»‡m chi phÃ­ Ä‘i láº¡i. NhÃ¢n viÃªn thÃ¢n thiá»‡n, vui váº». Bá»¯a sÃ¡ng Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n nhÆ°ng cháº¥p nháº­n Ä‘Æ°á»£c vá»›i giÃ¡ phÃ²ng ksan. KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n nhá» nÃªn khÃ´ng cÃ³ thang mÃ¡y, khÃ¡ch sáº¡n náº±m trong háº»m nhá», xe taxi cÃ³ thá»ƒ Ä‘i vÃ o nhÆ°ng tá»‘t hÆ¡n váº«n lÃ  Ä‘Ã³n xe á»Ÿ ngoÃ i háº»m.', 'Nhan vien vui ve, nhiet tinh, giÃ¡ cáº£ há»£p lÃ½, dich vu tot', 'Ä‚n sÃ¡ng mÃ¬ Äƒn liá»n thÃ¬ nh nÆ¡i cÃ³, nhÆ°ng phá»Ÿ Äƒn liá»n thÃ¬ hÆ¡i báº¥t ngá», thÃ  ko Ä‘Æ°a vÃ o thá»±c Ä‘Æ¡n cÃ²n hÆ¡n! PhÃ²ng Äƒn bÃ© cho 6 ng, nÃ³ng vÃ  muá»—i', "I spent 6 nights here and thoroughly enjoyed it.  It's located right next to backpackers street but it is tucked up a little lane so it is surprisingly quiet.  The staff are fantastic. Very welcoming, courteous and extremely helpful. The rooms are a decent size, the bed very comfortable, the aircon worked well and the tv had plenty of channels in English. The rooms are cleaned every day and the towels were also changed daily. The hotel also does a laundry service should you need anything washed. I would highly recommend this place to anyone considering staying in HCM. I will certainly be back.", 'Staff are really nice and honest. Buy your sim  card and tours through them. Its in an alleyway (safe atnight) a few mins walk from backpacker st yet quiet for sleep. The rooms have fan, aircon, safe, fridge etc.  Be prepared for stairs if your room is upstairs.  I would stay again.  Good value as breakfast included. The staff very helpful and some speak English so was easy for me.', 'For the cost, it was quite good. Staff was really friendly and always happy to help. I arrived late (very late - missed my flight and arrived the next day at 7am) and they happily checked me in and offered me some breakfast. Great location. Overall a good experience', 'The hotel is located in the main backpacker quarter. Itâ€™s clean with air-conditioned rooms (our machine broke but was quickly fixed). The manager has great recommendations (he pointed us towards a delicious bÃ¡nh mÃ¬ stall) and speaks good English. Breakfast is basic but nice. We would recommend!', 'The location very good and staff very good. Facilities a little bit old, especially the WiFi every floor use as different standalone, and difficult to use at night.  If can upgarde Will much better', 'The location of the hotel is accessible. There is an English-speaking staff who assisted us. The hotel offers tour and transport arrangements which is quite cheaper than online. The room and breakfast are also good.', 'A very warm welcome with helpful local information.  I had an early morning flight and I was still seen out with some fruit to eat on my journey as I would miss breakfast by a few hours. The bed was very comfortable. Air conditioning worked well plus an extra fan provided good white noise for my early evening.  The location is convenient being one block off the major street so its quieter but quick to get a taxi or grab.  Had very good pho a few blocks away too.   If you have lots of luggage ask for a lower floor to make it an easier climb. Would stay again', 'This is close to the backpacker area but not so loud and dirty. I even extended my stay. Staff was helpful. Itâ€™s easy to get your laundry done here and they made it smell so nice!', "Rooms are straightforward, clean, stocked with shampoo, soap, toothbrushes, and tissues (a plus in my book). My room had decent air conditioning and wi-fi proximity. Prices through Agoda are likely better than on other services, and the hotel will accept Vietnamese Dong (VND) or US Dollars, which is a lovely feature if you have not exchanged currencies yet. Great location, but quieter than the backpacker hell-hole called Bui Vien Street. On the downside, there is no elevator, so if you are above the 2nd floor, you will get a dose of exercise. Also, the hotel offers motorbike rentals for 150,000 VND per day, but they insist on keeping the passport or leaving a high-amount deposit. This is an issue for many foreigners who need their passports during the day, such as obtaining legitimate SIM cards or visiting embassies in town. Other hotels will let you keep your passport as they already have a copy of your passport and aren't as paranoid. Breakfast is decent and provided, and overall this is a good value.", 'I was really enjoyed my stay at ngoc linh, the staff performance was very attentive, they even booked me a bus ticket soon after I checking in, very supportive, the hotel was small but clean, room and bathroom also.  Their location is within a walking distance to all sightseing around ben tanh market, you can just walk to reunification museum, saigon sky deck, notre dame cathedral of saigon, and also local eatery around hotel, even the limousine bus such as mekong express stop just across the street outside this hotel.Would definitely stay at ngoc linh if I come visit saigon again, highly recommended for budget traveller One minor complaint is ngoc linh not provide a smoking room, so it was rather exhausted to back and forth 4th floor to 1st floor just to smoking', 'This was a nice hotel. Close to the main party area of Bui Vien/Pham Ngu Lau and the all the major attractions of District 1. The only negative of my stay was the large bed I requested was two single beds pushed together (which would have been fine except the matresses were different heights). I would stay here again.', "Room was clean, staff friendly, location v central. It's only a street away from the busy backpacker street, but surprisingly quiet. RoomIsn't large but reflect location. Bed was hard, but pretty much all beds are hard in Vietnam!", "Where it could feasibly fall down in its maintenance, it's more than made up for in the sweetness and helpfulness of the staff.  Nhu literally walked me to my bus several blocks away and waited outside in the noonday heat until I was comfortably seated on the bus. It's that kind of beyond-the-call-of-duty courteousness that I appreciate.  Both she and her business partner are so very welcoming, one feels so extraordinarily at home here. I love the feeling they create, even, at the time of arriving. If you should stay here, say 'hi' to them from me.", 'Location was perfect.ğŸ¤— Excellent staff -arranged our tour and transpo to airport, proactively offered in transferring us to lower room and always there to help when we have questions about the place. Will definitely come back here soon.ğŸ˜€', 'The hotel itself  is in a great location. Tucked away in the backpackers alley. Makes for a quite stay (request top floor). They only thing is you have to hike it up everytime but you get your daily workout.', "Pros: access to a computer, hotel has decent breakfast, employees are really nice, bed was clean. Guest friendly.Cons: ants appeared everywhere on my last day in the bathroom around the sink, no elevator. Annoying to climb the stairs. And there's a kid crying or yelling every morning that woke up everyone around 7:30am", "This is an awesome hotel! It's right in the middle of the backpacker scene but also walking distance to all the major attractions like the War Remnants Museum. Our room was clean and very well air conditioned. Staff were great always happy to help out and point us in the right direction. We even got our first night refunded even though it was our mistake that we didnt stay the night"]

address: 185 -187 LÃª ThÃ¡nh TÃ´n Quáº­n 1, Quáº­n 1, Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh, Viá»‡t Nam, 70000
reviews: ['Pros: have a large room and bathroom, location near to ben thanh market, around have the circle k mart, restaurant also.Cons: the prices is higher abit but no free bottled water, charges each bottle vnd 20k, so expensive on it. U can get it cheaper at K mart. Coz the water put inside refrigerator , on the first night we stayed we thoughts its free, but when check out time just only know its charges us money, not free. So after we back to stay 2 nights we knew already we just bought the water at K mart.', "Good hotel for family. I'am always stayed at this hotel since when i came to vietnam (ho chi min city)..Just walking to Choo Ben Than Market and Malaysian street.  Totaly this hotel comfortable and staff always helpful. Recommended hotel", 'The staffs are very friendly and helpful. Although it is quite noisy during the day, it is quite during the night. Room condition is very good. Also quite near to Malaysian Street and easy to find halal food.', 'Pros. Excellent location.  Near to Ben Thanh , night markets. Walking  distance to Takashimaya and other shopping centres. Lots of restaurants, cafes and street food around. Friendly staff. Daily room cleaning.Cons Bring your own shampoo and shower gel as hotel does not provide.', "Ideal location as Ben Thanh is just down the block. Away from the hustle and bustle of the market but still noisy in the streets (city never sleeps). Staff were super nice and helpful. We had to ask for more towels multiple times and I wish water as provided but for the price and location, it was a good experience and I'd book again.", "Checked in was fast and efficient. Hotel room and toilet were spacious. Our family consist of five adults and after we checked in and settled down, we were told to pay extra USD5/day for extra one pax. We didn't mind paying since everything looks great and clean. We were on level 6 and WiFi wasn't stable. However, one can use wifi on different levels with the same password. TV cable with Fox movie, HBO and many more were our entertainment. Staff were helpful and service was good. Balcony with the street view was nice. Hotel is a few step away from Ben thanh market and next to it, there is a family mart. Hotel provided good cheap massage service which I enjoyed it very much. Overall, we had a great stay and thumbs up for a budget hotel.", 'This was our first experience at this hotel & we liked it very much. We will return in the future to the hotel as it is nearby Ben-Than & just a short walk away. The room is quite specious even for 4 people.', 'Love this place close to everywhere and everything you need like eating places, nightlife spots and even good massages. The pricing for the room is amazingly afforable but the only thing missing is a safe where we can store valuables  and passport.', 'My husband & I enjoyed our stay so much, though at first, we only got our room at 5.30pm (waited for like 2 hours) but they gave us a very nice big room for two. The room was clean, no fouls odor, the bathroom was clean, surrounding not noisy. We had the view of other buildings but it was a nice scene.Overall I paid for what I got...its worthit & the area is safe too...', 'The hotel is strategically situated. It is within short walking distant to shops and halal food restaurants. Tourist guide and tour packages is just next door and was a real bargain with experienced personnels. The hotel staffs was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. I would certainly recommend this hotel to would be tourist.', "It was great.  So close to the Ben T. Market and the room's AC was super strong.  That really is a good thing in Vietnam's May weather.  Cools down the room within 5 mins.  Toilet was also Super Clean.  Everything looks new...", 'Information at agoda this hotel children 0-10years free to stay if not add extra bed.. But when i came at the hotel, the staff at the counter told me children 0-6years stay for free..7years must pay more 5usd/VND 200k.. So i was charged vnd 200k..So far  the rooms comfortable & clean..', 'Pros: good location, near to Ben thanh market, the room and bath room is big.Cons: no provide free bottled mineral water, each bottle charge VND 20k', 'kepada yang plan nak shopping area ben than market,ini adalah pilihan yang tepat kerana anda boleh jalan kaki sahaja kerana ia terletak di satu blok hadapan, begitu juga ben thant night market dan Malay Street .', 'The centre of old Sai Gon, now Ho Chi Minh City, is a short walk away, Ben Thanh markets are around the corner, good street food is every where and so is western fare if you prefer... and all for just over $40per night... and considering I was only there to sleep, what else would you want?', 'The location is just beside the popular Ben Thanh Market and night market.The family room is big and has balcony.Easy to get halal food at Malaysian street.There are wifi network in each room but sometimes the connection is very slow.', 'The best thing about this hotel is the location. Just walking distance to major attractions. Clean room. Very friendly and helpful staff. Value for money. Not many facility or food for breakfast but not a big problem.', 'The room was very run down n toilet was meh..aircon was noisy n only hot air came out...furnitures was also run down..very disappointed!..not recommending it to anyone..will never go back there again..', 'All the complaints that I read about other hotels are not found in this hotel. Basic hotel facilities even toothbrush were provided. Towels were changed daily. I was not moved to other hotels. Water pressure was great - just the hot water took sometimes in the morning and late evening. 50++ tv channels with around 7 English channels....', "Generous sized family room, good selection of TV channels (english channels available). But the room is getting worn, we suspect the waterproofing in the shower is a little faulty as the floor always got wet after a shower despite using the curtain. The cleaning service is a bit unpredictable (they skipped us one day, bedsheets arent changed even though we stayed for a week) and laundry is quite expensive. Convenient location although a bit noisy as facing a major road, on the plus side it's very easy to find. Next to two convenient stores and several eateries. Walking distance to Ben Thanh market and halal restaurants.Staff are friendly and helpful enough. there is a PC downstairs for usage and wifi is quite fast."]

address: 283/21 Ä‘Æ°á»ng Pháº¡m NgÅ© LÃ£o, Quáº­n 1, Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh, Viá»‡t Nam, 70000
reviews: ['KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n sáº¡ch sáº½, vá»‹ trÃ­ trung tÃ¢m thÃ nh phá»‘ nÃªn dá»… dÃ ng mua sáº¯m, Äƒn uá»‘ng vÃ  tiáº¿t kiá»‡m chi phÃ­ Ä‘i láº¡i. NhÃ¢n viÃªn thÃ¢n thiá»‡n, vui váº». Bá»¯a sÃ¡ng Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n nhÆ°ng cháº¥p nháº­n Ä‘Æ°á»£c vá»›i giÃ¡ phÃ²ng ksan. KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n nhá» nÃªn khÃ´ng cÃ³ thang mÃ¡y, khÃ¡ch sáº¡n náº±m trong háº»m nhá», xe taxi cÃ³ thá»ƒ Ä‘i vÃ o nhÆ°ng tá»‘t hÆ¡n váº«n lÃ  Ä‘Ã³n xe á»Ÿ ngoÃ i háº»m.', 'Nhan vien vui ve, nhiet tinh, giÃ¡ cáº£ há»£p lÃ½, dich vu tot', 'Ä‚n sÃ¡ng mÃ¬ Äƒn liá»n thÃ¬ nh nÆ¡i cÃ³, nhÆ°ng phá»Ÿ Äƒn liá»n thÃ¬ hÆ¡i báº¥t ngá», thÃ  ko Ä‘Æ°a vÃ o thá»±c Ä‘Æ¡n cÃ²n hÆ¡n! PhÃ²ng Äƒn bÃ© cho 6 ng, nÃ³ng vÃ  muá»—i', "I spent 6 nights here and thoroughly enjoyed it.  It's located right next to backpackers street but it is tucked up a little lane so it is surprisingly quiet.  The staff are fantastic. Very welcoming, courteous and extremely helpful. The rooms are a decent size, the bed very comfortable, the aircon worked well and the tv had plenty of channels in English. The rooms are cleaned every day and the towels were also changed daily. The hotel also does a laundry service should you need anything washed. I would highly recommend this place to anyone considering staying in HCM. I will certainly be back.", 'Staff are really nice and honest. Buy your sim  card and tours through them. Its in an alleyway (safe atnight) a few mins walk from backpacker st yet quiet for sleep. The rooms have fan, aircon, safe, fridge etc.  Be prepared for stairs if your room is upstairs.  I would stay again.  Good value as breakfast included. The staff very helpful and some speak English so was easy for me.', 'For the cost, it was quite good. Staff was really friendly and always happy to help. I arrived late (very late - missed my flight and arrived the next day at 7am) and they happily checked me in and offered me some breakfast. Great location. Overall a good experience', 'The hotel is located in the main backpacker quarter. Itâ€™s clean with air-conditioned rooms (our machine broke but was quickly fixed). The manager has great recommendations (he pointed us towards a delicious bÃ¡nh mÃ¬ stall) and speaks good English. Breakfast is basic but nice. We would recommend!', 'The location very good and staff very good. Facilities a little bit old, especially the WiFi every floor use as different standalone, and difficult to use at night.  If can upgarde Will much better', 'The location of the hotel is accessible. There is an English-speaking staff who assisted us. The hotel offers tour and transport arrangements which is quite cheaper than online. The room and breakfast are also good.', 'A very warm welcome with helpful local information.  I had an early morning flight and I was still seen out with some fruit to eat on my journey as I would miss breakfast by a few hours. The bed was very comfortable. Air conditioning worked well plus an extra fan provided good white noise for my early evening.  The location is convenient being one block off the major street so its quieter but quick to get a taxi or grab.  Had very good pho a few blocks away too.   If you have lots of luggage ask for a lower floor to make it an easier climb. Would stay again', 'This is close to the backpacker area but not so loud and dirty. I even extended my stay. Staff was helpful. Itâ€™s easy to get your laundry done here and they made it smell so nice!', "Rooms are straightforward, clean, stocked with shampoo, soap, toothbrushes, and tissues (a plus in my book). My room had decent air conditioning and wi-fi proximity. Prices through Agoda are likely better than on other services, and the hotel will accept Vietnamese Dong (VND) or US Dollars, which is a lovely feature if you have not exchanged currencies yet. Great location, but quieter than the backpacker hell-hole called Bui Vien Street. On the downside, there is no elevator, so if you are above the 2nd floor, you will get a dose of exercise. Also, the hotel offers motorbike rentals for 150,000 VND per day, but they insist on keeping the passport or leaving a high-amount deposit. This is an issue for many foreigners who need their passports during the day, such as obtaining legitimate SIM cards or visiting embassies in town. Other hotels will let you keep your passport as they already have a copy of your passport and aren't as paranoid. Breakfast is decent and provided, and overall this is a good value.", 'I was really enjoyed my stay at ngoc linh, the staff performance was very attentive, they even booked me a bus ticket soon after I checking in, very supportive, the hotel was small but clean, room and bathroom also.  Their location is within a walking distance to all sightseing around ben tanh market, you can just walk to reunification museum, saigon sky deck, notre dame cathedral of saigon, and also local eatery around hotel, even the limousine bus such as mekong express stop just across the street outside this hotel.Would definitely stay at ngoc linh if I come visit saigon again, highly recommended for budget traveller One minor complaint is ngoc linh not provide a smoking room, so it was rather exhausted to back and forth 4th floor to 1st floor just to smoking', 'This was a nice hotel. Close to the main party area of Bui Vien/Pham Ngu Lau and the all the major attractions of District 1. The only negative of my stay was the large bed I requested was two single beds pushed together (which would have been fine except the matresses were different heights). I would stay here again.', "Room was clean, staff friendly, location v central. It's only a street away from the busy backpacker street, but surprisingly quiet. RoomIsn't large but reflect location. Bed was hard, but pretty much all beds are hard in Vietnam!", "Where it could feasibly fall down in its maintenance, it's more than made up for in the sweetness and helpfulness of the staff.  Nhu literally walked me to my bus several blocks away and waited outside in the noonday heat until I was comfortably seated on the bus. It's that kind of beyond-the-call-of-duty courteousness that I appreciate.  Both she and her business partner are so very welcoming, one feels so extraordinarily at home here. I love the feeling they create, even, at the time of arriving. If you should stay here, say 'hi' to them from me.", 'Location was perfect.ğŸ¤— Excellent staff -arranged our tour and transpo to airport, proactively offered in transferring us to lower room and always there to help when we have questions about the place. Will definitely come back here soon.ğŸ˜€', 'The hotel itself  is in a great location. Tucked away in the backpackers alley. Makes for a quite stay (request top floor). They only thing is you have to hike it up everytime but you get your daily workout.', "Pros: access to a computer, hotel has decent breakfast, employees are really nice, bed was clean. Guest friendly.Cons: ants appeared everywhere on my last day in the bathroom around the sink, no elevator. Annoying to climb the stairs. And there's a kid crying or yelling every morning that woke up everyone around 7:30am", "This is an awesome hotel! It's right in the middle of the backpacker scene but also walking distance to all the major attractions like the War Remnants Museum. Our room was clean and very well air conditioned. Staff were great always happy to help out and point us in the right direction. We even got our first night refunded even though it was our mistake that we didnt stay the night"]

reviews: ['tá»‘t', 'KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n á»Ÿ trung tÃ¢m phá»‘ tÃ¢y, phÃ²ng sáº¡ch sáº½ tuy nhiÃªn cÃ²n má»™t vÃ i Ä‘iá»ƒm mÃ¬nh khÃ´ng hÃ i lÃ²ng: phÃ²ng khÃ¡ch sáº¡n quÃ¡ nhá», bÃ­, lá»‘i Ä‘i vÃ o phÃ²ng zÃ­ch záº¯c; khÃ¡ch sáº¡n chá»‰ phá»¥c vá»¥ Äƒn sÃ¡ng tá»« 7h khÃ´ng thuáº­n tiá»‡n cho nhÃ³m du lá»‹ch nhÆ° bá»n mÃ¬nh; phÃ²ng táº¯m khÃ´ng cÃ³ mÃ³c treo quáº§n Ã¡o.', 'Äi cÃ´ng tÃ¡c nÃªn ko cáº£m nháº­n Ä‘c háº¿t khu vá»±c xung quanh khÃ¡ch sáº¡n nÃ y.', 'ks nhá». vá»‹ trÃ­ ngay khu phá»‘ tÃ¢y tiá»‡n Äƒn uá»‘ng Ä‘i lai vui chÆ¡i. nhÃ¢n viÃªn thÃ¢n thiá»‡n. bá»¯a sÃ¡ng cáº§n cáº£i thiá»‡n.', 'Khach san khong co thang may. That vong tran tre khi fai di bo len tang 4 voi em be nho va hanh ly. Khong quay lai khach san nay nua', "The street is very beautiful and very lively in the evening where we passed good times. The hotel is in a very quiet alley. It's a good place.The welcome is friendly, the staff attentive and the rooms clean.Good place |", 'they speak French and English very well, they booked a taxi for me', 'Situated right in the Bui Vein walking street in an alley away from the traffic. Within walking distance to Ben Tanh market, War Remnants Museum, Post Office, Cathedral, Opera House, Fine Art Museum etc . Bare basic room but clean . Set breakfast provided .Breakfast is sufficient . Maybe can be expanded to include toasts and cereals as well.The walking street can be noisy at night especially weekends with many pubs and food joints. Luckily, you can hardly hear anything in the room . Day tours can be booked from the hotel . We visited the Chu Chi tunnels and Cao Dai temple in a day trip . Good outing.Walked to the other places  of interest. You can get good quality roasted coffee beans or ground coffee at the big cafes like Trung Nguyen Legend, Phuc Long etc much cheaper than elsewhere.Takashimaya has a wide range of local food products at reasonable prices. Saigon Square opposite is a good shopping place for clothes, shoes etc.The street next to Ben Tanh caters to Muslims.', 'The guesthouse was clean and the rooms are well insulated from the noise on Bui Vien. Breakfast was fruit and a mini baguette with either eggs or jam and butter, and hit the spot each morning. Air conditioner worked well but was rather noisy.', 'Pros : Nice staff with smile and clean room. No bugs during our stay. Good location. Itâ€™s on the walking street so itâ€™s easy to go bars or restaurants which is good. Breakfast is simple but you can choose among 3 menus.Cons : Because itâ€™s located on walking street surrounded by bars, itâ€™s little bit noisy at night till around 12. But not that problem to sleep. Water pressure for shower was bit weak.', 'Stayed in the cheapest, no-window room as I\'m travelling alone.  Satisfied. Initially when I entered the room I thought "Oh, right. I booked the cheapest," as it looked a bit too barren, but as I unpacked I realized it was very well-managed. Very clean, linens smelled lovely, fridge and A/C powerful (with no musty smell), clean working bathroom, hot shower. Only gripe is met a young girl on the 2nd day who was idling away on the reception sofa with a green facial mask all over her face. Inquired about extending half a day and her attitude was lackluster. Can only imagine she was the owner\'s daughter with such attitude? Unacceptable for me guests have to talk to an unfriendly, no smiles green face. Rules for outside guests are also very strict. ID check is necessary, which I understand, but still states they can stay only during the daytime. I didn\'t have a need to bring in a guest, but found it unreasonable. Breakfast never tried, but heard is good enough. Not noisy as inside alley!', 'The hotel has a perfect location. It is in the middle of bui vien street. But the location inside the street makes it so comfortable and quite. It is my favourite hotel in ssigon, close to the bus stations. Bars. Clubs and market. The rooms are clean and tiny. Staff soon be like familyğŸ˜Š', 'this hotel is in city centre, in entertainment area, but cleanliness is doubtful and staff could be more helpful. Breakfast is not good. If you choose eggs, you cannot get butter. I have never seen a worse breakfast before in Vietnam.', 'Always stay here when Iâ€™m in HCM', 'The  best you can get for the Value for money', 'This hotel is hidden down an alley which actually made it quite quiet for sleeping. Itâ€™s right off the Main Street where you can find anything from food to clothes to entertainment. I would for sure stay here again. They booked me a taxi to the airport at 6am and the driver was actually early. Overall no complaints. The bed was also pretty comfy.', "Hotel is inside a alley inside the night market.  It's quite at night, but just a few steps, you can reach the night market with lots of bars and restaurants.Friendly and helpful staff.Room is clean.  Reasonable price.", 'A comfortable room in a great location. A comfortable clean bed and a good a-la-carte breakfast. The staff is friendly and helpfu.I had booked room without window. My only problem was the fact, that there was no light switch next to the bed (arriving after a long flight I was a bit disoriented).', "We spent one night here before flying out early in the morning. The staff were incredibly helpful with organising a taxi for the morning and settling us into our room. It's in the heart of backpacker town, which is great if that's where you want to be. It's quiet in the hotel despite the crazy shenanigans going on in the streets. Breakfast was nice. Overall, really good value for money."]

address: 185 -187 LÃª ThÃ¡nh TÃ´n Quáº­n 1, Quáº­n 1, Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh, Viá»‡t Nam, 70000
reviews: ['Pros: have a large room and bathroom, location near to ben thanh market, around have the circle k mart, restaurant also.Cons: the prices is higher abit but no free bottled water, charges each bottle vnd 20k, so expensive on it. U can get it cheaper at K mart. Coz the water put inside refrigerator , on the first night we stayed we thoughts its free, but when check out time just only know its charges us money, not free. So after we back to stay 2 nights we knew already we just bought the water at K mart.', "Good hotel for family. I'am always stayed at this hotel since when i came to vietnam (ho chi min city)..Just walking to Choo Ben Than Market and Malaysian street.  Totaly this hotel comfortable and staff always helpful. Recommended hotel", 'The staffs are very friendly and helpful. Although it is quite noisy during the day, it is quite during the night. Room condition is very good. Also quite near to Malaysian Street and easy to find halal food.', 'Pros. Excellent location.  Near to Ben Thanh , night markets. Walking  distance to Takashimaya and other shopping centres. Lots of restaurants, cafes and street food around. Friendly staff. Daily room cleaning.Cons Bring your own shampoo and shower gel as hotel does not provide.', "Ideal location as Ben Thanh is just down the block. Away from the hustle and bustle of the market but still noisy in the streets (city never sleeps). Staff were super nice and helpful. We had to ask for more towels multiple times and I wish water as provided but for the price and location, it was a good experience and I'd book again.", "Checked in was fast and efficient. Hotel room and toilet were spacious. Our family consist of five adults and after we checked in and settled down, we were told to pay extra USD5/day for extra one pax. We didn't mind paying since everything looks great and clean. We were on level 6 and WiFi wasn't stable. However, one can use wifi on different levels with the same password. TV cable with Fox movie, HBO and many more were our entertainment. Staff were helpful and service was good. Balcony with the street view was nice. Hotel is a few step away from Ben thanh market and next to it, there is a family mart. Hotel provided good cheap massage service which I enjoyed it very much. Overall, we had a great stay and thumbs up for a budget hotel.", 'This was our first experience at this hotel & we liked it very much. We will return in the future to the hotel as it is nearby Ben-Than & just a short walk away. The room is quite specious even for 4 people.', 'Love this place close to everywhere and everything you need like eating places, nightlife spots and even good massages. The pricing for the room is amazingly afforable but the only thing missing is a safe where we can store valuables  and passport.', 'My husband & I enjoyed our stay so much, though at first, we only got our room at 5.30pm (waited for like 2 hours) but they gave us a very nice big room for two. The room was clean, no fouls odor, the bathroom was clean, surrounding not noisy. We had the view of other buildings but it was a nice scene.Overall I paid for what I got...its worthit & the area is safe too...', 'The hotel is strategically situated. It is within short walking distant to shops and halal food restaurants. Tourist guide and tour packages is just next door and was a real bargain with experienced personnels. The hotel staffs was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. I would certainly recommend this hotel to would be tourist.', "It was great.  So close to the Ben T. Market and the room's AC was super strong.  That really is a good thing in Vietnam's May weather.  Cools down the room within 5 mins.  Toilet was also Super Clean.  Everything looks new...", 'Information at agoda this hotel children 0-10years free to stay if not add extra bed.. But when i came at the hotel, the staff at the counter told me children 0-6years stay for free..7years must pay more 5usd/VND 200k.. So i was charged vnd 200k..So far  the rooms comfortable & clean..', 'Pros: good location, near to Ben thanh market, the room and bath room is big.Cons: no provide free bottled mineral water, each bottle charge VND 20k', 'kepada yang plan nak shopping area ben than market,ini adalah pilihan yang tepat kerana anda boleh jalan kaki sahaja kerana ia terletak di satu blok hadapan, begitu juga ben thant night market dan Malay Street .', 'The centre of old Sai Gon, now Ho Chi Minh City, is a short walk away, Ben Thanh markets are around the corner, good street food is every where and so is western fare if you prefer... and all for just over $40per night... and considering I was only there to sleep, what else would you want?', 'The location is just beside the popular Ben Thanh Market and night market.The family room is big and has balcony.Easy to get halal food at Malaysian street.There are wifi network in each room but sometimes the connection is very slow.', 'The best thing about this hotel is the location. Just walking distance to major attractions. Clean room. Very friendly and helpful staff. Value for money. Not many facility or food for breakfast but not a big problem.', 'The room was very run down n toilet was meh..aircon was noisy n only hot air came out...furnitures was also run down..very disappointed!..not recommending it to anyone..will never go back there again..', 'All the complaints that I read about other hotels are not found in this hotel. Basic hotel facilities even toothbrush were provided. Towels were changed daily. I was not moved to other hotels. Water pressure was great - just the hot water took sometimes in the morning and late evening. 50++ tv channels with around 7 English channels....', "Generous sized family room, good selection of TV channels (english channels available). But the room is getting worn, we suspect the waterproofing in the shower is a little faulty as the floor always got wet after a shower despite using the curtain. The cleaning service is a bit unpredictable (they skipped us one day, bedsheets arent changed even though we stayed for a week) and laundry is quite expensive. Convenient location although a bit noisy as facing a major road, on the plus side it's very easy to find. Next to two convenient stores and several eateries. Walking distance to Ben Thanh market and halal restaurants.Staff are friendly and helpful enough. there is a PC downstairs for usage and wifi is quite fast."]

address: 283/21 Ä‘Æ°á»ng Pháº¡m NgÅ© LÃ£o, Quáº­n 1, Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh, Viá»‡t Nam, 70000
reviews: ['KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n sáº¡ch sáº½, vá»‹ trÃ­ trung tÃ¢m thÃ nh phá»‘ nÃªn dá»… dÃ ng mua sáº¯m, Äƒn uá»‘ng vÃ  tiáº¿t kiá»‡m chi phÃ­ Ä‘i láº¡i. NhÃ¢n viÃªn thÃ¢n thiá»‡n, vui váº». Bá»¯a sÃ¡ng Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n nhÆ°ng cháº¥p nháº­n Ä‘Æ°á»£c vá»›i giÃ¡ phÃ²ng ksan. KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n nhá» nÃªn khÃ´ng cÃ³ thang mÃ¡y, khÃ¡ch sáº¡n náº±m trong háº»m nhá», xe taxi cÃ³ thá»ƒ Ä‘i vÃ o nhÆ°ng tá»‘t hÆ¡n váº«n lÃ  Ä‘Ã³n xe á»Ÿ ngoÃ i háº»m.', 'Nhan vien vui ve, nhiet tinh, giÃ¡ cáº£ há»£p lÃ½, dich vu tot', 'Ä‚n sÃ¡ng mÃ¬ Äƒn liá»n thÃ¬ nh nÆ¡i cÃ³, nhÆ°ng phá»Ÿ Äƒn liá»n thÃ¬ hÆ¡i báº¥t ngá», thÃ  ko Ä‘Æ°a vÃ o thá»±c Ä‘Æ¡n cÃ²n hÆ¡n! PhÃ²ng Äƒn bÃ© cho 6 ng, nÃ³ng vÃ  muá»—i', "I spent 6 nights here and thoroughly enjoyed it.  It's located right next to backpackers street but it is tucked up a little lane so it is surprisingly quiet.  The staff are fantastic. Very welcoming, courteous and extremely helpful. The rooms are a decent size, the bed very comfortable, the aircon worked well and the tv had plenty of channels in English. The rooms are cleaned every day and the towels were also changed daily. The hotel also does a laundry service should you need anything washed. I would highly recommend this place to anyone considering staying in HCM. I will certainly be back.", 'Staff are really nice and honest. Buy your sim  card and tours through them. Its in an alleyway (safe atnight) a few mins walk from backpacker st yet quiet for sleep. The rooms have fan, aircon, safe, fridge etc.  Be prepared for stairs if your room is upstairs.  I would stay again.  Good value as breakfast included. The staff very helpful and some speak English so was easy for me.', 'For the cost, it was quite good. Staff was really friendly and always happy to help. I arrived late (very late - missed my flight and arrived the next day at 7am) and they happily checked me in and offered me some breakfast. Great location. Overall a good experience', 'The hotel is located in the main backpacker quarter. Itâ€™s clean with air-conditioned rooms (our machine broke but was quickly fixed). The manager has great recommendations (he pointed us towards a delicious bÃ¡nh mÃ¬ stall) and speaks good English. Breakfast is basic but nice. We would recommend!', 'The location very good and staff very good. Facilities a little bit old, especially the WiFi every floor use as different standalone, and difficult to use at night.  If can upgarde Will much better', 'The location of the hotel is accessible. There is an English-speaking staff who assisted us. The hotel offers tour and transport arrangements which is quite cheaper than online. The room and breakfast are also good.', 'A very warm welcome with helpful local information.  I had an early morning flight and I was still seen out with some fruit to eat on my journey as I would miss breakfast by a few hours. The bed was very comfortable. Air conditioning worked well plus an extra fan provided good white noise for my early evening.  The location is convenient being one block off the major street so its quieter but quick to get a taxi or grab.  Had very good pho a few blocks away too.   If you have lots of luggage ask for a lower floor to make it an easier climb. Would stay again', 'This is close to the backpacker area but not so loud and dirty. I even extended my stay. Staff was helpful. Itâ€™s easy to get your laundry done here and they made it smell so nice!', "Rooms are straightforward, clean, stocked with shampoo, soap, toothbrushes, and tissues (a plus in my book). My room had decent air conditioning and wi-fi proximity. Prices through Agoda are likely better than on other services, and the hotel will accept Vietnamese Dong (VND) or US Dollars, which is a lovely feature if you have not exchanged currencies yet. Great location, but quieter than the backpacker hell-hole called Bui Vien Street. On the downside, there is no elevator, so if you are above the 2nd floor, you will get a dose of exercise. Also, the hotel offers motorbike rentals for 150,000 VND per day, but they insist on keeping the passport or leaving a high-amount deposit. This is an issue for many foreigners who need their passports during the day, such as obtaining legitimate SIM cards or visiting embassies in town. Other hotels will let you keep your passport as they already have a copy of your passport and aren't as paranoid. Breakfast is decent and provided, and overall this is a good value.", 'I was really enjoyed my stay at ngoc linh, the staff performance was very attentive, they even booked me a bus ticket soon after I checking in, very supportive, the hotel was small but clean, room and bathroom also.  Their location is within a walking distance to all sightseing around ben tanh market, you can just walk to reunification museum, saigon sky deck, notre dame cathedral of saigon, and also local eatery around hotel, even the limousine bus such as mekong express stop just across the street outside this hotel.Would definitely stay at ngoc linh if I come visit saigon again, highly recommended for budget traveller One minor complaint is ngoc linh not provide a smoking room, so it was rather exhausted to back and forth 4th floor to 1st floor just to smoking', 'This was a nice hotel. Close to the main party area of Bui Vien/Pham Ngu Lau and the all the major attractions of District 1. The only negative of my stay was the large bed I requested was two single beds pushed together (which would have been fine except the matresses were different heights). I would stay here again.', "Room was clean, staff friendly, location v central. It's only a street away from the busy backpacker street, but surprisingly quiet. RoomIsn't large but reflect location. Bed was hard, but pretty much all beds are hard in Vietnam!", "Where it could feasibly fall down in its maintenance, it's more than made up for in the sweetness and helpfulness of the staff.  Nhu literally walked me to my bus several blocks away and waited outside in the noonday heat until I was comfortably seated on the bus. It's that kind of beyond-the-call-of-duty courteousness that I appreciate.  Both she and her business partner are so very welcoming, one feels so extraordinarily at home here. I love the feeling they create, even, at the time of arriving. If you should stay here, say 'hi' to them from me.", 'Location was perfect.ğŸ¤— Excellent staff -arranged our tour and transpo to airport, proactively offered in transferring us to lower room and always there to help when we have questions about the place. Will definitely come back here soon.ğŸ˜€', 'The hotel itself  is in a great location. Tucked away in the backpackers alley. Makes for a quite stay (request top floor). They only thing is you have to hike it up everytime but you get your daily workout.', "Pros: access to a computer, hotel has decent breakfast, employees are really nice, bed was clean. Guest friendly.Cons: ants appeared everywhere on my last day in the bathroom around the sink, no elevator. Annoying to climb the stairs. And there's a kid crying or yelling every morning that woke up everyone around 7:30am", "This is an awesome hotel! It's right in the middle of the backpacker scene but also walking distance to all the major attractions like the War Remnants Museum. Our room was clean and very well air conditioned. Staff were great always happy to help out and point us in the right direction. We even got our first night refunded even though it was our mistake that we didnt stay the night"]

reviews: ['tá»‘t', 'KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n á»Ÿ trung tÃ¢m phá»‘ tÃ¢y, phÃ²ng sáº¡ch sáº½ tuy nhiÃªn cÃ²n má»™t vÃ i Ä‘iá»ƒm mÃ¬nh khÃ´ng hÃ i lÃ²ng: phÃ²ng khÃ¡ch sáº¡n quÃ¡ nhá», bÃ­, lá»‘i Ä‘i vÃ o phÃ²ng zÃ­ch záº¯c; khÃ¡ch sáº¡n chá»‰ phá»¥c vá»¥ Äƒn sÃ¡ng tá»« 7h khÃ´ng thuáº­n tiá»‡n cho nhÃ³m du lá»‹ch nhÆ° bá»n mÃ¬nh; phÃ²ng táº¯m khÃ´ng cÃ³ mÃ³c treo quáº§n Ã¡o.', 'Äi cÃ´ng tÃ¡c nÃªn ko cáº£m nháº­n Ä‘c háº¿t khu vá»±c xung quanh khÃ¡ch sáº¡n nÃ y.', 'ks nhá». vá»‹ trÃ­ ngay khu phá»‘ tÃ¢y tiá»‡n Äƒn uá»‘ng Ä‘i lai vui chÆ¡i. nhÃ¢n viÃªn thÃ¢n thiá»‡n. bá»¯a sÃ¡ng cáº§n cáº£i thiá»‡n.', 'Khach san khong co thang may. That vong tran tre khi fai di bo len tang 4 voi em be nho va hanh ly. Khong quay lai khach san nay nua', "The street is very beautiful and very lively in the evening where we passed good times. The hotel is in a very quiet alley. It's a good place.The welcome is friendly, the staff attentive and the rooms clean.Good place |", 'they speak French and English very well, they booked a taxi for me', 'Situated right in the Bui Vein walking street in an alley away from the traffic. Within walking distance to Ben Tanh market, War Remnants Museum, Post Office, Cathedral, Opera House, Fine Art Museum etc . Bare basic room but clean . Set breakfast provided .Breakfast is sufficient . Maybe can be expanded to include toasts and cereals as well.The walking street can be noisy at night especially weekends with many pubs and food joints. Luckily, you can hardly hear anything in the room . Day tours can be booked from the hotel . We visited the Chu Chi tunnels and Cao Dai temple in a day trip . Good outing.Walked to the other places  of interest. You can get good quality roasted coffee beans or ground coffee at the big cafes like Trung Nguyen Legend, Phuc Long etc much cheaper than elsewhere.Takashimaya has a wide range of local food products at reasonable prices. Saigon Square opposite is a good shopping place for clothes, shoes etc.The street next to Ben Tanh caters to Muslims.', 'The guesthouse was clean and the rooms are well insulated from the noise on Bui Vien. Breakfast was fruit and a mini baguette with either eggs or jam and butter, and hit the spot each morning. Air conditioner worked well but was rather noisy.', 'Pros : Nice staff with smile and clean room. No bugs during our stay. Good location. Itâ€™s on the walking street so itâ€™s easy to go bars or restaurants which is good. Breakfast is simple but you can choose among 3 menus.Cons : Because itâ€™s located on walking street surrounded by bars, itâ€™s little bit noisy at night till around 12. But not that problem to sleep. Water pressure for shower was bit weak.', 'Stayed in the cheapest, no-window room as I\'m travelling alone.  Satisfied. Initially when I entered the room I thought "Oh, right. I booked the cheapest," as it looked a bit too barren, but as I unpacked I realized it was very well-managed. Very clean, linens smelled lovely, fridge and A/C powerful (with no musty smell), clean working bathroom, hot shower. Only gripe is met a young girl on the 2nd day who was idling away on the reception sofa with a green facial mask all over her face. Inquired about extending half a day and her attitude was lackluster. Can only imagine she was the owner\'s daughter with such attitude? Unacceptable for me guests have to talk to an unfriendly, no smiles green face. Rules for outside guests are also very strict. ID check is necessary, which I understand, but still states they can stay only during the daytime. I didn\'t have a need to bring in a guest, but found it unreasonable. Breakfast never tried, but heard is good enough. Not noisy as inside alley!', 'The hotel has a perfect location. It is in the middle of bui vien street. But the location inside the street makes it so comfortable and quite. It is my favourite hotel in ssigon, close to the bus stations. Bars. Clubs and market. The rooms are clean and tiny. Staff soon be like familyğŸ˜Š', 'this hotel is in city centre, in entertainment area, but cleanliness is doubtful and staff could be more helpful. Breakfast is not good. If you choose eggs, you cannot get butter. I have never seen a worse breakfast before in Vietnam.', 'Always stay here when Iâ€™m in HCM', 'The  best you can get for the Value for money', 'This hotel is hidden down an alley which actually made it quite quiet for sleeping. Itâ€™s right off the Main Street where you can find anything from food to clothes to entertainment. I would for sure stay here again. They booked me a taxi to the airport at 6am and the driver was actually early. Overall no complaints. The bed was also pretty comfy.', "Hotel is inside a alley inside the night market.  It's quite at night, but just a few steps, you can reach the night market with lots of bars and restaurants.Friendly and helpful staff.Room is clean.  Reasonable price.", 'A comfortable room in a great location. A comfortable clean bed and a good a-la-carte breakfast. The staff is friendly and helpfu.I had booked room without window. My only problem was the fact, that there was no light switch next to the bed (arriving after a long flight I was a bit disoriented).', "We spent one night here before flying out early in the morning. The staff were incredibly helpful with organising a taxi for the morning and settling us into our room. It's in the heart of backpacker town, which is great if that's where you want to be. It's quiet in the hotel despite the crazy shenanigans going on in the streets. Breakfast was nice. Overall, really good value for money."]

Náº¿u khÄƒn tráº£i giÆ°á»ng mÃ u tráº¯ng hoáº·c sÃ¡ng thÃ¬ tá»‘t hÆ¡n', 'ChÃºng tÃ´i uá»‘ng bia bá»‡t suá»‘t Ä‘Ãªm á»Ÿ BÃ¹i Viá»‡n', "Perfect location and great staff. Indulge yourself with a balcony room. Always happy to return to Kim's hotel.", "always a warm welcome . Right in the heart of district 1 bit set back on a quiet steet McDonald's 5 min walk .The bus from the airport costs 20.000dng and drops u within a few min walk .taxi to airport back is cheap at 16.000dng Internet is perfect And if u choose a balcony room a bath tub too be it a bit small .Highly recommended", 'I enjoyed my stay at Kim hotel. Im surprised to receive a bunch of longan fruits and a bottle of mineral water upon arrived at the hotel. Wow experience I had from the owner. They are flexible with my requests and im pleased with the stay. As a frequent traveller, I feel this hotel provide a good homestay experience.', "Hotel is situated at a good location.  I was greeted with a warm smile, a welcome drink and fruits. Something that is not normally associated with a budget hotel. There is a small lift that goes up to the 5th floor.  Amenities are very basic but considering the price that I paid, it's great value for money. The only complain that I have is the poor wifi connectivity.  Other than this, I am happy with the place.  I will come back again.", 'It was a comfortable place with good and friendly staff. Do inform them if u want to laundry white clothes to seperate from the others as my friend had a stain on it. There is a bus 152 that drops u off at ben thath market which is only 10k dong (less than 1 USD) instead of cabbing from the airport or asking for an airport transfer. it is just a 10 mins walk from ben thanh market.', "The room is big and clean with a small balcony. The lock on the room was pretty basic I felt it wasn't safe leaving my valuables. But I didn't lose anything. They clean the room everyday and replenishes the supplies. They have a restaurant downstairs that offers breakfast which is good when you book an 8am tour. The staff are nice, they will try to accommodate all your needs. Try chatting with them if you have time. They also offer tours but try to check the tour agencies along Pham Ngu Lao and Bui Vien to score a better deal.", 'Balcony rooms with bath Perfect location Mc ds the bars and bus to airport all a few min walkLovely staff ex internet and clean rooms', 'I stayed in a deluxe room. It was spacious and clean. Great stay', 'The  staff  greeted  me by  name  when  I  arrived . They  took  me  straight  to  my  room . Check  in took less  than  a minute . The  room  was  clean and  as advertised . The  street  is  quite  at night  with  plenty  of  places  to  eat  near  by . It is  only  1/2 a block  off walking  street .', 'This lovely budget hotel is situated in the centre of all the local activity. The staff were very welcoming and let us know that they could organize trips for us if necessary. In fact we had not arranged for a pick-up from the airport and a couple of days earlier rang to ask if it was possible for Kim to arrange it. They were very obliging and picked us up from our delayed flight. The hotel was also very clean, it had wi-fi, drinks were very reasonably priced. I would highly recommend it as it was certainly value for money.', 'It was fine. Bathroom was quite small but it did the job. Excellent location just off main tourist road but heard nothing in the room. Great staff, except for one minor disagreement over what was taken from the minibar.', 'nothing wrong with the hotel, but while you book for 20 bucks here, you can find the same room for 10-12 just walking on same street. Lots and lots of rooms available these days. No need to book online and pay more.', 'The room wiht balcony is very clean and good! Everything you need and also aircon. The location is in the traveller area and you find restaurants and shops around. As long as Miss Kim is there everything is working perfect!!! Only the others do not know what to do....', 'I had a great time at Kim Hotel 1. I booked the economy room but when I arrived at the hotel, the owner upgraded me to a double room. The room was clean and comfortable. The location was perfect because it is just a walking-distance away from Ben Tanh Market, and the area is full of tourists which makes it safe to walk around.', 'Stay was good. Room was big for 1. Balcony was only big enough for one chair to fit, its small but ok.Foods served at breakfast was nice. Location was easy to walk to nice eateries and close to benh tanh market where i always went to buy sweets and food.The street behind is justwhere pwople would sitaround and drink by the side walk. So its in the middle of a happening place. Lots of nice cafe.', 'e were warmly welcomed from the start and the friendly staff did everything possible to help us. Rooms were very clean and comfortable, the street outside quiet. Large room safe. Centrally located in quarter 1 with easy walking access to almost anything you want to see in HCMC. I would definitely stay there again.', 'The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were very nicely designed with a safe in the room and very fast internet. The bed and furniture was great and could not ask for a better layout with balcony.']

address: 238 Bui Vien, Quan 1, Quáº­n 1, Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh, Viá»‡t Nam, 256125
reviews: ['KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n sáº¡ch sáº½, á»Ÿ giá»¯a trung tÃ¢m, tiá»‡n lá»£i Ä‘i thÄƒm quan.Nhan viÃªn thÃ¢n thiá»‡n', 'The best part of the hotel was the staff. Everyone was very friendly and made it very easy to arrange tours and onward travel. Location has in the heart of the action, but, inside was a haven. Very clean.', 'we are very satisfied with our room ,clean and well attended everyday. All are nice except in booking for transport from hotel to airport. There is no proper coordination between hotel staff and private transpo bec we were ask to pay when advance payment was already made at the hotel. Gave us hassle in going  to the airport', 'Everything was great in the hotel except we got put on the top floor. This means up 7 flights of steps in the heat and humidity. They have no rooms on the 1st or 2nd floor. Otherwise if you are looking to be near the nightlife, this is the perfect location.', "If you are looking for budget price accommodation which is spotless; well managed with attentive caring staff; right in the centre of the action in hcmc, then look no further.I stayed here for 3 nights with my two sons aged 18 and 20 for the first leg of our Vietnam adventure.Admittedly, the Hong Han is not for everyone. The rooms are located on the five floors above the lobby and there is no lift, therefore strong legs and lungs are required, especially if your room is on the upper floors. The rooms to the front of the hotel are fronting onto one of the busiest and loudest tourist traps in the city which doesn't quieten down until 4am so those with a disposition to noise should probably look elsewhere.The rooms are spacious and well appointed for guesthouse standards. The cooked complimentary breakfast served on the first floor balcony is simple but delicious. The staff will help you any way they can.  We all thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely make a return visit.", "The hotel is very nice. Even though it's in a busy area, I didn't hear the busy city ar night. As soon as you're out of the door, you are in a busy part of town. Just a (15 minute) walk away from the Benh Than markets, the war museum, sky deck etc. Lot's of bars and restaurants just around the corner. Breakfast is quite a lot you can choose different options.Staff is friendly and rooms are big enough and clean. Overall a good place to explore Saign for a few day's.", 'I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The staff were very very friendly. They were the best staff I had so far!  Though they didnâ€™t have an elevator, our room was at the 3rd or 4th floor (i kind of forgot) but they helped us with our bags. They also helped us book a tour and the location of the hotel was very convenient. :)', 'We only stayed one night but this hotel left an impression on us! The room was clean and surprisingly quite for the location. The staff was very considerate and accomadaing! We highly recommend staying here!', 'The hotel is in the heart of the city with great resturants bars and shops everywhere but once you step inside the hotel doors you leave all the madness and noise behind you and just chill out in this  lovely  little place', 'Location is good. Near resto and walking distance to Ben Than market and Saigon Square. Clean and descent. The staff are polite and very attentive. They made my booking in Mekong tour via KIM Travel which is cheap compare to other. And also, they book me for bus going to cambodia. Breakfast is good.Cons: No elevator. You need to exercise walking the stairs. But, they have a lifting machine incase you have luggage.In recommed this hotel. You get what you pay.', "Pros:- the staff work super hard and are very kind! - location - this can be a pro or con depending on how you look at it...it's in the middle of the action and the bars, restaurants etc., and a pretty good walking distance to many of the major city attractions - close to the first/last stop of the 109 Yellow bus to/from the airport (at 23/9 Park)- the rooms are not new or fancy, but they were comfortable and kept well (ours was quite large)- they close the gate at 11pm, but you can ring the bell at any time and they will open it for youCons:- location (can be a pro or con)...it can get quite loud at night when everyone's out, but we were fine with it. We had a room on the 4th floor at the front of the building and we got over the noise by the second night (or join the fun or use ear plugs:P).- there is no elevator, so expect to get in a good exercise before relaxing in aircon if you're on an upper floor", "Staff are SO nice! Made me feel right at home and helped arranged bus tickets. Room was very spacious and even though it's right off the main backpacker street, you couldn't here any outside noise. Lovely stay, would come again.", "Centrally located in the backpacker area, nice big, clean rooms with a compact ensuite. Friendly staff who use an electric hoist to lift luggage to your floor (you have to walk). The street below is very busy  but we were on the third floor and really didn't notice any noise. Nice little, alfresco breakfast balcony, (it was a tad crowded and service was a bit slow; it seemed everyone wanted an early meal and check out and the poor waitress was managing both.) (Poor girl was run off her feet but continued to smile)", 'The hotel is located in a very lively street with bars, shops and plenty of restaurants, the rooms are quiet, clean and modern. Delicious breakfast is served on a cosy little terrasse on the first floor. But what really makes the difference here is the friendly and very helpful staff, that helped us sort out e very urgent passport problem upon arrival:)', 'Hotel was located at a very convenient location with eateries, bars, and convenience stalls all around. Staff was very friendly and patient and ensured that you had a comfortable stay. Would recommend you to stay at this hotel!', 'we stayed at the hong han for a week and returned for a couple of days prior to our return flight from hcmcthe hotel was exceptionally clean and very efficiently run by friendly and very helpful staff.the rooms we used were light and spacious with good aircon and fans, the roof terrace is a plus for breakfast and for me reading after the kids were in bed.the 11pm curfew was fine for us with kids though party party backpackers would probably find it too restrictive.we travelled saigon dalat bmt and nha trang. and this was the best hotel by a wide margin', 'My second visit to Saigon and I returned to the Hong Han because my previous experience had been so good.  The faces behind the counter may have changed but the service is still the same Located right at the heart of the action, the Hong Han offers great value for money', "Hong Han staff were wonderfully helpful, the rooms were clean, and the hotel was conveniently located. I walked pretty much everywhere.  If you're not looking for anything crazy fancy but totally affordable, then this is a great option. The backpacker street is also convenient with lots of restaurant choices, spas, etc. it's louder at night, but I have to say, even as a light sleeper, I had no trouble sleeping.", '-live high floor will have trouble climbing stairs\r-live low floor may have trouble being interpreted by noise coming from the street\rhard choice.\rhost is helpful. location is the most crazy and popular place in HZM. \rnear Fan Wu Lao Jie.\rnear the Sihn Tourist', 'Cons: A bit noisy from all the bars and general street revelry, also the doorbell ringing all night to let people in is a bit frustratingPros: immaculately clean. Ok sized rooms - not large but big enough. No lift but an ingenious electronic pulley to bring luggage up and down the stairs. Breakfast, coffee, juice very good.Staff so friendly and helpful, knowledgeable about all kinds of travel arrangements and happy to book for you']

address: 238 Bui Vien, Quan 1, Quáº­n 1, Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh, Viá»‡t Nam, 256125
reviews: ['KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n sáº¡ch sáº½, á»Ÿ giá»¯a trung tÃ¢m, tiá»‡n lá»£i Ä‘i thÄƒm quan.Nhan viÃªn thÃ¢n thiá»‡n', 'The best part of the hotel was the staff. Everyone was very friendly and made it very easy to arrange tours and onward travel. Location has in the heart of the action, but, inside was a haven. Very clean.', 'we are very satisfied with our room ,clean and well attended everyday. All are nice except in booking for transport from hotel to airport. There is no proper coordination between hotel staff and private transpo bec we were ask to pay when advance payment was already made at the hotel. Gave us hassle in going  to the airport', 'Everything was great in the hotel except we got put on the top floor. This means up 7 flights of steps in the heat and humidity. They have no rooms on the 1st or 2nd floor. Otherwise if you are looking to be near the nightlife, this is the perfect location.', "If you are looking for budget price accommodation which is spotless; well managed with attentive caring staff; right in the centre of the action in hcmc, then look no further.I stayed here for 3 nights with my two sons aged 18 and 20 for the first leg of our Vietnam adventure.Admittedly, the Hong Han is not for everyone. The rooms are located on the five floors above the lobby and there is no lift, therefore strong legs and lungs are required, especially if your room is on the upper floors. The rooms to the front of the hotel are fronting onto one of the busiest and loudest tourist traps in the city which doesn't quieten down until 4am so those with a disposition to noise should probably look elsewhere.The rooms are spacious and well appointed for guesthouse standards. The cooked complimentary breakfast served on the first floor balcony is simple but delicious. The staff will help you any way they can.  We all thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely make a return visit.", "The hotel is very nice. Even though it's in a busy area, I didn't hear the busy city ar night. As soon as you're out of the door, you are in a busy part of town. Just a (15 minute) walk away from the Benh Than markets, the war museum, sky deck etc. Lot's of bars and restaurants just around the corner. Breakfast is quite a lot you can choose different options.Staff is friendly and rooms are big enough and clean. Overall a good place to explore Saign for a few day's.", 'I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The staff were very very friendly. They were the best staff I had so far!  Though they didnâ€™t have an elevator, our room was at the 3rd or 4th floor (i kind of forgot) but they helped us with our bags. They also helped us book a tour and the location of the hotel was very convenient. :)', 'We only stayed one night but this hotel left an impression on us! The room was clean and surprisingly quite for the location. The staff was very considerate and accomadaing! We highly recommend staying here!', 'The hotel is in the heart of the city with great resturants bars and shops everywhere but once you step inside the hotel doors you leave all the madness and noise behind you and just chill out in this  lovely  little place', 'Location is good. Near resto and walking distance to Ben Than market and Saigon Square. Clean and descent. The staff are polite and very attentive. They made my booking in Mekong tour via KIM Travel which is cheap compare to other. And also, they book me for bus going to cambodia. Breakfast is good.Cons: No elevator. You need to exercise walking the stairs. But, they have a lifting machine incase you have luggage.In recommed this hotel. You get what you pay.', "Pros:- the staff work super hard and are very kind! - location - this can be a pro or con depending on how you look at it...it's in the middle of the action and the bars, restaurants etc., and a pretty good walking distance to many of the major city attractions - close to the first/last stop of the 109 Yellow bus to/from the airport (at 23/9 Park)- the rooms are not new or fancy, but they were comfortable and kept well (ours was quite large)- they close the gate at 11pm, but you can ring the bell at any time and they will open it for youCons:- location (can be a pro or con)...it can get quite loud at night when everyone's out, but we were fine with it. We had a room on the 4th floor at the front of the building and we got over the noise by the second night (or join the fun or use ear plugs:P).- there is no elevator, so expect to get in a good exercise before relaxing in aircon if you're on an upper floor", "Staff are SO nice! Made me feel right at home and helped arranged bus tickets. Room was very spacious and even though it's right off the main backpacker street, you couldn't here any outside noise. Lovely stay, would come again.", "Centrally located in the backpacker area, nice big, clean rooms with a compact ensuite. Friendly staff who use an electric hoist to lift luggage to your floor (you have to walk). The street below is very busy  but we were on the third floor and really didn't notice any noise. Nice little, alfresco breakfast balcony, (it was a tad crowded and service was a bit slow; it seemed everyone wanted an early meal and check out and the poor waitress was managing both.) (Poor girl was run off her feet but continued to smile)", 'The hotel is located in a very lively street with bars, shops and plenty of restaurants, the rooms are quiet, clean and modern. Delicious breakfast is served on a cosy little terrasse on the first floor. But what really makes the difference here is the friendly and very helpful staff, that helped us sort out e very urgent passport problem upon arrival:)', 'Hotel was located at a very convenient location with eateries, bars, and convenience stalls all around. Staff was very friendly and patient and ensured that you had a comfortable stay. Would recommend you to stay at this hotel!', 'we stayed at the hong han for a week and returned for a couple of days prior to our return flight from hcmcthe hotel was exceptionally clean and very efficiently run by friendly and very helpful staff.the rooms we used were light and spacious with good aircon and fans, the roof terrace is a plus for breakfast and for me reading after the kids were in bed.the 11pm curfew was fine for us with kids though party party backpackers would probably find it too restrictive.we travelled saigon dalat bmt and nha trang. and this was the best hotel by a wide margin', 'My second visit to Saigon and I returned to the Hong Han because my previous experience had been so good.  The faces behind the counter may have changed but the service is still the same Located right at the heart of the action, the Hong Han offers great value for money', "Hong Han staff were wonderfully helpful, the rooms were clean, and the hotel was conveniently located. I walked pretty much everywhere.  If you're not looking for anything crazy fancy but totally affordable, then this is a great option. The backpacker street is also convenient with lots of restaurant choices, spas, etc. it's louder at night, but I have to say, even as a light sleeper, I had no trouble sleeping.", '-live high floor will have trouble climbing stairs\r-live low floor may have trouble being interpreted by noise coming from the street\rhard choice.\rhost is helpful. location is the most crazy and popular place in HZM. \rnear Fan Wu Lao Jie.\rnear the Sihn Tourist', 'Cons: A bit noisy from all the bars and general street revelry, also the doorbell ringing all night to let people in is a bit frustratingPros: immaculately clean. Ok sized rooms - not large but big enough. No lift but an ingenious electronic pulley to bring luggage up and down the stairs. Breakfast, coffee, juice very good.Staff so friendly and helpful, knowledgeable about all kinds of travel arrangements and happy to book for you']

As far as continental breakfast is concerned I would assess it 4 out of 5.', 'Located in Ba Vi National Park, this resort has a great environment for relax. outside pool is very relaxing. Good buffet breakfast and restaurant. It is far from Ha Noi City (it takes about 1-1.5 hour by car).', "I can't believe there could be this amazing resort in the heart of the national forest Bavi. If you really want to detox, relax and refresh your mind and soul, you need to come to this place. The moment you arrived in the lobby, you feel calm by the atmosphere and the enchanting scent they use. The entire resort is covered by thousands of trees, the room is even designed to blend in nature.  I absolutely enjoyed walking around the place, uphill and downhill to enjoy the fresh air, watching birds, the view of the big lake....Inside the room (deluxe) is very spacious nice as well, with premium wooden furniture and a balcony. Breakfast buffet was a little bit limited in terms of choice, probably because there are only few guests stayed those days. But a la carte menu for lunch and breakfast at the western restaurant was very delicious.  Staff were very polite, helpful and attentive everywhere, at anytime. This is such a gem and Cant wait to come back and have longer stay here."]

KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n phÃ²ng hÆ¡i nhá» tuy nhiÃªn ráº¥t Ä‘Ã¡ng tiá»n náº¿u báº¡n Ä‘i du lá»‹ch HÃ  ná»™i', 'This hotel is beautiful. Brand new with a roof top pool that had the best view of the lake and surroundings. The location was great and the staff were amazing. They all spoke excellent English and could not do enough for us. They made us feel very special and went above and beyond. We will definitely stay here again.', 'Hotel new. Need to keep up with the cleaning. If not it will soon be dirty and unclean. I am very picky with cleaning.', 'I booked this hotel last-minute and it was one of few available options. It\'s a few minutes walking from the lake, right in the heart of the Old Quarter. I was "upgraded" to a room with windows, although the view from the windows is nothing worth bragging about. However, the kindness of the staff and their continuous willingness to make every effort to ensure you have a pleasant stay is one I haven\'t experienced thus far. My first night there I had no time for dinner and starved at 11PM, called reception - who offered to get KFC or what not, after which I requested something local. About 15 minutes later the bellboy knocked and gave me one of the best tasting chicken noodle soups I have had (45k for the soup, 25k for the service) which outmatched all the >100k foods I had prior to that in restaurants (not necessarily because I was starving). The team is very young and very kind, and made up whatever may be lacking in the room (which to me was none).', 'Good', 'Staffs are great and helpful, Maybe provide a better baby cot is a good idea.', 'Brand new hotel. Prime location. 5 mins walk from the Lake and the night market.. Staff is responsive and very attentive. All in a lovely hotel with all the benefits of a large chain hotel but with a boutique feel. Service was excellent on all levels', 'The front desk people and managers were all nice and very helpful. The breakfast was great and the airport transportation service was good and the price is reasonable ( cheaper than the taxi we got from the airport) As it is a new hotel, everything was just so tidy and clean. The location is the best. You can easily walk to the lake or the night market within 1-2 mins. It was a wonderful experience to stay with this hotel.', 'Everything is perfect,  clean and comfortable, staffs are nice and helpful. Highly recommended.', 'buffet was out of this world!!!!', 'Fantastic location, great breakfast, helpful staff,  Stay Here!', 'Perfect hotel!!!', 'just avoid the spa, it was like the one staff there had no idea what was going on. For the rest , as they work slow coz reopening : no room service for food, and breakfast limited.  But staff tries its best to accommodate. .']

Táº¥t cáº£ nhá»¯ng gÃ¬ cÃ¡c báº¡n nhÃ¢n viÃªn lÃ m vá»›i chÃºng tÃ´i Ä‘á»u vÆ°á»£t ngoÃ i mong Ä‘á»£i.CÃ¡c con cá»§a chÃºng tÃ´i nháº¥t Ä‘á»‹nh láº§n sau Ä‘áº¿n HÃ  Ná»™i chá»‰ á»Ÿ khÃ¡ch sáº¡n La Siesta thÃ´i!', 'Tá»‘t', 'La Siesta hÃ´tel and Spa was being renovated so we stayed at the newly renovated La Siesta Premium which is just a few metres away and was a lovely French colonial style hotel with great rooftop bar. We were a family of four with two teenagers. It was right in the middle of the old quarter. The service and location was excellent.', "They are very kind and helpful. They can help me whenever I need.I wanna go back to this hotel when I go to Hanoi definitely.Unfortunately,air condition doesn't work one day. But their service is perfection.Should go visit the hotel:)", 'Absolutely amazing, beautiful hotel and lovely staff. Everyone makes you feel welcome and personalizes your stay. 100% would recommend to anyone visiting Vietnam.', "There are many La Siesta's located in the Old Quarter of Hanoi but this location in particular was extra special due to the wonderful staff!  They were very accommodating and took care of our group which included my spouse and mother with special TLC.  We stayed a total of 5 nights with the first stay being 4 nights.  We had reservations for our return from Ha Long Bay & Hoi An and they were so great to securely hold our purchased painting and luggage.  Prior to our return, Scarlett (who was amazing) reached out to see when our departure flight would be to help with Airport arrangements!  What a surprise, you typically do not find attention to detail unless you stay at a 5 or 6 star hotel and even then, La Siesta rivaled their customer service!  I should also add that when we first arrived, the AC in our assigned family room was being repaired and the manager, I believe her name was Tran offered another upgraded room along with complimentary spa sessions for all 3 of us!", 'I have stayed at this hotel 3 out of 4 times that I was in Hanoi.  The rooms are beautifully appointed, and the food at Red Bean is of high level. Last but not least, in fact the most important, is their team of lovely and professional staff. Well trained, and  always anticipative.', "Room facilities are relatively new compared to other cheaper hotels of the same range, with an amazing service. Breakfast buffet is excellent, with an addition of a menu to order from. Hotel concierge personnel treat each guest as an individual and gives personalised service. Polite and helpful, they will try to cater to our needs whenever possible. It's amazing how they recognise their guests and are able to give updates on our requests (like tours) the moment we stepped into the hotel.", 'We booked a 4N stay from 18-22Mar to celebrate our wedding anniversary. After reading all the good reviews about the hotel, we decide to give it a try.And true enough, the hotel service is excellent. The staffs are friendly and helpful. The service quality is consistent thru out all the staffs. Location is also very centralised with many eateries and restaurants all within walking distance.Would recommend the hotel for their excellent service n location.  :)', 'This place is amazing and the staff are all excellent. They are attentive to every need.', 'Upon getting out of airport immigration, we were received by hotel staff and were taken to the hotel lobby without worrying the surcharge of taxi driver.  We were then greeted with a welcome drink before being informed of room upgrade to a duplex room on the top floor. The room was decorated with rose petal and welcome fruit plate. It was worth noting that hotel staff, Kaylee worked professionally and gave us useful advice on Ha Long Bay trip and so on.  She deserved a commendation as well.  In general, staying at the hotel is highly recommended to anyone.', 'Staff are very polite and willing to help no matter on travel recommendation or room late-out request, they provided good advice. They are also very sweet as it was my birthday, they gave us a big surprise to make the travelling more unforgettable . Highly recommended if you are going to Hanoi for relaxation!']

Chá»‰ cÃ³ Ä‘iá»u vá»‹ trÃ­ vÃ  view phÃ²ng giá» sáº½ khÃ´ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c nhÆ° xÆ°a.', 'KS nÃªn chá»n khi Ä‘áº¿n HN', 'This was my forth trip to Hanoi, but first time to stay at Hanoi Emerald Waters H&S.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful (which seems to be common in Hanoi).  The location makes it very convenient for getting around all the popular areas of the city.  They also have a nice breakfast that was included with the room.  Good selection and choice of eggs and other custom dishes.Another recommendation - the reception set us up with a free guided tour with two nice university students who did a great job taking us around and explaining things.', 'Clean, close to Ho Guom, the staffs are friendly', 'Overall nice in location, room size, breakfast, services and budget, etc.', 'Very friendly staff', 'Staff were very kind!', 'The hotel was clean the breakfast was very good and the location in the old quarter was good. However we wanted to leave a few days early to continue our travels and the hotel insisted we pay for the nights we were not there. Only after contacting Agoda for their help was it arrange for us to only pay for the nights we stay there. Ridiculous that the hotel would not allow us to leave and still pay for time we did not occupy the hotel .  One electrical outlet could not plug-in lamp by the bed for two phone chargers  anywhere else in the room    A lot of compromises for relatively high price hotel', 'The hotel is strategically located at the heart of the Old Quarter which is quite convenient as the famous attractions such as the Hoan Kiem Lake, Water Puppet Show, Hoa Lu Prison, the Opera House in French quarters, and many other famous restaurants in the Old Quarters are all within walking distance. The hotel staff contacted us prior to our visit via email for airport transfers to-from the hotel, and recommended some nice Halong/Sapa/Tam Coc tours at fair price, which is extremely helpful for travellers like me who wish to have a hassle free trip.  The hotel is not very big and does not have a lot of facilities execept for Spa and restaurant, but the room was clean, cosy and living spaces were definitely sufficient for two persons, although sound isolation is not that good and you can literally hear sound room the corridor.  Housekeeping is excellent and decorated the bed with flowers and towels everyday. Overall,  great value for money and excellent service! Highly recommended!']
