Thá»§ tá»¥c nhanh gá»n, tÃ´i sáº½ trá»Ÿ láº¡i Ä‘Ã¢y.', 'KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n nhá», sáº¡ch sáº½, phÃ¹ há»£p vá»›i khÃ¡ch du lá»‹ch ngáº¯n ngÃ y hoáº·c khÃ¡ch Ä‘i lÃ m viá»‡c. TrÆ°á»›c sáº£nh khÃ¡ch sáº¡n cÃ³ cafe ngÃ²ai trá»i khÃ¡ Ä‘áº¹p. Vá»‹ trÃ­ khÃ¡ch sáº¡n ngay gáº§n trung tÃ¢m, cÃ³ thá»ƒ Ä‘i bá»™ ra bá» Há»“, gáº§n cÃ¡c cá»­a hÃ ng mua sáº¯m Ä‘á»“ hiá»‡u. KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n á»Ÿ trÃªn má»™t con phá»‘ khÃ¡ ngáº¯n nÃªn nhiá»u ngÆ°á»i, tÃ i xáº¿ taxi khÃ´ng biáº¿t tÃªn.', 'sehr zentral gelegenes, schoenes sauber und ruhiges hotel, sehr hÃ¶fflichem und sehr freundlich personal. Sehr empflehlenswert.', 'Ky nghi tuyet voi voi nhung trai nghiem thu vi. Nhan vien lich su an can va chu dao. Vi tri gan trung tam mua sam.', 'Very well located, in the French quarter, near Hotel Metropole. Thus, the place is quiet and at the same time a very good starting point for any walk in the French quarter or around the Hoan Kiem lake nearby.Nice rooms (I recommend the suites at floor 10, bigger and with a nice view).Breakfast quite disappointing though. But there is a French coffee place inside the French institute called Lâ€™Espace, in Trang Tien street, nearby. Or your could indulge yourself and have it at the hotel Metropole on the other side of street Ly Thuong Kiet.', 'We are frequent Hanoi Travellers - and thereby test different areas - this time, we were really pleased.Location:Within walking distance (10 - 15 min) to the old quarter (busy and overcrowded), the hotel is located between the tourist area and the French quarter - and combines the benefits of both. Many nice cafÃ©s and restaurants nearby, the lake within less than 10 min â€¦.. and still, already rather quiet. I would consider this as the perfect location for a vacation with family.Hotel:The hotel has some signs of aging but is well maintained. Nice breakfast.If we ignore our tendency to explore new areas and hotels, this was the first hotel in Hanoi, which we would consider to revisit. We were very satisfied.', 'Staff very helpful & friendlyCafe on site nice fresh juices and Vietnamese soups but the sandwiches were not good very small with little fillingBar closes too early which is a shame as thereâ€™s a nice seating area out the front.Starbucks across the road and a bakery walking distance of opera house, old quarter & main shopping area with all designer shops', "This hotel has a great location very near to many tourist destination places, to many decent cafes and restaurants and to high profile stores like Prada, Omega etc. Starbucks is right in-front of the hotel.  Breakfast is great, cannot forget the very yummy creamy and cheesy pasta. We only got a problem with the lady receptionist the night we came, had a long discussion with her before we were able to finally checked-in, we came in very late around 9pm but we didn't receive enough consideration from them regarding the room we booked unlike with other hotels,  although I must say that the male staffs are all nice, helped us for a taxi going to another hotel in Hanoi in the following day. The facility is overall nice except that there's no sprinkler in the bathroom, not convenient at all. The room is small I think for its price.", 'Nice upgrade as it was my first time to stay. However I needed to borrow an iron  and without noticing there was a sharp edge which ruined my shirt when I ironed it. I complained to the reception, but all the guy said was sorry. Disappointing reaction from such a small and nice hotel.', 'Fantastic location right in the heart of Hanoi. Walking distance to a number of shopping options from markets through to big brand stores.The decor is a little dated, and rooms are limited with space, but you have everything you need. Service is fantastic and always willing to help.', 'Conifer Hotel is a boutique luxury hotel category. Located in the heart of tourist area of Hanoi.The area is quiet yet your at the City Center. Opera House, Lake, Post Office is within 5-10 minutes walk. There are plenty of proper restaurants. The staff at the reception,F&B and sales team will do their best to accommodate any reasonable request. In fact the two receptionist Mr. Hum & Mr. Nam has provided a great service that encouraged us to stay at the hotel. The F&B staff are good too and food is pretty good meal.The surrounding area is high end for Vietnam style both the hotel and as well as neighbourhood.', 'Room was a bit worn but very clean and functional. Bed was comfortable, basic amenities including toiletries and mineral water was available. The TV had international channels . As I arrived late, I didnâ€™t realise until the next morning that the hotel was very well located with many international premium shopping boutiques nearby. Great stay and Iâ€™ll definitely come back,', "Rooms are a bit small and there are some fit out choices that are kind of surprising (e.g. bath/shower set so high it's hard to climb into and then the ceiling is too close for comfort).But I'm a repeat guest because the staff are great, the location is convenient for both work and tourism and the quality/cost works out in my favour.", "On our third visit to Hanoi and having stayed in 5-star hotels prior, I found a gem in this hotel. Located in the former French Quarter, it is in a rather quiet street (Vietnamese love blowing their car and motorbike horns) and very conveniently located within a short distance to the old quarter. The staff personnel, from the bell captain to the maids, were excellent, professional, and very responsive to one's needs. Although my room was rather small, it was very nicely appointed with a great balcony to sit and view the on-goings outside. Breakfast was adequate and although we did not eat at the hotel any other time, we did view some wonderfully prepared dishes. My wife, a Thai, stated that the massage was excellent and very professional. We booked the hotel car for our return to the airport and wished that we had booked it for our arrival also. Excellent service for about 9.00 USD more but well worth it. In sum, we had another memorable Hanoi visit and staying at this wonderful hotel made it even more so. True Vietnamese hospitality in a wonderful setting.", "Right around the corner from the Opera house, this small boutique hotel offers perfect value for money. Rooms are reasonably sized - make sure you get one with a balcony. They are well-maintained and clean, and have not really aged since I stayed here first a few years ago. Just shows management takes care of their establishment. Staff is very helpful and friendly and makes one feel welcome.\r\rBreakfast has improved over the years (it used to be this hotel's biggest downside). It's still nothing to rave about, the single choice of processed ham and cheese remains sub par. Be aware that the horrible mayonnaise is sweet like a dissolved candy cane. Freshly cooked scrambled eggs are absolutely delicious though.\r\rI recommend this place to anyone going to Hanoi.", 'I would reccomend the staff  (front desk staff) who were all very diligent, very professional and active.\rA little story which happened to me : I went to the market (north of the lake) by taxi, it costed 24.000 dong (around 1,5 dollars)\rwhen i came back, from the market i took a taxi but i didnt feel confortable, the box of the counter/taximeter was partially hidden. And i notices that the rate increased very fast... at the hotel the total was 107.000 dong. I asked the hotel to help me and they immediately came and barked at the driver who was definately a taxi/stealer... I paid 50.000 (The reception told me to pay only 40.000 but I didn t have change and didnt want to spend time on that)\rAnyway they helped....\rBe aware of fake taxi !...', 'The staffs were very attentive and helpful. We booked a tatami room, which was on the top floor with very nice view. But I will not suggest anyone taller than 180cm choose this room, for the ceiling is too low for the tall. The location is wonderful, nearing everything, but in a quiet alley. I think we will come back again.', "This is the second time I have stayed at the Conifer, it is just about 4 star but really a mid-range to budget choice, but what lacks in luxury is made up for by the wonderful staff, who will do anything to help you.  The Manager especially is very solicitous and will make sure that you are happy with your stay.  I stayed in the cheapest room this time (the 'tatami' room on the top floor - though there is no tatami, just a wooden floor, and the bed mattress is on the floor).  The room was OK with a small bathroom, but I kept waking up very early due to sunlight leaking into the room via the bathroom window. I mentioned it to the manager and by the second day they had taped a screen over the window for me which really helped.  On the down side, the wifi did not stretch well to this room (no router on the 11th floor) so I had to work in the restaurant, also the breakfast is not great - best to go for the pho or have the baguettes with some eggs.  All in all though, if you want a more peaceful location than the old town and you are looking for a good mid-range choice I can recommend the Conifer.", "I love staying here when I visit hanoi for personal travel. More upscale area than the normal tourist section of Hoan Kiem. Hotel is very nice for the cost. Very helpful staff, short walk from great food. Only complaint is the wifi is terrible on the upper floors. They do provide an Ethernet cable, so don't forget your adapter if you're a Mac user.", 'This is my third staff at this boutique hotel over the past 18 months.  The hotel is centrally located in the city and has some good restaurants nearby.  Staff is friendly and helpful, and the rooms are well maintained.  Great value!']

reviews: ['HÃ i lÃ²ng vá»›i má»i thá»©, ngoáº¡i trá»« viá»‡c cÃ³ máº¥y con muá»—i vo ve trong phÃ²ng lÃ m tÃ´i cáº£m tháº¥y báº¥t an.', 'Æ¯u: Nvien nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh chu Ä‘Ã¡o,NhÆ°á»£c: Äang trong quÃ¡ trÃ¬nh thay khÄƒn táº¯m', 'Nv Ã¢n cáº§n', 'This is a boutique hotel. I would say that that the value is fantastic. Location js great with easy walking distances to many tourist attractions. The staff at the hotel are friendly and give many recommendations on where to go sight seeing. Overall a great place to stay I will definitely be back for a return stay.', 'This hotel is really worth recommending. Cheap hotel have five star service. The hotel manager Tommy was very attentive. Makes us feel like home. Each service staff is also very friendly to meet all the needs of the guests and treat them as family members. Because this is my first time in Hanoi, when I entered the hotel, in addition to providing welcome drink and fruit, the lady staff also took out a nearby map, explaining one by one where there are delicious restaurants at reasonable prices and which important attractions to visit. The room is clean and tidy. Breakfast is very delicious and there are many choices, the preparation is very attentive and special. It is really good experience and good value for money. If you want to come to Hanoi, the best choice is this one.', "I booked La Castela for the later half of our time in Hanoi and I wish I had booked it for the first part of our stay, too. The staff went above and beyond to welcome us to Hanoi, provide us with valuable information, serve a delicious and filling breakfast, and make all the car arrangements we needed. The location is great for the Old Quarter with lots of good vegetarian restaurants right around the corner (important to me). I can't recommend this hotel enough.", 'Very friendly straff!', 'Very Good Location, near to the Lake and shops. Very nice and accommodating Hotel staff!', 'A lovely hotel. â€¢Every staff there is really warm,nice and friendly. â€¢The location of the hotel is excellent!â€¢The breakfast was tasty! â€¢The room was clean and elegant. I enjoy staying here.Strongly recommend.', 'Perfect hotel! The location, the room and the staff are amazing! Had 1 night there and about to come back to another one. Very very recommended', 'Nous avons particuliÃ¨rement apprÃ©ciÃ© les prestations de cet hÃ´tel mais ce qui nous fera y revenir et le conseiller Ã  nos amis et Ã  nos familles, c\'est la qualitÃ© du service ! Mr Tommy Bui, le gÃ©rant et Alice, la rÃ©ceptionniste, sont vÃ©ritablement fantastiques ! De tous les voyages que nous avons fait, nous n\'avions jamais vu un personnel aussi dÃ©vouÃ©, souriant et attentionnÃ©. Avec tous leurs bons conseils et toutes leurs attentions ils ont tout fait pour rendre notre sÃ©jour des plus agrÃ©able ! Nous tenons Ã  les en remercier encore une fois !Pour ce qui est du reste, l\'hÃ´tel est bien tenu et en plein coeur du "Old Quarter" de HanoÃ¯. Les suites avec balcon sont spacieuses et lumineuses : grand lit, tv, rÃ©frigÃ©rateur, mini bar, bouilloire avec biscuits, cafÃ©s et thÃ©s offerts, baignoire, sÃ¨che cheveux, nÃ©cessaires de toilette offerts, peignoires, chaussons, clim... Et mÃªme si vous Ãªtes cÃ´tÃ© rue, vous n\'aurez pas Ã  vous inquiÃ©ter du bruit, la baie vitrÃ©e bien fermÃ©e Ã©touffe les klaxons.', reviews: ['Bá»‹ Ä‘au Ä‘áº§u xin thuá»‘c Ä‘Æ°á»£c nhÃ¢n viÃªn mua cho mang lÃªn táº­n phÃ²ng vÃ  ráº¥t nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh. Very good', "Breakfast and showering system are big failures.Don't expect such a great value at this hotel.Just good for budget stay for a short period of time.", 'Good location and cosy hotel within old quarters', 'Thank you all staff of Splendid Pearlight Hotel especially Chu Chu, Hannah and Fiona however not forgeting the rest of the staff that we do not know all their names. They are always friendly and helpful on our queries  about anything.  Thank you for the hospitality.', 'I booked 3 nights at Pearlight.  When I reached hotel, my room was occupied. They sent me to 500m away named Symphony Hotel ( lower star hotel , their hotel also. ) At first, I thought  Is upgrade my stay.  However,  Symphony hotel is dark ( lobby, lift )  hotel , noisy renovation next to the hotel for 2 hours during mid night and 5:50am start noisy again.  Another reason is location far away from St Josephâ€™s Cathedral .  I complaint then they sent me back to stay another hotel named S Central ( opposite Pearlight).  They group have Symphony ( 500m away ), Pearlight, Star Grand & S Central next to each other.   Beware if you booked higher grade hotel, but was arranged to stay at lower grade hotel .   Star Grand has better / more variety breakfast than others.    I used to do online booking, first time this incident happened to me.  And I think is not right because they want to earn more cos I early booked in lower rate,  they use my room to rent out to other guests in higher rate )', 'The hotel is clean and big. near to the shopping, many food, spa, and local tour there. The staff so friendly and helpful. They can arrange car for pick up and drop off to the airport', 'The location in old quarter, near to the hoan kiem lake just walking around 10-15 minute.And around hotel is a lot of store and food. So nice. The staff also so helpfull and friendly.', 'we Arrived with 3 suitcases and when we got to the hotel  found out there was no elevator and my room was on the 7th floor..the staff was really nice and changed me to there sister hotel roght opposit.all staff was really nice and helpful specially DONG &HAIthank you very much  to all the staffroom was really large and aircon should be left on 24/7', 'Cut-water for whole stay, terrible facility, never come back', 'I recommend it. The staff are really friendly. Meals are also good. It is cheap and good for family travelers with children. Please note that there is no elevator.', "I recommend it. The staff are really friendly. Meals are also good. It's best. Please note that there is no elevator.", 'I recommend you guys to check in here because, eventhough the building is small yet the room is big and nice. Plus, the receptionist are always in welcome mode which give positive vibes. The hotel give the very best hospitality and services in which you can imagine you were in 4/5 star hotel.', 'Not as good as the stars they have as a rating', 'Big thank', 'There was a reservation stuff up from Agoda. The staff organised a mattress for us , carrying a double up 4 flights. They helped us with a late check out and were more than helpful with any request. The location is great, the only downer was the church bells at 5 am. But everything was close.  The room was clean and big with 2 queen sized beds.  Breakfast was good with a decent selection of local and western foods. If we go back to Hanoi  will stay there again.', "We had a family room with 2 king sized beds, very comfortable. The room was spacious and had a balcony looking out onto St Joseph's Cathedral. Check in and check out were smooth and trouble free with a welcome juice and fruit provided on arrival. All staff were attentive, polite and ready to assist whenever they could. A great spot, close to the centre with restaurants and bars all around.", 'Very comfortable', "Your hotel is located nearly the Church, closely to walk to Old Quarter (5 mins).I need to leave the hotel early morning for taking bus to SAPA, and the staff is very nice to willing to help us to pack the breakfast to go.Besides that, when we come back again the day after, we are arranged the room with big king bed. It's comfortable for sleeping.For sure, I will stay here if I have chance to back to Hanoi. And recommend all people can stay here to earn the spirit of Hanoi.", 'thank you so much', 'Thank you so much for Amazon staying with beautyful bacony room. The room is big and nice. Stuff very freindly and breakfast has so many choice. I will be back. Would like to rezonans.']

reviews: ['vá»£ chá»“ng tÃ´i thá»±c sá»± Ä‘Ã£ cÃ³ 1 ká»³ nghá»‰ tuyá»‡t vá»i táº¡i Ä‘Ã¢y, khÃ¡ nhiá»u danh lam tháº¯ng cáº£nh, Ä‘á»‹a Ä‘iá»ƒm Äƒn uá»‘ng Ä‘Ã¡ng Ä‘á»ƒ thÆ°á»Ÿng thá»©c, 1 Ä‘iá»u cháº¯c cháº¯n lÃ  vá»£ chá»“ng tÃ´i sáº½ quay láº¡i Ä‘Ã¢y vÃ o 1 ngÃ y khÃ´ng xa, 1 ká»³ nghá»‰ Ä‘Ã¡ng nhá»› :)', 'RÃ¢t tot,', 'RÃ¢Ìt thiÌch hÆ¡Ì£p cho Ä‘i cÃ´ng taÌc ngÄƒÌn ngaÌ€y.\rBuffet khÃ´ng Ä‘a daÌ£ng lÄƒÌm. KhaÌch saÌ£n Æ¡Ì‰ rÃ¢Ìt gÃ¢Ì€n HÃ´Ì€ HoaÌ€n KiÃªÌm coÌ thÃªÌ‰ Ä‘i bÃ´Ì£ vaÌ€ khaÌ yÃªn tiÌƒnh. NÃ´Ì£i thÃ¢Ìt Ã¢Ìm cuÌng. Tuy nhien, coÌ veÌ‰ hÃªÌ£ thÃ´Ìng thoaÌt nuoc khÃ´ng tÃ´Ìt lÄƒÌm', 'PhÃ²ng ráº» ,nhÆ°á»£c Ä‘iá»ƒm khÃ´ng sáº¡ch sáº½ ,dá»‹ch vá»¥ khÃ´ng tá»‘t', 'very good', 'Staff very friendly and helpful. Good location and value for money. Okay breakfast as omelette was good. Our room had a bit of a mouldy smell, but that was probably bad luck, and the room size and bed were both good.', 'Right inside old quarter. Room is spacious. Staff is friendly and attentive. Reasonable spread of breakfast selection', 'I stayed here about 3 years ago and the condition of this hotel is showing its age. I think it needs an uplift soon. Other than that, nice hotel and great location. I didnâ€™t have the breakfast nor used the gym so I cannot comment on that. I had 2 rooms. One room had a hard bed and one had a soft pillow top which was nice. Worked fo us. So if when you book, I would request for the bed that you prefer and hopefully they can accommodate. My only complaint is the shower in my room 704. The shower head needs replacing, more water flows through the sides than through the shower head. And the shower door/window leaks water a bit so when u shower, the floor gets a little wet and itâ€™s slippery. The staff were wonderful. Spoke good English and attentive. Upstairs restaurant has a nice view of the lake. There is a great seafood restaurant near the hotel. When u walk out of the hotel, itâ€™s to ur right. Thereâ€™s 3 locations and they are the same restaurant.', 'I had a comfortable stay at the Hotel. They provide quality Halal food. The Hotel is near the old Quarters which is good for fellow shoppers. The room was comfortable The Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful and informative. Very easy to get Taxi from the Hotel.', "The check in is very fast, the staff served us ice tea whike waiting. The location is near to the old quater,  nearby there are many eating places. With the help of the front desk staff, we managed to rent  a motorbike. When we complained that it is faulty - the hotel staff help to contact the motorbike company to have it changed. There's anew Italian ice cream shop selling creep and various types of ice cream.", "Elsewhere this might get a better review, but in Hanoi visitors are spoilt for choice and there are better options in this price range (we stayed overnight in Hanoi on 3 separate occasions, each time in 3 star hotels). The room and bathroom were clean, new and well appointed. The breakfast was buffet style and typical of the high standard at this price point in Hanoi. There just wasn't anything exceptional about the room or service like we experienced elsewhere. Unfortunately the bed was also extremely hard, so much so that it was difficult to sleep.I had also ticked airport transfer when making the booking and as per Agoda's advice had tried to contact the hotel to confirm. They didn't reply and I therefore assumed that there would be no transfer. Nonetheless we looked for a sign when we arrived, but didn't see any so we proceeded to the hotel on our own. After we checked in, the manager called us and made his displeasure very clear that we had not taken the airport transfer which he claimed had been waiting for us. We thought we resolved this by explaining that we neither saw anyone waiting for us nor received any reply to my attempt to confirm the transfer. However, at checkout he presented us with a bill for the transfer. It took too much persistence from us to get him to withdraw it. This left us with a bit of a bad vibe about the place, especially compared the the warm friendly service (and comfortable beds) we experienced elsewhere in Vietnam.", 'It is a affordable hotel for traveler. The service very good, even i can print my web check-in boarding pass at the computer room and collect from the lobby. The staff very nice, helpful and try to facilitate. The location hotel also not so far from the old street, within a walking distance. Beside the hotel is a halal restaurant which suitable for muslim friends.', 'Since we were upgraded to a bigger room during our return from Halong Bay. It was the same layout as the suite room but only bigger in space. However, the same problem exists, that is, the wall is too thin and that we can hear the tv noise from the room beside us. However, this time, the neighbour was considerate and kept the volume to tolerable levels.\r\rOther than that, we liked the room very much due to its spaciousness. There is a huge bathtub, the biggest that we have ever had in our travels which was good for a nice long dip. Wifi was available and strong signal since the router is just outside the door.\r\rNice city view although the windows needed some cleaning. Close to the water puppet theatre and other eateries.', "This hotel was centrally located and affordable. It is just 3 mins walk to Hoan Kiem lake and there are many nice eating places and coffee shops nearby. The wifi was good and available throughout the hotel. The only problem is that the suites are placed next to each other and the walls are too thin, so the noise from the tv can be heard from the other room. We needed to get the staff to approach the next doors' guests to turn down the volume which they did so promptly.", 'This is my 2nd time staying in this hotel which I personally think is is underated at 3 star.The hotel is excellently located near shopping districts at old quarter but yet not nosiy that happens to most hotels nearby.Also it is very clean with modern layout and facilities with big bathtub.I would definately stay this hotel again.The only improvement it might consider to improve its star rating is more variety of food.', 'A new Hotel with convenient locations with access to food and entertainment within walkig distance. Hotel served with simple and yet acceptable breakfast and you have to ask for special serving like egg and noodles. Only set back is the water is not too hot and Air Con is too cold even with Max 32 degrees adjusted and I turned it off to keep warm but ended up too stuffy.', 'I have high expectations from the time I booked this hotel but unfortunately when arrived for\rcheck in was told by reception that Agoda had oversold the room\rso I have to transfer to a nearby boss hotel for 1 night stay.  The stay in boss hotel is so so\ras the hotel is just like any normal orinally Vietnamese run hotel.\rThe next day I was finally checked in with a room but as I have mentioned to them\rI want a king size bed so quite annoyed when given a twin room. But later on they did change for me. I thought the room size should be bigger on the photo in the web site but turn out to be quite average. I think with less money u can stay at Gondola or Golden silk boutique which is in same category. The Authentic hotel is closed to FIVI supermarket so will be quite convenience to get some drinks or titbits.\rI have breakfast and lunch in the 10 floor restaurant which nice view overlooking old quarter .', 'So close to the center and such a friendly staff! The hotel looks like completely new and the facilities are great (small gym) and the breakfast .... it is great! I was so surprised finding this hotel. It might be the reason to come back to Hanoi soon! We had a great stay and enjoyed every minute. I hope the can keep the price value rate, since that was the best ever for us!!', 'Beside the location and service also the rooms and facilities were excellent. The hotel is new and it feels, looks and experienced like that! They are even still building on the top of the hotel to extend it, but we had no any inconvenience of that building. The breakfast, welcome and front desk services were excellent too!! We will come back here!']

And how do we start with the service... Top notch and personable from ALL staffs .  We were made so welcomed and had our requests warmly catered to by Jasmine, Kelvin and Jake and every one we encountered. Outstanding and most highly recommended.', 'One of the BEST hotel especially the staff - namely jasmin, rosy, daniel, the other guy with eye glass and the 2 bellman. Arrived 3am and was really tired. Luckily, my room got upgraded to a family room. Very clean and service was exceptional, everyone was doing extra mile qnd asking if you need anything. Location is right at the center of the tourist area. I will DEFINITELY go back and stay again here. Kudos to the staff ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ»', 'Highly recommended! Itâ€™s a nice hotel. Clean, beautiful and have the best staffs.  All the staff are friendly and always smile. Especially Ms.Jasmine, she is so kind and always helpful. I stay there for 4 nights, if I come back to Hanoi, Iâ€™ll choose Hanoi emerald waters hotel trendy again.', 'I stayed here In between 3 day excursions for a total of 7 nights. My room for the first 3 nights was smaller than I expected for a deluxe double, but it was clean, quiet and the bed was quite comfy. I was upgraded to a lovely large room on my second 3 night stay.  The staff is amazing. When I returned for my second stay they were so excited to see me you would have thought I was long lost family. Everyone from the doorman to the reception staff to the concierge and manager ALL bend over backwards to ensure you have a great stay.  They booked a Hanoi city tour with car, driver and separate English-speaking guide who offered my friend and I a separate motorbike tour of farmlands just outside the city after the first tour ended that turned out to be so much fun!  They recommended fabulous vegetarian and non vegetarian restaurants and always greeted us so warmly whenever we returned to the hotel.  The doorman even walked us to our spa appointments! I highly recommend this hotel!', 'We were upgraded to city view room. Room size is similar to the one we booked. The room can be quite noisy during day time. Toliet is a bit small. Staff are mostly very friendly and helpful. They would check on us and see if we need any help whenever we pass by the reception.']

reviews: ['Bá»‹ Ä‘au Ä‘áº§u xin thuá»‘c Ä‘Æ°á»£c nhÃ¢n viÃªn mua cho mang lÃªn táº­n phÃ²ng vÃ  ráº¥t nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh. Very good', "Breakfast and showering system are big failures.Don't expect such a great value at this hotel.Just good for budget stay for a short period of time.", 'Good location and cosy hotel within old quarters', 'Thank you all staff of Splendid Pearlight Hotel especially Chu Chu, Hannah and Fiona however not forgeting the rest of the staff that we do not know all their names. They are always friendly and helpful on our queries  about anything.  Thank you for the hospitality.', 'I booked 3 nights at Pearlight.  When I reached hotel, my room was occupied. They sent me to 500m away named Symphony Hotel ( lower star hotel , their hotel also. ) At first, I thought  Is upgrade my stay.  However,  Symphony hotel is dark ( lobby, lift )  hotel , noisy renovation next to the hotel for 2 hours during mid night and 5:50am start noisy again.  Another reason is location far away from St Josephâ€™s Cathedral .  I complaint then they sent me back to stay another hotel named S Central ( opposite Pearlight).  They group have Symphony ( 500m away ), Pearlight, Star Grand & S Central next to each other.   Beware if you booked higher grade hotel, but was arranged to stay at lower grade hotel .   Star Grand has better / more variety breakfast than others.    I used to do online booking, first time this incident happened to me.  And I think is not right because they want to earn more cos I early booked in lower rate,  they use my room to rent out to other guests in higher rate )', 'The hotel is clean and big. near to the shopping, many food, spa, and local tour there. The staff so friendly and helpful. They can arrange car for pick up and drop off to the airport', 'The location in old quarter, near to the hoan kiem lake just walking around 10-15 minute.And around hotel is a lot of store and food. So nice. The staff also so helpfull and friendly.', 'we Arrived with 3 suitcases and when we got to the hotel  found out there was no elevator and my room was on the 7th floor..the staff was really nice and changed me to there sister hotel roght opposit.all staff was really nice and helpful specially DONG &HAIthank you very much  to all the staffroom was really large and aircon should be left on 24/7', 'Cut-water for whole stay, terrible facility, never come back', 'I recommend it. The staff are really friendly. Meals are also good. It is cheap and good for family travelers with children. Please note that there is no elevator.', "I recommend it. The staff are really friendly. Meals are also good. It's best. Please note that there is no elevator.", 'I recommend you guys to check in here because, eventhough the building is small yet the room is big and nice. Plus, the receptionist are always in welcome mode which give positive vibes. The hotel give the very best hospitality and services in which you can imagine you were in 4/5 star hotel.', 'Not as good as the stars they have as a rating', 'Big thank', 'There was a reservation stuff up from Agoda. The staff organised a mattress for us , carrying a double up 4 flights. They helped us with a late check out and were more than helpful with any request. The location is great, the only downer was the church bells at 5 am. But everything was close.  The room was clean and big with 2 queen sized beds.  Breakfast was good with a decent selection of local and western foods. If we go back to Hanoi  will stay there again.', "We had a family room with 2 king sized beds, very comfortable. The room was spacious and had a balcony looking out onto St Joseph's Cathedral. Check in and check out were smooth and trouble free with a welcome juice and fruit provided on arrival. All staff were attentive, polite and ready to assist whenever they could. A great spot, close to the centre with restaurants and bars all around.", 'Very comfortable', "Your hotel is located nearly the Church, closely to walk to Old Quarter (5 mins).I need to leave the hotel early morning for taking bus to SAPA, and the staff is very nice to willing to help us to pack the breakfast to go.Besides that, when we come back again the day after, we are arranged the room with big king bed. It's comfortable for sleeping.For sure, I will stay here if I have chance to back to Hanoi. And recommend all people can stay here to earn the spirit of Hanoi.", 'thank you so much', 'Thank you so much for Amazon staying with beautyful bacony room. The room is big and nice. Stuff very freindly and breakfast has so many choice. I will be back. Would like to rezonans.']

KhaÌch saÌ£n Æ¡Ì‰ rÃ¢Ìt gÃ¢Ì€n HÃ´Ì€ HoaÌ€n KiÃªÌm coÌ thÃªÌ‰ Ä‘i bÃ´Ì£ vaÌ€ khaÌ yÃªn tiÌƒnh. NÃ´Ì£i thÃ¢Ìt Ã¢Ìm cuÌng. Tuy nhien, coÌ veÌ‰ hÃªÌ£ thÃ´Ìng thoaÌt nuoc khÃ´ng tÃ´Ìt lÄƒÌm', 'PhÃ²ng ráº» ,nhÆ°á»£c Ä‘iá»ƒm khÃ´ng sáº¡ch sáº½ ,dá»‹ch vá»¥ khÃ´ng tá»‘t', 'very good', 'Staff very friendly and helpful. Good location and value for money. Okay breakfast as omelette was good. Our room had a bit of a mouldy smell, but that was probably bad luck, and the room size and bed were both good.', 'Right inside old quarter. Room is spacious. Staff is friendly and attentive. Reasonable spread of breakfast selection', 'I stayed here about 3 years ago and the condition of this hotel is showing its age. I think it needs an uplift soon. Other than that, nice hotel and great location. I didnâ€™t have the breakfast nor used the gym so I cannot comment on that. I had 2 rooms. One room had a hard bed and one had a soft pillow top which was nice. Worked fo us. So if when you book, I would request for the bed that you prefer and hopefully they can accommodate. My only complaint is the shower in my room 704. The shower head needs replacing, more water flows through the sides than through the shower head. And the shower door/window leaks water a bit so when u shower, the floor gets a little wet and itâ€™s slippery. The staff were wonderful. Spoke good English and attentive. Upstairs restaurant has a nice view of the lake. There is a great seafood restaurant near the hotel. When u walk out of the hotel, itâ€™s to ur right. Thereâ€™s 3 locations and they are the same restaurant.', 'I had a comfortable stay at the Hotel. They provide quality Halal food. The Hotel is near the old Quarters which is good for fellow shoppers. The room was comfortable The Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful and informative. Very easy to get Taxi from the Hotel.', "The check in is very fast, the staff served us ice tea whike waiting. The location is near to the old quater,  nearby there are many eating places. With the help of the front desk staff, we managed to rent  a motorbike. When we complained that it is faulty - the hotel staff help to contact the motorbike company to have it changed. There's anew Italian ice cream shop selling creep and various types of ice cream.", "Elsewhere this might get a better review, but in Hanoi visitors are spoilt for choice and there are better options in this price range (we stayed overnight in Hanoi on 3 separate occasions, each time in 3 star hotels). The room and bathroom were clean, new and well appointed. The breakfast was buffet style and typical of the high standard at this price point in Hanoi. There just wasn't anything exceptional about the room or service like we experienced elsewhere. Unfortunately the bed was also extremely hard, so much so that it was difficult to sleep.I had also ticked airport transfer when making the booking and as per Agoda's advice had tried to contact the hotel to confirm. They didn't reply and I therefore assumed that there would be no transfer. Nonetheless we looked for a sign when we arrived, but didn't see any so we proceeded to the hotel on our own. After we checked in, the manager called us and made his displeasure very clear that we had not taken the airport transfer which he claimed had been waiting for us. We thought we resolved this by explaining that we neither saw anyone waiting for us nor received any reply to my attempt to confirm the transfer. However, at checkout he presented us with a bill for the transfer. It took too much persistence from us to get him to withdraw it. This left us with a bit of a bad vibe about the place, especially compared the the warm friendly service (and comfortable beds) we experienced elsewhere in Vietnam.", 'It is a affordable hotel for traveler. The service very good, even i can print my web check-in boarding pass at the computer room and collect from the lobby. The staff very nice, helpful and try to facilitate. The location hotel also not so far from the old street, within a walking distance. Beside the hotel is a halal restaurant which suitable for muslim friends.', 'Since we were upgraded to a bigger room during our return from Halong Bay. It was the same layout as the suite room but only bigger in space. However, the same problem exists, that is, the wall is too thin and that we can hear the tv noise from the room beside us. However, this time, the neighbour was considerate and kept the volume to tolerable levels.\r\rOther than that, we liked the room very much due to its spaciousness. There is a huge bathtub, the biggest that we have ever had in our travels which was good for a nice long dip. Wifi was available and strong signal since the router is just outside the door.\r\rNice city view although the windows needed some cleaning. Close to the water puppet theatre and other eateries.', "This hotel was centrally located and affordable. It is just 3 mins walk to Hoan Kiem lake and there are many nice eating places and coffee shops nearby. The wifi was good and available throughout the hotel. The only problem is that the suites are placed next to each other and the walls are too thin, so the noise from the tv can be heard from the other room. We needed to get the staff to approach the next doors' guests to turn down the volume which they did so promptly.", 'This is my 2nd time staying in this hotel which I personally think is is underated at 3 star.The hotel is excellently located near shopping districts at old quarter but yet not nosiy that happens to most hotels nearby.Also it is very clean with modern layout and facilities with big bathtub.I would definately stay this hotel again.The only improvement it might consider to improve its star rating is more variety of food.', 'A new Hotel with convenient locations with access to food and entertainment within walkig distance. Hotel served with simple and yet acceptable breakfast and you have to ask for special serving like egg and noodles. Only set back is the water is not too hot and Air Con is too cold even with Max 32 degrees adjusted and I turned it off to keep warm but ended up too stuffy.', 'I have high expectations from the time I booked this hotel but unfortunately when arrived for\rcheck in was told by reception that Agoda had oversold the room\rso I have to transfer to a nearby boss hotel for 1 night stay.  The stay in boss hotel is so so\ras the hotel is just like any normal orinally Vietnamese run hotel.\rThe next day I was finally checked in with a room but as I have mentioned to them\rI want a king size bed so quite annoyed when given a twin room. But later on they did change for me. I thought the room size should be bigger on the photo in the web site but turn out to be quite average. I think with less money u can stay at Gondola or Golden silk boutique which is in same category. The Authentic hotel is closed to FIVI supermarket so will be quite convenience to get some drinks or titbits.\rI have breakfast and lunch in the 10 floor restaurant which nice view overlooking old quarter .', 'So close to the center and such a friendly staff! The hotel looks like completely new and the facilities are great (small gym) and the breakfast .... it is great! I was so surprised finding this hotel. It might be the reason to come back to Hanoi soon! We had a great stay and enjoyed every minute. I hope the can keep the price value rate, since that was the best ever for us!!', 'Beside the location and service also the rooms and facilities were excellent. The hotel is new and it feels, looks and experienced like that! They are even still building on the top of the hotel to extend it, but we had no any inconvenience of that building. The breakfast, welcome and front desk services were excellent too!! We will come back here!']

reviews: ['Cháº¥t lÆ°á»£ng phÃ²ng á»‘c tá»‘t, cÃ³ há»“ bÆ¡i, nhÃ¢n viÃªn nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh', 'NÆ¡i á»Ÿ thuáº­n tiá»‡n cho viá»‡c Ä‘i láº¡i vÃ  cÃ³ há»“ bÆ¡i Ä‘á»ƒ thÆ° giáº£n.Sáº½ quay láº¡i.HÃ´m Ä‘Ã³ chá»‰ bá»‹ 1 lá»—i nhá» Ä‘áº·t view há»“ bÆ¡i nhÆ°ng khi nháº­n láº¡i ko giao Ä‘Ãºng nhÆ°ng cÅ©ng ko pháº£i lÃ  lá»—i lá»›n.', 'TÃ´i Ä‘Ã£ á»Ÿ Ä‘Ã¢y 3 Ä‘Ãªm ,má»i thá»© á»Ÿ Ä‘Ã¢y Ä‘á»u ráº¥t tuyá»‡t . Sáº½ quay láº¡i khi Ä‘áº¿n HÃ  Ná»™i .', 'Location is in the heart of the Old Quarter, walking distance to plenty of sites, museums, restaurants. Breakfast was adequate. Staff was very helpful in suggesting activities to do during the day. Hostel also offers a free walking tour but I didnâ€™t not have time to do this.Hostel can be a little noisy in the afternoon and early evening around beer hour, so may not be the best for people looking for some quiet. But if youâ€™re out and about doing stuff until late itâ€™s not a problem.', 'A lot of shop and also the night is near there.. that is very convenience..', "This is a luxury hostel. It's a perfect combination of the social vibe of a good hostel, and the cleanliness and comfort of a nice hotel. Clean towels, comfortable beds with very air conditioned rooms, and curtains around the dorm beds for privacy!", "The hostel is really nice and clean, they offer a delicious breakfast with many choices and free beer in the evening, there's a pool too and the staff is great, especially Phuc who was very friendly and super helpful. The free walking tour with him was great and insightful as well. I recommend Little Charm.", 'I had an enjoyable stay at Little Charm.  The location was perfect and right in the middle of all the happs.  The big Turtle lake is a 5-7 min walk away maybe.  The facilities were clean and the staff is amazing at helping with anything you need to get around.  I would definitely recommend this hostel', 'Apart from that aazing buffet breakfast and free beer, that Free Walking Tour should be on your list because Mr.Ha and Mr.Phuc will never disappoint. They were both patient with me knowing I walk too slow with my cane and helped me all the way. Being PWD is not a problem in this place. I will definitely be back! I loved my stay here.', 'If only all hostels could be like this one. Tidy and smart decor, everything was clean and in good repair. The beds were comfy, the linens were clean, and you get a fresh towel everyday if you want one. The lockers were spacious and the privacy curtains were great at keeping the light out. The pool was clean and a nice treat. The showers were hot and the bathrooms were clean with good facilities, great lighting and plugs for hair and make up. The breakfast was superb and the staff spoke reasonable english and could help with anything. The restaurant was also very tasty and reasonably priced. Great location in the old quarter. And the best laundry service I have ever used, it was all so fresh smelling and actually clean.', "It's a remarkably pretty hostel and has nice amenities.The shower stalls are a bit tight and it'd be nicer if they had a place where you could place your things so they don't get splashed on while you shower, but it wasn't that big a deal.Good breakfast selection and the free beer from 5:30-6:00 was a nice touch.", "I've tried three top hostels in Hanoi and I can say this is the best among the best. It's still very new (6 months if I'm not miskaken). It has a very cool swimming pool. Staff were very polite, extremely friendly and very helpful. I highly recommend this hostel.", 'Breakfast free beer free bedroom clean', 'As lovely as this hostel is I can not recommend it to others until itâ€™s policy on providing drinking water from sustainable sources, i.e. not plastic bottles, changes.Initially I asked to refill my water bottle but was refused as its against hostel policy, despite seeing staff drinking from a filtered water tap at the bar. A few emails later I was given approval to have my bottle refilled from this tap. The reasons given for this policy are half baked. #1 the pipes are old, #2 one customer said the water upset their stomach when the hostel previously offered this service. I doubt theyâ€™d shut the kitchen if the same happened with the food. We all have a responsibility to treat our planet with care and this hostel is falling short.Other than that the hostel was great apart from staff checking guests into the dorm at 1am and turning the lights on.', 'Really nice hostel in the Old Quarter area. Nice facilities (including swimming pool), staff is very friendly, attentive, and well versed in English; one of the staff speak Spanish.I gave a four star to facilities due to an incident (not serious, at least)... the stairs to the swimming pool are very slippery; I slid on them and fortunately nothing serious happened. I talked with the staff and they said they will report to management. Hope they really do something for the safety of guests using the pool.Besides that, highly recommended place, good value for money, and location is superb!', 'Alex is friendly and helpful so are the other staff. Free day tour by Ha was very enjoyable. The bartender Tung is a great guy, had good conversations with him, very helpful too. This hostel has an atmosphere unique of its own, a great place to hang out with other backpackers. I made good friends here.The Pho Ga that I had here is the best I ever had anywhere in Vietnam.', 'First impression was my first step into this lovely hostel. I stayed there 4 nights. Staff were doing amazing job. I love breakfast choices as well as other foods and beverages. Room, bed, bathroom were super clean. Fast WiFi (as I have to work I need this). Great location, easy to walk around Old Quarter. I will stay here again next time.', 'Super nice staff, especially Mr. Ha!', "I had only one night stay but it's really nice. They offering 3 hrs free walking tour it quite nice. Mr. Ha and Mr. Phuc are from local guys have more in-depth knowledge about the area. We were 10 ppl from the hostel started from Temple Bach ma then we went to food street (dong xuan).. many local foods availabile. Good for street photography. Then we went famous local market complex. After that we went to the long bien bridge. They told history of the bridge. View from the bridge was amazing. In last we went to the train street. We waited for the train between we all had some beers and coffees. The view is so good. With little drizzle we reached to the hostel. If any one visiting Hanoi stay in little charm and your first would be walking to thats you can make new friends... Chit chats.", 'I will recommend this hostel to every backpacker!I stay in this hostel for seven days.The environment is clean and good.The locker are all new and safe.The staff are polite and kind.I like free draft beer time and good music in afternoon and I always drink three bottles!I will book this hostel when I visit Hanoi next time!']

reviews: ['Tá»‘t', 'We checked into the hotel. The entrance is quite nice and has statues of dragons etc.  Then we were taken to our lake view room. We found 3 â€œoffâ€ bananas with approx 20 fruit fly around them. Not what you want really and not very appetizing either!After the looking at the room I requested a higher floor room as the view was not so good. Also the bed linen looked â€œusedâ€ which were pointed out to the hotel staff who seemed to think it was acceptable to walk around in your room with bare feet. We were moved to another room. Multiple cleanliness issues; under bed hadnâ€™t been cleaned properly in a long time, bedside table had coffee/tea cup stains on from the previous guest - worst was the toilet with an assortment of hairs left for us in full view. Also massive mark on bedsheet which was visible as soon as you walk in. The whole lot of issues brought into question my trust for them and in turn we decided it best to check out. Therefore unfortunately I would not recommend this hotel', 'No elevator, but they have staff who will carry your luggage.Breakfast is not buffet, but they have really good food!They allow you to leave your luggage at the reception for storage. And they gave us free water when we went back for our bags even if we were checked out already.', 'No elevator but the staff will carry your luggage to the room.Plated breakfast, but food is good.', 'This is a a great place to stay at. Across the street from West Lake the hotel is archtecturally beautiful, the rooms are spacious and everything works efficiently. The breakfast was quite good. The staff are very hospitable and courteous. The main guy at the front desk is a young man who lived in England for a while and speak a very good English. He was very helpful in providing me with all kinds of information about Hanoi. I would want to stay at this place again if I went back to Hanoi. I would give this hotel a rating of 9.0.', 'Interesting style. Large room for price. Usable fridge. Oldish fittings but in keeping with place. Breakfast inedible, but lots of places nearby.', 'Really nice place - large rooms .   Only thing that upset me was the minimal selection of breakfast and inability to get a refill cup of coffee - even if you offered to pay.   ( ultra small coffee cup not sufficient)One star meaning breakfast was very disappointing', 'Good hotel nice and clean , staff were relaxed and helpful', 'Very relaxed hotel, near to everything you need', 'Good location near good restaurants on Tay ho  lake', 'The staff is very supportive and friendly, the space is clean. The hotel is very unique in term of decoration. And since it is located by the West Lake, you can get a chance to walk around this beautiful lake with a great view. Def coming back!', "A good location, staff very helpful, you couldn't ask for more.", 'Rooms were unclean. Especially bathrooms.My Air-conditioner only worked on occasion.Mosquitoes in the room.', 'A good room that was very suitable for my family while visiting me here. Staff were very accommodating and helpful.', 'Architecture was really nice, room spaceous, shower water heater perfectlly working, staff were nice.', 'I booked 3 nights at this hotel based on reviews on this site. When I arrived I was given a filthy room reeking of cigarette smoke. After complaining the room was supposedly cleaned however the filth behind the fridge and bathroom was still there but at least the smoke smell was gone. After travelling for more than14 hours I needed sleep so I was forced to stay the night but left the next day and had to find alternative accommodation myself. This was my 5th visit to Hanoi and this was the most expensive and worst hotel I have every stayed in. Despite complaints to agoda they are still changing me for the one night I had to endure in this dreadful place.', "Don't miss the fish pond.  Great staff and services.", 'Good', 'Big clean room with west lake view is really good. I love their chinese style statues decorated in room and lobby. Without  lift, hotel staff has provided good care for us. Hotel also provide 1 day trip it may suit to anyone who travel alone. All of that, thank all staffs there for your good take care.']

Vá»Š trÃ­ Ä‘á»‹a Ä‘iá»ƒm ráº¥t thuáº­n lá»£i.', 'I really hate to give a bad review! On the first day, the bathtub stopper did not work. We called for assistance. The handyman showed up but didn\'t fix it. He didn\'t care. The facility is so poor that you can hear street noises day and night (we had a "luxury" suite). We were miserable to cope with the lack of soundproof for a decent rest.  On the second day, we had to call to get the room cleaned. A man and a woman came and spent a shocking five minutes to clean the room. As they were about to leave, I had to ask them to mop the floor. They didn\'t care! They didn\'t clean the tea/coffee counter. They didn\'t clean the counter on the left side of the sink.  By the way, three electrical outlets didn\'t work. The USB outlet by the desk didn\'t work.  The breakfast food was suboptimal for the price they charged the luxury suite. I wished that I could check out and move to a different hotel for the remainder of our stay but I had already paid for five nights through Agoda. Will not recommend.', 'From Thailand ,Good location with friendly and helpful staff.', 'I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The location is very good and the Staff especially were excellent.Especially TRACY AND VU THUY LY. They were very kind to me and my GF.They will help in any way you wish. Their exchange rate to the Usd is better at this hotel than any money changer in town.  Breakfast is very nice.', 'Good cleanliness, comfy room, good services and hospitality. Nice breakfast and consumptives. Wonderful located at the heart of Old Quarter zone and close to Hoan Kiem Lake. Many shops, restaurants, cafe and bar surrounded. Worth for your pennies. Recommend.', 'Stayed at junior suite level 8. Corridor area quite dim. Per level around 5 or 6 rooms maximum. Room is big and comfortable big King bed (even for twin beds which my friends stayed along, also comfortable). However, the bathroom filled with water from the standing shower area. Have to use all available towels to lay on the floor to prevent slipping. Food and shopping is easily available. Overall a nice hotel to stay as staff are also vey polite and speaks English.', 'Great room- comfortable bed and very spacious for anywhere let alone Hanoi. Love that the decor is true to the Vietnamese heritage. Location is excellent as it is close to the old quarter and Lake. Breakfast was OK, nothing to rave about, the quality could be a lot better. Staff were great, very friendly.', 'the presidential suite balcony is very dirty... there is no table outside to sit and relax. the jacuzzi inside presidential suite is perfect. what i find uncomfortable is the manager during breakfast to be served by her staff, i know it is her privilege to have breakfast but i find it not pleasant to the eyes seeing all your staff serving you like a queen and all other quests go to the buffet table to get food. or she can do self serve, the buffet table is easy to access. nothing against her anyway...the good thing about this hotel are their staff, very friendly and accomodating, even during check out, a staff gave us tea- well done!!!', 'Rooms are reasonable size and is clean.  The staff at reception are very nice and can speak English well.  The location is near to Silk street which is rather convenience to walk around the old quarter area.', 'I so loved this hotel. Its smack in the middle of the market district. 10 minute walk to the "lake" not sure of the name, sorry. Restaurants are in abundance. The staff are very helpful and friendly. I loved the hustle and bustle of this area. Its close proximity to the multi story shopping complex which has all the couture  clothing. I don\'t know the name of the shopping centre but its on the far side of the lake. I\'m sure hotel staff would know as its the only one in the area. Great hotel and would definitely stay there again. So enjoy', "I was very welll-pleased with the hotel, both with their location in the old quarter and with the decor & size of the room and it's amenities. The included buffet breakfast served one of the best phos in the area!"]

Vá»Š trÃ­ Ä‘á»‹a Ä‘iá»ƒm ráº¥t thuáº­n lá»£i.', 'I really hate to give a bad review! On the first day, the bathtub stopper did not work. We called for assistance. The handyman showed up but didn\'t fix it. He didn\'t care. The facility is so poor that you can hear street noises day and night (we had a "luxury" suite). We were miserable to cope with the lack of soundproof for a decent rest.  On the second day, we had to call to get the room cleaned. A man and a woman came and spent a shocking five minutes to clean the room. As they were about to leave, I had to ask them to mop the floor. They didn\'t care! They didn\'t clean the tea/coffee counter. They didn\'t clean the counter on the left side of the sink.  By the way, three electrical outlets didn\'t work. The USB outlet by the desk didn\'t work.  The breakfast food was suboptimal for the price they charged the luxury suite. I wished that I could check out and move to a different hotel for the remainder of our stay but I had already paid for five nights through Agoda. Will not recommend.', 'From Thailand ,Good location with friendly and helpful staff.', 'I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The location is very good and the Staff especially were excellent.Especially TRACY AND VU THUY LY. They were very kind to me and my GF.They will help in any way you wish. Their exchange rate to the Usd is better at this hotel than any money changer in town.  Breakfast is very nice.', 'Good cleanliness, comfy room, good services and hospitality. Nice breakfast and consumptives. Wonderful located at the heart of Old Quarter zone and close to Hoan Kiem Lake. Many shops, restaurants, cafe and bar surrounded. Worth for your pennies. Recommend.', 'Stayed at junior suite level 8. Corridor area quite dim. Per level around 5 or 6 rooms maximum. Room is big and comfortable big King bed (even for twin beds which my friends stayed along, also comfortable). However, the bathroom filled with water from the standing shower area. Have to use all available towels to lay on the floor to prevent slipping. Food and shopping is easily available. Overall a nice hotel to stay as staff are also vey polite and speaks English.', 'Great room- comfortable bed and very spacious for anywhere let alone Hanoi. Love that the decor is true to the Vietnamese heritage. Location is excellent as it is close to the old quarter and Lake. Breakfast was OK, nothing to rave about, the quality could be a lot better. Staff were great, very friendly.', 'the presidential suite balcony is very dirty... there is no table outside to sit and relax. the jacuzzi inside presidential suite is perfect. what i find uncomfortable is the manager during breakfast to be served by her staff, i know it is her privilege to have breakfast but i find it not pleasant to the eyes seeing all your staff serving you like a queen and all other quests go to the buffet table to get food. or she can do self serve, the buffet table is easy to access. nothing against her anyway...the good thing about this hotel are their staff, very friendly and accomodating, even during check out, a staff gave us tea- well done!!!', 'Rooms are reasonable size and is clean.  The staff at reception are very nice and can speak English well.  The location is near to Silk street which is rather convenience to walk around the old quarter area.', 'I so loved this hotel. Its smack in the middle of the market district. 10 minute walk to the "lake" not sure of the name, sorry. Restaurants are in abundance. The staff are very helpful and friendly. I loved the hustle and bustle of this area. Its close proximity to the multi story shopping complex which has all the couture  clothing. I don\'t know the name of the shopping centre but its on the far side of the lake. I\'m sure hotel staff would know as its the only one in the area. Great hotel and would definitely stay there again. So enjoy', "I was very welll-pleased with the hotel, both with their location in the old quarter and with the decor & size of the room and it's amenities. The included buffet breakfast served one of the best phos in the area!"]

Cáº£m Æ¡n Labevie team nhiá»u.', 'KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n ngay trung tÃ¢m,Ä‘i bá»™ tá»›i há»“ gÆ°Æ¡m gáº§n,nhÃ¢n viÃªn nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh,phÃ²ng hÆ¡i nhá» vÃ  cÅ©', 'KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n náº±m á»Ÿ vá»‹ trÃ­ thuáº­n tiá»‡n.CÃ³ má»™t Ä‘iá»ƒm nhá» khÃ´ng hÃ i lÃ²ng: TÃ´i book phÃ²ng family suite, trÃªn web ghi rÃµ lÃ  cho 4 ngÆ°á»i (2 ngÆ°á»i lá»›n, 2 tráº» em), nhÆ°ng khi tá»›i nÆ¡i thÃ¬ chá»‰ cÃ³ 1 giÆ°á»ng Ä‘Ã´i (cho 1 ngÆ°á»i) vÃ  1 giÆ°á»ng Ä‘Æ¡n (cho 1 ngÆ°á»i). Gia Ä‘Ã¬nh tÃ´i pháº£i tráº£i Ä‘á»‡m xuá»‘ng Ä‘áº¥t Ä‘á»ƒ ngá»§.', 'We enjoyed our stay at Labevie very much! Breakfast was very nice and our rooms were clean and we received complimentary water and tea each day. It is located in the Old Quarter and a short distance to many restaurants, bars, and a majority of the sites. Great value for your money. My only problem was the bathroom was for some reason really hot!', 'We really appreciate their service. We canâ€™t forget the welcome drink - banana smoothie. AWESOME. The concierge carried all our luggageâ€™s and receptionist sent us to the room personally. Breakfast is lovely. We informed the staff that we need to check out at 4am and they slept at the counter just for us. They packed the breakfast for us even when we check out at 4am. The service is beyond our expectations and love to stay again.', 'Fantastic hotel to stay in Hanoi. Location is superb and staffs are extremely friendly. Location of hotel is within walking distance to Xoi yen, Giang coffee, Bun Cha ta, Hoan Kiem lake and Trang Tien plaza etc. Staffs are super friendly and helpful. Ms Nga who contact me before my trip to enquire about my stay in Hanoi and if I am looking for trips to Sapa and Halong bay etc. Get her to book. You will not be disappointed. She will meet your budget and expectation to the limit (give and take in minor arrangements). Mr Sun who was at reception will ensure you have a good stay everyday. Breakfast is very basic but they fried very good sunnyside up. Basic price for basic hotel with superb services. Please note the rooms has very nostalgic layout with the door needs to be key locked. Tourists who looks for superb staff service, good budget hotel and nostalgic layout room, this is it. Lastly, fresh towel everyday from lovely housekeeping. My top recommendation for Hanoi stay.', 'The staff at this hotel offered the best services at par with 5 star properties in the country. Very courteous, friendly, hospitable, caring & kind. I can use all the adjectives to describe them. Much of this credit goes to Mr Sun at the Reception who went out of his way to help me sort the much needed extension cord for my computer so I can work! He also made sure that my stay remained pleasant and indeed! I appreciated very much his support and kindIf I could give him more than 5 stars rating, I would! He is a â€œgemâ€ worth keeping! I hope the management will provide him the much needed pay rise or if not promotion as well as to other staff who deserves this. I also would like to take this opportunity to thank the hotel management & staff for the upgrade on my last night of stay! It was a very pleasant surprise for me! The last surprise I got when I checked out were the beautiful handmade card and the rice cakes for me to take home! I was so touched by this gesture. I will definitely recommend this hotel. Book in advance as their rooms sold out fast! My very best wishes to everyone at Labevie Hotel for a wonderful new year ahead!', "I received several WhatsApp messages from a staff member from the hotel prior to my arrival to advertise tour packages and airport transfers which I found to be intrusive and annoying. Beyond that, I stayed for a week and got a balcony room, and it was well lit and a good space.  The breakfast is incredibly basic and nothing to complain about or praise. WiFi in the room was mostly good except it cut out one evening and took until noon the next day to fix. Relatively quiet compared to other Old Quarter hotels that I've stayed at.", "Mr. Tiep Le and his staff were all gracious hosts from the moment we walked in. They welcomed us with a drink and then sat us down to show us the various landmarks around Hanoi, where to shop, etc. Then we discussed what tours we may want to purchase. We already had a 3d2n Halong Bay cruise in mind and when we mentioned it, they quickly contacted the cruise line and got us booked slightly cheaper than we could have ourselves. After the cruise, which was spectacular, we spent another night at the hotel before departing for a 3 day tour of Sapa that Mr. Tiep Le set up for us. We would have been lost on this one without him. He sent us off in a taxi and had one of his staff follow us on his motorbike to make sure we make it onto the train without any problems, and carrying our bags for us each step of the way. Truly VIP service. At the Lao Cai station we were greeted by a man holding a sheet with our names who guided us to our bus which took us to our hotel. We had the standard room with no window which was quite small but suited our needs. The hotel has an elevator which was convenient with our heavy bags and the room was clean when we arrived. The only problem we had with the room was a clogged shower drain but we informed the staff before we left for Halong Bay and it was fixed before we got back. They also had all of the luggage we left behind ready in our room for us before our arrival. There's a decent selection of food for breakfast including a nice spread of fruit and the chef can make a delicious bowl of pho. We were overall very pleased with the 3 nights we spent at Labevie Hotel.", 'The room is clean and spacious. The staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast is great. The location is convenient. The cost is very good. The only two issues are shower water temperature fluctuate and the pillow is too thick. Other that these, no complaint! Strongly recommended.']

NÃ³i chung vá»›i táº§m tiá»n vá»«a pháº£i thÃ¬ Ä‘Ã¢y cÅ©ng lÃ  1 lá»±a chá»n tá»‘t.', 'phong oc sach se, nhan vien than thiet, hop tui tien.', 'No pros, we had no wifi for our full stay ever after we complained as soon as we arrived, shower was broken and filthy. No soap provided. AC was broken after 2nd night. Strong smell of sewage from the toilet vent. Very unprofessional customer service since the receptionist was on their phone and you had to call them for attention.  I highly recommend looking for somewhere else.', "The receptionists are extremely nice, I even befriended one of them! It's situated in the old quaters. The breakfast is nice, serving both local food and westernized breakfast. There is free wifi. The place is a little worn down, so don't expect too much, but the price is very affordable. I move around a lot by day, only going back to shower and rest, so it was good enough for me.", "it's not the best hotel but the most worth it. the price comes with free breakfast and the toilet is clean, the bed has hair though which might mean they didn't change the sheets before us but im not sure. couldnt complain because i didnt want to pay more.", 'It really needs to be renovated, the staff and cleanliness was good but the rooms get too old now', 'This hotel is a black inn waiting to catch customer by surprise to steal whatever valuable they can laid their hands on.  Have stayed for 4 days but on the 5th day, was caught by surprise when cleaning staff took the unusual breakfast time to clean the room and made off with US200 from my luggage bag and substituted fake hell note of US$200 to cover up for the theft. No management staff was around and the receptionist took upon herself investigate after my complaint but it was a clear-cut tip off and a cover up. Nothing came off from my complaint and police report as amount was not significant enough to warrant an investigation from district police. Very disappointed with the protection racket where locals can do no wrong.', 'At first: the hotel is good and no one wouldnâ€™t get annoyed of booking it, but you would also find better places for the same price. Unfortunately our room had no window and this was the worst fact of all. Because of the missing naturell ventilation the room smelled a bit moist. The room was jaded, but clean. The breakfast was okay, nothing special. The location is very good, the staff very friendly and they offer a fast (and expensive) laundry service.', 'Great location - 15 min walk from all the activities in the old quarter. Good value for money, very nice and helping staff. Clean room with very strong Wi-Fi in each room, strong shower with hot water. Highly recommended!', 'Nobody was at the reception at 7am til 730 and I almost missed the bus to Sapa because my\rtravel company was trying to call but nobody was able to answer. The breakfast was good. The shower gets either too hot or cold., nothing between. The room was spacious for a person and had a window. Not noisy like the other street but still close to the main tourist area.\rExcept for the poor staff service it was okay.', 'Nearby here have a lot handicraft shop, trandisional shop, local food and train station. Very convenient for walk around to see the local market, people, daily activities at hanoi. Also near to Ho Kiem Lake by walking distance.', 'I stayed at the Charming Hotel for 4 days and it was a wonderful experience. For under $ 20 per night ( which included a big breakfast) it was great value. The room was not flashy but very comfortable and clean. Jenny and her staff went out of their  way to help me book tours ,organise taxis and recommended excellent places to eat. The icing on the cake was when I accidentally left my passport on the bus ( yes I know, pretty dumb huh) and Jenny called the bus company to track it down. ( Yes, it was found) and then another staff member drove me to the office to pick it up. All this was just part of their service ( no tips or extra charges). When I return to Hanoi this Hotel will be my first stop. Thanks Jenny and Staff ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€', "Based on Agoda's high rating and its location, I was a returning customer on 3 occasions. However on my last stay on May 14, 2017 I discovered that the hotel is a black inn.  I lost US$200 when housekeeping without notice came to carry daily cleaning when I was having my breakfast (which is quite abnormal as most other days, it was usually after breakfast around checkout or lunch time). The hotel management is no where to be found and the front counter/receptionist took everything under her control to defend the housekeeping staff even pre-empting them of my request for a search. Nevertheless with the help of one of the hotel staff, I lodged a police report. I maybe fortunate that the hotel thief was ethical enough not to steal all my money (US$650 + Ringgit 545) but just substituted two pieces of genuine US$100 notes with 2 hell US$100 notes, so that I can burn the hell money for the thief's use in her next life. A note of caution to share with unsuspecting traveller, do check your US$ notes before using them, as your genuine notes may have been substituted with fake US$ hell notes by this hotel scam.", 'this hotel is very well located, the staff are the sweetest and most helpful staff in any hotel, we had Anna and Jenny help us with anything we asked, rooms are super clean. I suggest to try the Vietnamese breakfast ( included in the price of the hotel) is the best noodle soup in town !!  we went to halong Bay an Sapa and both times returned to this hotel in Hanoi !!', 'I had nothing to complain about this hotel....really a good choice for what I paid for. Hehe', 'The hotel replace my booking room with bad room. There is not clean,no tissue soap shampoo etc...And wrote a mail to me said they will upgrade my room,but got nothing.When i complain to Agoda,the hotel said I had check the room mean I accept it.But the true is they wrote me the letter and not answer my question till midnight.Must be carefull for this hotel.', 'The hotel (split across 3 buildings a few meters from each other) is in an ideal location for the old town and Hoan Keim lake, so that you are only a couple of minutes walk away from plenty of restaurants, tourist sites etc.Our "Superior room" was clean, had plenty of space, desk, good internet connection and a decent bathroom. The only comment I would make is that if you find stairs difficult, check with the hotel in advance to see if a room on a lower floor is available.Although our only dealings with the staff were on arrival/departure, the staff were helpful and friendly, with reasonable English.We would be more than happy to use this hotel again on any future visit to Hanoi.', 'Especen is a great place to start your journey in Vietnam. â€œYour home in Hanoiâ€ is their catch phrase. I pre booked my airport transport and all tours on line with Thanh. When I arrived â€œMr Einâ€ took me to the local shop to arrange a local SIM and 3G internet. A secure hotel in a central location. Good English skills ensuring no problems. But learn a few Vietnam words with the Especen staff. Iâ€™m coming back....... Yes I did have a great time.', 'No elevator in several buildings.  Check if the rooms have windows', 'Very accessible!', 'Bad location and dirty', 'We stayed in three different hotels and this place was super noisy. It is kitty corner to the church which dings every half hour. The walls and windows are also paper thin. However the staff was amazing and super accomodating. They also have bike rentals which is nice.', 'This is a somewhat charmless hotel, but nonetheless a good value.  Everything was clean - staff is very helpful and basic comforts are met.  Nice location on a side street, so a tad quieter than the normal Hanoi location.', "We had a great stay at the hotel.the room was simple but clean,as the bathroom.we had plenty of warm water. The staff was really helpful and gave great tips. The location is central with makes it easy to get to the main interesting parts of the city.it's easy to visit by foot from there.the neighboorhood is safe.we can recommend this hotel.", 'A good choice to stay, all rooms were clean and equipped with air-con and fan. The staff was very friendly. The hotel is located near to the centre of Hanoi, you can reach most sights and great restaurants afoot.', 'Front reception make me feel unreliable', 'Good', 'The room is very spacious and the beds very comfortable. Lovely hotel!! Close to restaurants.', "good location as it's near the joseph's church. no lift but the staff will help you to carry your luggage. it looks like old room but room is still very clean", 'after being in many hotels in southeast asia i can say this is one of the best relation price and quality, good location and service.']

Only 2 Front Desk staffs greets us on our 2 nights stay. Only 1 F&B staff were smiling & nice to us. Room & bathroom were clean & big. Mind you that the bathroom is fully glass. Pull the curtain & you will be covered. TV channel were grainy but watchable.  We booked 1 Triple Room, but as we arrived the Front Desk asked us to pay for 1 more person, as we only booked for 3 adults (we have 1 9 years old along). After some argument she accepted our booking & gave breakfast voucher for 4 pax.If your are on a budget & looking for big room in Old Quarter, then this is the place.', "The bedroom was smelly and there was mold on the walls. The room was big, but wasn't comfortable at all. The lack of cleaning didn't help and the spider cobs all over the place didn't make it a nice experience.There was a balcony, but it wasn't a nice place to stay, given that there weren't any chairs available. The bathroom was really small and was also dirty. The breakfast wasn't bad, but the options were a bit limited. The staff wasn't amazing, but it was the best part of it.", 'The staff were kind to prepare a simple egg on bread and banana breakfast for us when we had to leave early for the airport. The water pressure is also very strong. But thatâ€™s all that was decent. The room was very old with stained everything (head board, sheets, towels) and they forgot to give us towels and water, then gave us dirty towels. The pictures are not at all what the rooms really look like and we would not stay again.', "Things to note: location is central, amenities are ok, there's an elevator. The bathroom is weird - might work for kinky couples - because there's no lock for the glass door and you can draw the bathroom's curtains from outside. Haha!", 'Very convenient location. Very friendly sfaff. I would stay there again if I visit Hanoi next time.', "Great location, from there you can walk to the old center streets, not even need a bike. In overall, the place is okie, but it seems not clean as expected, my room was smelly. The cleaning staffs were too noisy talking to each other like yelling in the middle of a wet market. I'll not come back, but it's still okie within the money spent.", 'We did not geht the room we had booked, but were charged the higher price. Since we arrived late in the evening, we did not have the nerve to look for something different.', 'Room size is reasonable and clean. Bed is just nice. Good location, walking distance to most attractions. Friendly and helpful staff, always asking whether I need a taxi. I never use the local taxi, but use Uber once, with reasonable price. Unfortunately, Uber is not available in Ninh Binh and Halong.', 'Location is good, clean hotel, stuffs are helpful.Money wise worth it . Food stores everywhere in that area.A bit noisy early in the morning.', 'Good part is location and friendly staffs .Bad part is very noisy and facilities are not clean.', 'It was a good clean room, the bar downstairs can be noisy if your room is on the first floor. Great staff, very helpful when I had to arrange for something to be dropped off at the hotel.', "I've been upgraded in the big rooftop bedroom. The room is big and has windows all around. So the view and the light is awesome! The shower was good.But many things were wrong, the walls were badly built, not even finished. Patch-up job (painting, wall primer, curtain rod, curtains themselves).The mattress was bad, really too soft.And the roof was getting away cause of the strong wind. I've been woken up cause of the noise and finally some drops of rain fell on my bed from the ceiling!The bar is nice and the staff as well although a bit pushy to sell trips.", 'The room was without windom but very nice and clean, very helpfull staff\rOnly glass walls from the bathroom to the room so works best for one person', 'Great location,Very clean, has lift on it, friendly staffs Good price', 'Clean, quiet, friendly staff\rEasy access locations', 'I was in Hanoi for a few days and spend them in the Hanoi Pho hostel! Best decision. The staff is super friendly and helpful with everything, the location was in the old quater and perfect. The rooms are super nice although the bathrooms for the dorms could be a bit cleaner. The dorms are in a good condition with wifi and air condition.\rEvery Dong worth it :)', 'Could have booked somewhere nicer for the price we paid. It was good enough and the breakfast was good. Free coffee/tea all the time was a nice touch. Staff was very friendly, but try to sell you their bus way too many times which is annoying. Probably would stay somewhere else next time.']
