The only downside is there is no lift, so you need to walk up but the staff can help you to carry your luggage if you need.', 'Smelt of sewage throughout our first stay here until we covered up the drain pipe in our shower, smelt of death in the lobby. Staff were friendly and helpful, cleanliness wasnâ€™t too bad, the room was quite small.', 'Hanoi Golden Hostel is a great place for budget conscious  travellers. If you are looking for a nice place within the old quarter, then this is the right choice. Arrived around 2am but they provided a vehicle for me. i forgot the name of the driver but he was very patient and kind. Shoutout also to Tina and Henry who were very friendly and helpful. Did I mention they can speak English well? That is a plus factor for tourists. They made me feel at home while travelling in a foreign country alone.', 'All staff very helpful and the room very clean', 'Very helpful staff easy to book trips with at reasonable prices. Rooms are clean though bed wasnâ€™t very comfy.  Still excellent value for money', 'No drinking water is given even water boiler in room. Found some ants on the beds. Location near to night market.', 'All Fine', "Goods:We stayed there 4 nights and the lady from the hotel offers us to stay in a bigger room with a balcony for free.The room is quite clean and spacious. The staffs help us to visit hanoi and explain staffs.Bads:I advanced book a tour to halong bay and it's more than their list price on the entrance.Taking shower that is almost impossible to do. The amount of water from the shower head is so little and we uses a cup from a sink to shower.The noise of drunk people from staircase can also wake you up in the middle of the night.", 'We thought we picked the right place for the right price, our room did not look like the picture we had no window and the room was very small. Our bathroom was a wet room that was meant to have a shower...the shower was attached to the sink and you had to stand nearly on the toilet to use the shower. The only positive thing I would say was the staff at the desk were friendly and we did Have a breakfast included.Biggest thing to mention: do not book a cruise through miss Mai (not sure if Iâ€™m spelling her name correctly) she worked at the desk some days and likes to pretend sheâ€™s getting you good tour deals. We booked a cruise from her and although the cruise itself was nice we were disappointed with the tour guide (barely any English) rushed us the whole 24hours we were on the trip, our boat ran out of petrol and we were stranded wasting an hour at a random harbour and we were moved to another boat the following day as we were not going back to Hanoi. Ms Mai really misinformed us!', 'It was pleasure to sleep in this hotel. Staff was very helpful and kind. If you need a hotel in Hanoi, this place is one of the best in good price! â¤ï¸', 'Staff were really friendly here and upgraded our room for 2 nights. If you are looking for a nice place within the old quarter, then this is the right choice. The amount of water from the shower head is so little and we uses a cup from a sink to shower.The noise of drunk people from staircase can also wake you up in the middle of the night.", 'We thought we picked the right place for the right price, our room did not look like the picture we had no window and the room was very small. Our bathroom was a wet room that was meant to have a shower...the shower was attached to the sink and you had to stand nearly on the toilet to use the shower. The only positive thing I would say was the staff at the desk were friendly and we did Have a breakfast included.Biggest thing to mention: do not book a cruise through miss Mai (not sure if Iâ€™m spelling her name correctly) she worked at the desk some days and likes to pretend sheâ€™s getting you good tour deals. We booked a cruise from her and although the cruise itself was nice we were disappointed with the tour guide (barely any English) rushed us the whole 24hours we were on the trip, our boat ran out of petrol and we were stranded wasting an hour at a random harbour and we were moved to another boat the following day as we were not going back to Hanoi. Ms Mai really misinformed us!', 'It was pleasure to sleep in this hotel. Staff was very helpful and kind. CÃ¡m Æ¡n ráº¥t nhiá»u', 'Vá»‹ trÃ­ thuáº­n tiá»‡n, yÃªn tÄ©nh, khÃ´ng cÃ³ nhiá»u xe cá»™ qua láº¡i.  PhÃ²ng á»Ÿ ráº¥t sáº¡ch sáº½, thoÃ¡ng mÃ¡t, nhÃ¢n viÃªn táº­n tÃ¬nh chu Ä‘Ã¡o. NÃ³i chung so vá»›i Ä‘á»“ng tiá»n bá» ra, Ä‘Ã¢y háº³n lÃ  má»™t sá»± lá»±a chá»n tuyá»‡t vá»i.  TÃ´i sáº½ quay láº¡i Ä‘Ã¢y vÃ o nhá»¯ng láº§n sau.', 'KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n bÃ¡o 14:00 nháº­n phÃ²ng nhÆ°ng khi khÃ¡ch Ä‘áº¿n Ä‘Ã£ linh hoáº¡t Ä‘á»“ng Ã½ cho nháº­n sá»›m hÆ¡n.TÃ´i Ä‘i Ä‘i vá» vá» Ä‘á»‹nh thuÃª láº¡i chá»— nÃ y nhÆ°ng giÃ¡ tiá»n nháº£y liÃªn tá»¥c lÃ  Ä‘iá»ƒm trá»« Ä‘á»‘i vá»›i khÃ¡ch sáº¡n nÃ y.', 'Rá»™ng rÃ£i, gáº§n trung tÃ¢m', 'GiÃ¡ cáº£ há»£p lÃ½', '- Toilet khÃ´ng cÃ³ khÃ³a cá»­a ráº¥t báº¥t tiá»‡n - Wifi Ks ráº¥t yáº¿u', 'Ks trung tÃ¢m tp, hÆ¡i nhá», phÃ²ng cÅ© nhÆ°ng á»Ÿ cÅ©ng táº¡m Ä‘c.', 'The best breakfast we had at a hotel. Hot dishes are prepared as in a large restaurant. The choice is very wide, with an exceptional buffet. Our room was also very nice, big and comfortable. The reception is excellent as well as the geographical situation.  It is  really good hotel for the price we paid.', "My wife and I went to Hanoi for two days, which was extended to 13 days, on the second day my wife had a heart attack and died 7 days later, during that time and after, Tony the manager was so helpful, nothing was too great a problem for him, and if he didn't have the answer he would find out.The first impression is that it is a small hotel, but that turned out for my situation to be an advantage, business was quiet which meant Tony was able to devote more of his time to help me. when ordering a taxi through Tony, he receives a discount that he passes on to his patrons and makes sure that you are not ripped off.The room that we had was clean, light, airy and large", 'Hotel very well located. We were upgraded  to a spacious family, It was  so quiet, which is very significant in Hanoi. We only spent a few days there but we keep an excellent memory. The staff is very attentive and adorable: our 8 year old daughter left with a nice memory of the hotel. Thank you again for your kindness', 'Before I went to Hanoi, I chose a hotel with a swimming pool and kitchen but when I arrived it was not there. I feel cheated but there was nothing I can do as I already paid. Location is okay near to the lake, night market and also to a halal restaurant. The Old Quarter area is congested with a narrow road and too many motorbikes coming in and out. The hotel staff are so nice especially Lily and Tom. They arranged for my transportation to and from airport and also my trip to Halong Bay. Suitable for budget traveler but not suitable for family.', 'Serendipity is very well located at the edge, thereby avoiding the central crowd. For a 1st time visitor of Hanoi,  I would consider it as ideal location - for a 2nd time visitor, I would try to go out of the tourist area.- breakfastvery simple with very small selection, but well prepared local food (good vn soup and fresh fruits). For this price category, it is the best you can expect. We were happy.- room was rather large, a bit outdated, basic - considering the price, it was on the good side.- cleannessnot great but also not bad - I would say, it is what you want to expect from the price.downside (the only real one) â€¦. by accident, I had a look into the basic kitchen â€¦. let me a bit uncomfortableOverall, apart from what I saw in the kitchen, it is a good value for the money.  There are significant downsides but also very positive aspects. As a tourist, I enjoyed the stay - as a business traveler, I would not.', 'This hotel is in a great location in the Old Quarter.  No pool, and the rooms are narrow (as are most buildings in Hanoi) but the friendly, helpful staff and central location more than make up for it.  If youâ€™re looking for a clean room in the heart of the action then this hotel is perfect.', 'There was certainly nothing wrong with the room at all, but we thought it could be a tad cheaper. However, the breakfast spread was fantastic and the staff was super friendly and fun to interact with. I recommend staying here.', 'No complaints, would definitely book it again.', 'We stayed there for 4 nights, but the thing is every 6:30 in the morning, we will hear a loud noise doing some construction stuff. We wanted to sleep longer but the noise is very irritating. Also we also experienced a noise during 11 in the evening, where all of the guests were already sleeping. The good thing about this place is the location, the staff were also accommodating.', 'The hotel is only a few minutes to walk from the lake and the heart of the old quarter, but far enough to be away from the worst noise. The room was very quiet at night and I can recommend it to any type of tourist, single or with company.', 'This is definitely the absolute upper class, as regards the reception,  clean room, quiet location,  very good breakfast and finally the organization of the taxi on the day of departure! You can not be happier, and we would love to stay there anytime again!', 'The hotel is in the old quarter and therefore perfectly located! Within walking distance of all the attractions, the market, the restaurants! Despite its location in the old quarter, the hotel is very quiet and is not noisy. The room, bathroom and bedding are very clean. All toiletries are provided. The included breakfast  offers a nice variety of dishes. Air conditioning and WiFi work very well. The staff is attentive, smiling and always ready to help you!', 'This is our first stop on our trip to Vietnam. The reception is very nice, the room is correct and we can communicate in English. The hotel is 2 minutes from the covered market and in less than 10 minutes you are on the shores of the lake. The breakfast buffet is completed with a dish of your choice. It is nice to have someone pick you up at the airport (even for $ 18 while you can get a $ 10 trip). This is the first time we leave a hotel with 1 gift!']

Ok', 'KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n cÃ³ vá»‹ trÃ­ ngay trung tÃ¢m vÃ  di chuyá»ƒn ra phá»‘ cá»• khÃ¡ thuáº­n lá»£i. PhÃ²ng tuy hÆ¡i nhá» nhÆ°ng sáº¡ch sáº½ mÃ  Ä‘Æ°á»£c trang bá»‹ tá»‘t. Ngoáº¡i trá»« viá»‡c khÃ¡ch sáº¡n náº±m trong má»™t ngÃµ nhá» nÃªn viá»‡c di chuyá»ƒn hÃ nh lÃ½ mang theo tá»« Ä‘áº§u ngÃµ vÃ o cÃ³ chÃºt khÃ´ng tiá»‡n lá»£i do pháº£i Ä‘i qua chá»£. Má»i thá»© Ä‘á»u ok', 'We really enjoyed our stay, the staff were so friendly and welcoming, helped us out with anything we needed. Lovely rooftop view of Hanoi. I would deffinetly recommend!', 'We felt very welcome. Breakfast buffet was good and fresh. And you could also make an order. Hotel is situated in a quiet street off the main streets of the old town. Everything was in walking distance, F&B, shopping, art ... you name it. Airport pickup was reliable. I would definitely stay here again.', 'We arrived at about 2am local time, but the awesome staff were there waiting for us, even carried our luggage up to our room! There is beautiful artworks on a lot of the walls, which is one of the reasons I booked here.The room is very nice and clean with massive comfortable beds.The buffet style breakfast was delicious as well.', 'Fantastic staff, clean and comfortable rooms, good location, great breakfast. Highly recommended!', "We stayed 2 nights here based on good reviews of the place but we're pretty disappointed. Hotel was in a small alley inaccessible by car. Travellers needing assistance please take note. The family room was very narrow and small, floors under the bed were dusty. Shower room was a squeeze and had poor drainage. Breakfast selection was poor. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay though. Avoid the tour desk and shop around from the multitude of tour operators in the old quarter. You will get better prices and the tours are pretty much the same standard fare. We stayed for 2 nights here and checked into another hotel nearby and we were surprised how much more we are able to get from that hotel for the same price.", 'Everything was perfect, we can recommend.', 'Ancient Lane Hotel was a great choice for our short visit to Hanoi. It is extremely close to very delicious pho and bun cha restaurants. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only downside was that are room was on the ground floor right next to the lobby. This did not bother much though since we were only there for one night and hardly in the room.', 'Wonderful place, hidden in a small alley but right in the middle of the Old Quarter.The staff is super friendly, the room great, clean and comfortable and the breakfast buffet was really good.Great value for what we paid. I would definitely stay here again.', 'Staff were very friendly and helpful  Very comfy beds Good choice at breakfast Good location if you want to be in the heart of hanoi old quarter. Only complaints were the rooms are a little small  - but this is reflected in price  the old quarter is all quite small and room size is similar to other hotels around the area-  to get a larger room you will be paying a lot more for it. We did two nights and it was perfect for what we needed Cars can not drive to entrance either you will need to walk down the lane to find it but will only take one minute Overall we were very happy and would nit hesitate to go back. Thank you', "Great little place, good breakfast, very comfy and well appointed rooms, staff super friendly and the WIFI was good. location is great just a small walk up a lane and you are in the hustle and bustle of Hanoi's old quatre.", 'Staff is amazing, professional, very friendly and accommodating. Room is really clean and comfortable though quite small in size. Just had an issue with the safe, but itâ€™s a minor thing. Breakfast was a big plus, there were many choices and variety. Really good value for money. Would surely want to stay again in the future.', 'Good Accomodation but not Exceptional', 'We only stayed here for 1 night on the way through from Ha Long Bay to Ninh Binh but wow. The reception staff, especially Tracey were just outstanding. Couldnâ€™t fault them, always want to go above and beyond to make sure your having a good experience whether itâ€™s with them or wherever you plan to go next. They upgraded us to a honeymoon suite which was lovely and the bed was honestly so comfy we both had the best night sleep. Breakfast was decent for it being included and a nice bonus. They also did all our laundry for us ready for the next morning and we had a lot! We did get a pretty good deal Â£16 for a night but it was a last minute booking but the room and hotel and the staff is worth way over that! The location is down a little lane from the Main Street so its really quiet as well...Stay here !', "We were very impressed with the helpful and friendly staff. The hotel is in the heart of the Old Quarter but is very quiet as it is hidden down a small world lane. Breakfast was very good and the room was clean and there was abundant hot water. Room size was on the small side but didn't bother us at all. We'll return to stay again within a few days!", 'Nice and cosy little hotel in a Hanoi old town side street. Staff was good and very friendly. Rooms were a little bit on the small side but still adequate, however, the soundproofing needs to be improved.']

After 12 o'clock in the evening it is necessary to ring the chime in order for the shutter to come down and enter.", 'The nearby hotel has a famous pho restaurant. It takes about 2-3 minuets. And we could take a walk to Hoan Kiem Lake and market. We didnâ€™t need to use any transportation. Hotel women can speak English and she offered us to Halon bay and Hoalu Tamcoc tour. The price was 35$ and 30$. Itâ€™s not bad. But there are so many tour companies so if someone go there you can buy tour tickets cheaper.', 'This hotel is very looks like old family house,running by owner family with few staffs. Despite my room is not so pleasant I had nothing to complaint as receptionist (Ms Thre) were very helpful and been convinced by her on behalf of the hotel.Location is excellent,not on the busy, most of the tourist sites are proximity, quiet etc.My suggestion - please choose with balcony of the front row and higher the better,quieter.', "The staff here were so warm and friendly I was kind of sad to leave them. The room was comfortable and clean but had no outside window or natural light which was a bit of a bummer. I booked my Halong Bay tour through the hotel and was really happy with it. I'd stay here again.", "Camellia 3 is kind of your typical cheap old quarter hotel. Mediocre service, some rooms can be horrifyingly bad but if you complain you'll probably get moved to a reasonable one.\r\rFor the price its fine, but there are probably better options if you hunt.", 'i chose the hotel for location and on arrival was greeted with amazing staff who all spoke good english. location was excellant and room was clean and comfortable. the staff at the hotel were good at arranging for trip to halong bay and bike hire etc. breakfast included but only on weekends. a lot of the tourist places are within walking distance. the lake 2 mins away.', 'We so enjoyed our stay at Camellia.  The staff was very friendly, and always willing to help. The room was quiet, even though overlooking the street, in an otherwise very busy area.  The rooms are simply decorated, but very adequate, and a very good value for the money.  We were able to use internet free in the lobby anytime-- a big plus for us, not traveling with wi-fi.  We booked two tours through the hotel, and got very good prices.']

Ngoáº¡i trá»« viá»‡c khÃ¡ch sáº¡n náº±m trong má»™t ngÃµ nhá» nÃªn viá»‡c di chuyá»ƒn hÃ nh lÃ½ mang theo tá»« Ä‘áº§u ngÃµ vÃ o cÃ³ chÃºt khÃ´ng tiá»‡n lá»£i do pháº£i Ä‘i qua chá»£. Má»i thá»© Ä‘á»u ok', 'We really enjoyed our stay, the staff were so friendly and welcoming, helped us out with anything we needed. Lovely rooftop view of Hanoi. I would deffinetly recommend!', 'We felt very welcome. Breakfast buffet was good and fresh. And you could also make an order. Hotel is situated in a quiet street off the main streets of the old town. Everything was in walking distance, F&B, shopping, art ... you name it. Airport pickup was reliable. I would definitely stay here again.', 'We arrived at about 2am local time, but the awesome staff were there waiting for us, even carried our luggage up to our room! There is beautiful artworks on a lot of the walls, which is one of the reasons I booked here.The room is very nice and clean with massive comfortable beds.The buffet style breakfast was delicious as well.', 'Fantastic staff, clean and comfortable rooms, good location, great breakfast. Highly recommended!', "We stayed 2 nights here based on good reviews of the place but we're pretty disappointed. Hotel was in a small alley inaccessible by car. Travellers needing assistance please take note. The family room was very narrow and small, floors under the bed were dusty. Shower room was a squeeze and had poor drainage. Breakfast selection was poor. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay though. Avoid the tour desk and shop around from the multitude of tour operators in the old quarter. You will get better prices and the tours are pretty much the same standard fare. We stayed for 2 nights here and checked into another hotel nearby and we were surprised how much more we are able to get from that hotel for the same price.", 'Everything was perfect, we can recommend.', 'Ancient Lane Hotel was a great choice for our short visit to Hanoi. It is extremely close to very delicious pho and bun cha restaurants. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only downside was that are room was on the ground floor right next to the lobby. This did not bother much though since we were only there for one night and hardly in the room.', 'Wonderful place, hidden in a small alley but right in the middle of the Old Quarter.The staff is super friendly, the room great, clean and comfortable and the breakfast buffet was really good.Great value for what we paid. I would definitely stay here again.', 'Staff were very friendly and helpful  Very comfy beds Good choice at breakfast Good location if you want to be in the heart of hanoi old quarter. Only complaints were the rooms are a little small  - but this is reflected in price  the old quarter is all quite small and room size is similar to other hotels around the area-  to get a larger room you will be paying a lot more for it. We did two nights and it was perfect for what we needed Cars can not drive to entrance either you will need to walk down the lane to find it but will only take one minute Overall we were very happy and would nit hesitate to go back. Thank you', "Great little place, good breakfast, very comfy and well appointed rooms, staff super friendly and the WIFI was good. location is great just a small walk up a lane and you are in the hustle and bustle of Hanoi's old quatre.", 'Staff is amazing, professional, very friendly and accommodating. Room is really clean and comfortable though quite small in size. Just had an issue with the safe, but itâ€™s a minor thing. Breakfast was a big plus, there were many choices and variety. Really good value for money. Would surely want to stay again in the future.', 'Good Accomodation but not Exceptional', 'We only stayed here for 1 night on the way through from Ha Long Bay to Ninh Binh but wow. The reception staff, especially Tracey were just outstanding. Couldnâ€™t fault them, always want to go above and beyond to make sure your having a good experience whether itâ€™s with them or wherever you plan to go next. They upgraded us to a honeymoon suite which was lovely and the bed was honestly so comfy we both had the best night sleep. Breakfast was decent for it being included and a nice bonus. They also did all our laundry for us ready for the next morning and we had a lot! We did get a pretty good deal Â£16 for a night but it was a last minute booking but the room and hotel and the staff is worth way over that! The location is down a little lane from the Main Street so its really quiet as well...Stay here !', "We were very impressed with the helpful and friendly staff. The hotel is in the heart of the Old Quarter but is very quiet as it is hidden down a small world lane. Breakfast was very good and the room was clean and there was abundant hot water. Room size was on the small side but didn't bother us at all. We'll return to stay again within a few days!", 'Nice and cosy little hotel in a Hanoi old town side street. Staff was good and very friendly. Rooms were a little bit on the small side but still adequate, however, the soundproofing needs to be improved.']

MÃ¹i hÃ´i trang thiáº¿t bá»‹ cÅ©', "one night just 300000(13usd)ï¼Œthey offer free breakfast . bread. fruit .cheese.jam. and noodle  chicken soup .some cold drink  lemon juice black coffee. that's good ï¼but the room is not big and smells bad ã€‚the bed is a bit damp. the location is very good.u can find a lot of delicious food around hotel. at last. the girl can speak english and u can pay in usd of vnd.", 'Really friendly staff and tasty breakfast! Good value for price. They just didnt have the room which we booked, but nevermind, we got another one. ItÂ´ s in the old town, really close to markets and all of streets with food and so on, so you can enjoy the best of the city.', 'Spring bed yang digunakan  ( family room 3 person, kamar 102) sudah perlu diganti karena busanya sudah menipis dan saat tidur sangat terasa per-nya sehingga membuat badan sakit. Ruangan kamar luas tetapi posisi toilet sangat sempit sehingga kurang leluasa.Lokasi kamar terletak di lantai 1 dan hanya bisa dicapai menggunakan tangga.Lokasi kamar yg lain ( 2 kamar berhubungan) terletak dilantai 6, 5 lantai dicapai menggunakan lift dan lantai ke 6 menggunakan tangga yang sempit dan curam.', "The rooms are big and very clean. The only issue we had was the amount of light coming in through the window from the stairs. This could easily be solved with some curtains or blinds. It is also noisy from quite early in the morning from the corridor, we had to wear earplugs. Breakfast was good (one morning there were ants in the scrambled eggs but we took them back and they were very apologetic and got us some fresh ones). Location is really good as it is right in the centre of the Old Quarter. It is quite hard to find initially. If you follow the address the rather than the name it would be easier. It looks almost like a shop from the front but if you walk through you can see the reception. Overall, would recommend if you're on a budget.", 'This hotel is tucked away in a quieter part of Old Quarters in Hoan Kiem, yet within few minutes walk to the crowded places - especially around Hang Buom - during week end evenings where the roads are closed to traffic.  As such you can readily grab a cab or bike to & fro the door-step. It offers  great customer service through very friendly staff. Simple breakfast set include Bread + Jam or egg or Noodles (Soup) + a drink. All considered - its a good-value for money package.', 'We were surprised by this guest house as it does not match the agoda description or photos.  For two nights we were kept awake by drunk loud guests slamming up the stairs in the early hours.  Following thus the staff woke us up in the early hours also shouting up the stairs and around the building. We had NO sleep for two days !! Not impressed', 'Staff let me check in at 9 am because I came with the train from China who arrived in Hanoi at 5:30 am which I am grateful', 'Was a good stay', 'I booked  asia guest house. But when i arrived the  staff told  me  that  their aircon have some  problems.  So they  transfer me  to  ha noi city  guest house.  Which  is  under the same  company.  Well, the  staff here  are good. Clean room. Not  that bad. I extend my  stay for  another 3 days. Very satisfied.', "After 15.5H long travel from Hue, we were told that there is no available room. It was around 10pm and we were exhausted but had to find other place to stay. A guy at front dest apologized us and we weren't upset at him. He was a nice guy. It just happened and it was just a shame that they didn't manage booking well.", 'i stayed in the standard room and everything from bed to bathroom look ok for me, considering the price you are paying. It is great value for money as this hotel is cheapest among the others in this area. And most important this hotel have very friendly polite staff from cleaners, helpers, front desk staff, this makes your stay a pleasant one.  location is very good and only mins walk to the famous pho bo, pho ga, bun bo nam bo,, bun cha, cha ca and vietnam desert.  I am a regular to Hanoi so my recommendation for budget travellers, is this Hanoi Asia Guest House , it will be great choice.', 'Booked for 4d3n stay and paid less than 50usd inclusive of breakfast. Service is great and they are helpful in attending to your needs with airport transfers, food recommendations and tour packages. The area is hard to find though because you would need to get inside a store and enter narrow passageway to reach the reception area.', 'we (couple) stay there for 2 night and it was great. very clean hotel, very comfortable, and very helpful. Also very good location you can walk everywhere in just 5 - 10 minuts. i really recommend it. \r\rAnn, the reception woman and the other reception men, help us with tips, with everything. we had a problem with the night we had booked, and they without problem changed the days, and also they tryed to called agoda for us. \r\rits a really good hostel, the breaksfast its was good enough.\r\rthey always try to help you and say hello with a smile in their faces.  \r\rit was just perfect.\r \r\rI absolutly recommend it']

Cáº£m giÃ¡c phÃ²ng khÃ´ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c vá»‡ sinh láº¯m.', 'Tá»‘t', "The street noise in all of Hanoi takes some getting used to, but you will notice a perfect quiet calm from midnight to 4AM.  This hotel seems immaculately new, perfectly clean, nice wood floors and bathrooms of stone.  My experience of five days in Hanoi was welcomed every night by this beautiful respite.  I talked with tourists that had stayed in many hotels around Vietnam, and their take was all of the others places were aesthetically pleasing, but the infrastructure like plumbing, water pressure did not match the aesthetics, whereas Lan Vien was an amazing place - Truly - and the buffett breakfast with warm service staff -  not to miss for sure.  Don't believe that something this great exists elsewhere in Hanoi unless you go Hilton or ?  Enjoy!!!", 'Spend few days for working trip at hanoi, first time to stay at this hotel. so far the hotel is new and quite spacious, the staff are well trained. all the necessary stuff was arranged perfectly.\ri will suggest to put more effort on the breakfast, not much variety especially for asia food.', 'i booked 2 superior room but both were upgraded to excutive room and one room even has balcony. the rooms are large and clean. although i could use wifi with my iphone, i found it very thankful that they even prepared a lan cable in the drawer so that i could use with my note pc which is restricted with wifi. \rthe staffs were very nice and helpful. they even helped me to peel the grapefruit i had bought from a super market. i definately will stay at this hotel next time.', 'NÃ³ thing tocomplain', 'The hotel is older but maintained very well and modern. The staff was always very friendly & helpful. We stayed in a room with a city view & balcony which allowed us to sit outside and relax at times. The hotel is within close walking distance to the park & â€œwalking streetâ€ areas that are closed to vehicles on the weekends. There were numerous restaurants, coffee shops, movie theaters, shopping areas, etc within a short walk of the hotel. The complimentary morning breakfast selections at the 11th floor restaurant were more than satisfying. Overall, we truly enjoyed our stay & would recommend the hotel to anyone seeking a comfortable stay in a great location.', 'I stayed for 5 nights for a business trip. All staffs are friendly and willing to help. I think the service that could be improved tho is the variety of food for room service and an option for Halal food. The hotel was accessible and near food stalls. Thereâ€™s also Starbucks at the lobby as alternative dining option. If you are a Muslim traveller, there is a certified Halal restaurant two blocks away from the hotel, around 10-minute walk.']

address: 26 Ã‚u Triá»‡u, Quáº­n HÃ²an Kiáº¿m, Quáº­n HoÃ n Kiáº¿m, HÃ  Ná»™i, Viá»‡t Nam
reviews: ['Staff is super friendly. Most spoke english pretty well. Great location, but there are early morning chuch bells nearby.  Good breakfast (recommend the noodle bowl).  Good restaurants nearby. Great place to stay.', 'Very pleasant stay. Impressed with the reception and other staff members who are so willing to make our experience comfortable and fulfilled. Will come back there for our next trip to the Viet Nam capital city.', 'Enjoyed my time there very much.  Coming back to the hotel each day and greeted by staff was a real pleasure.  Especially thought that Mai was terrific and gets my vote as the nicest of a really outstanding group of front desk people.  Was there around Christmas.  Church bells were very loud and caroles were playing even until late at night.  So if you are OK with that, (room comes with nice ear plugs!) then the hotel rates highly for charm and comfort.', 'We stayed at this hotel twice at the beginning and end of our trip to Vietnam. The staff are so great and friendly, rooms are very clean and big. Breakfast is sooooo delicious! The only think to note is that they have 2  Hotel, one of them is Cinnamon Cathedral  Hotel and one Cinnamon Hotel( very close to each other). We booked with Cinnamon Hotel but then we moved to Cinnamon Cathedral Hotel as the bathrooms are better. Anyway Loved it and will definitely recommend this.', 'Showing its age, the Cinnamon is in an excellent location for tourists. Breakfast is two doors doen at another Cinnamon- not a problem, but could be an issue for some.Staff were unfailingly attentive, friendly and helpful. I stayed two nights then one night a week later. Spotty at first, the wifi was nonexistent subsequently - definitely a dreback.', 'Very good location.', 'Super hotel, well placed. We were given an upgrade room on the top floor of the Cinnamon Cathedral Hotel, two doors away. Wonderfully designed with white walls and black stained wood, balcony overlooking the cathedral roof. Large bathroom. No lift, but worth the walk up. Delicious breakfast and a generous pack up when we had to leave early one morning. The cathedral bells start at 5 am when most locals get up. Do the same and join in the Tai Chi on the doorstep or by the lake. I slept on, but witnessed the city coming to life on another occasion when I got back into Hanoi at 5:30 on the sleeper train from Lao Cai.', "Lovely staff, great breakfast, fabulous location. The one downside: the bells of the church across the street peal every 15 minutes. And the 5am ringing goes on for several long minutes.Also, the safe in the room is not attached to anything. Anyone can potentially lift it and walk away with it. :) I didn't worry that this might happen (and clearly, it never has), but it would be a little more reassuring if they bolted it to something.But the niggles aside, this was a very cute place and was great value for money. I will be back.", 'Wonderful staff throughout our stay! Thuy, May and Phoenix are wonderful ladies with big smiles and lots of energy! They really got to know us and look after us. Lovely rooms and very well situated hotel.', "We were a group of 4 who stayed as 2 couples. The staff were so lovely and attentive. Especially Tracy and Phoenix who were so friendly and couldn't do enough for us. We had a great stay and would certainly recommend this hotel.", 'Delighted to have had the opportunity  to enjoy the delights of this hotel and to experience the staffs willingness to assist where ever they could with a special word for Stacey and Kim., I should note all the staff I came in contact with were a delight .', 'Rreally enjoyed staying at cinnamon hotel. Hotel staff were always nice to me and helped me so much to find location etc. Their towel arts on the bed were cute and breakfast was lively. It is located in a popular area, where church, restaurants and cafes are around, so I heard noise during night though. Was fortunate that I found this hotel in Hanoi.', "Overall, our stay was very pleasant. The staff spoke good English and were very helpful and accommodating. The room we stayed in was big and very comfortable. Cinnamon Hotel's location is great -- beside St. Joseph's Cathedral, surrounded by interesting shops and restaurants, and just walking distance to the lake. I would definitely recommend staying here when in Hanoi.", 'I enjoyed the stay, it was good value for money and the staff were very friendly and engaging.  The bells of the cathedral are noticeable at first (especially at 0500!) but you just get used to them, & they supply earplugs if you need.  the room was large, cool & dark when required & bright when not.  The bed was huge, enough to squeeze in a small family.  Madame Hien around the corner, night market a short stroll away & Ta Hien bars too.  Represents excellent value for money & will recommend to friends.', "We can't speak highly enough of our stay at the Cinnamon. Our room was beautifully presented and clean, Ms Nguyen and her team were very welcoming and helpful and even changed our room when the wifi wouldn't work. It was no trouble for us to leave our suitcases when we went to Halong Bay; then when we got back upgraded us to their new hotel two doors down at 38 Au Trieu. The cathedral bells didn't bother us at all. If we ever go back to Hanoi we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.", 'Staff at hotel were amazing, made our first night in Vietnam an experience to remember. Helpful tips about where to eat, booked train tickets and even left weather forecast for us. On our return from a trip on the night train they happily welcomed us back at 5.30am and gave us a room to shower and sleep. Lovely designed rooms in superb location. Would definitely come back.', 'We loved our stay at the Cinnamon Hotel . We extended by three nights because the location and staff were so good . The church bells do chime regularly, but if you are staying next to a Cathedral it is what you would expect.', "Everything was great! Included breakfast was good and more than enough food. The rooms were clean and next to the cathedral to hear the bells if you choose not wear the eearplugs. The only thing I would be wary of is using the staff as your travel agent. I had a couple of issues and wasn't totally satisfied with their travel arrangements l. I do think this maybe dependent on which staff member you work with. However there are plenty of travel agencies around the city that can provide this service.", "Very comfortable. The bells of St Joseph's ring matins at 5am which can be a little disconcerting. But the location is very charming. A few hundred metres to Hoan Kiem lake and very close proximity to 2 of Didier Corlou's fantastic restaurants. Try both - Madame Hien's is a treat. Great Pho for breakfast and kids will love the pancakes. Very big breakfast. Bar fridge prices very reasonable. They are opening a bigger version of the hotel a few places up the street and it looks as if it will be great too. Bathrooms are very basic - but the ambience and charm of the place works. Don't stay here if you want 5 star luxury - but for comfort and value it cannot be beaten. And the staff are the nicest people you will ever meet. When my daughter got a little sick they offered to send up a ginger tea and take me to the pharmacy. It feels like being a guest in a home. The design is elegant and simple."]

address: 26 Ã‚u Triá»‡u, Quáº­n HÃ²an Kiáº¿m, Quáº­n HoÃ n Kiáº¿m, HÃ  Ná»™i, Viá»‡t Nam
reviews: ['Staff is super friendly. Most spoke english pretty well. Great location, but there are early morning chuch bells nearby.  Good breakfast (recommend the noodle bowl).  Good restaurants nearby. Great place to stay.', 'Very pleasant stay. Impressed with the reception and other staff members who are so willing to make our experience comfortable and fulfilled. Will come back there for our next trip to the Viet Nam capital city.', 'Enjoyed my time there very much.  Coming back to the hotel each day and greeted by staff was a real pleasure.  Especially thought that Mai was terrific and gets my vote as the nicest of a really outstanding group of front desk people.  Was there around Christmas.  Church bells were very loud and caroles were playing even until late at night.  So if you are OK with that, (room comes with nice ear plugs!) then the hotel rates highly for charm and comfort.', 'We stayed at this hotel twice at the beginning and end of our trip to Vietnam. The staff are so great and friendly, rooms are very clean and big. Breakfast is sooooo delicious! The only think to note is that they have 2  Hotel, one of them is Cinnamon Cathedral  Hotel and one Cinnamon Hotel( very close to each other). We booked with Cinnamon Hotel but then we moved to Cinnamon Cathedral Hotel as the bathrooms are better. Anyway Loved it and will definitely recommend this.', 'Showing its age, the Cinnamon is in an excellent location for tourists. Breakfast is two doors doen at another Cinnamon- not a problem, but could be an issue for some.Staff were unfailingly attentive, friendly and helpful. I stayed two nights then one night a week later. Spotty at first, the wifi was nonexistent subsequently - definitely a dreback.', 'Very good location.', 'Super hotel, well placed. We were given an upgrade room on the top floor of the Cinnamon Cathedral Hotel, two doors away. Wonderfully designed with white walls and black stained wood, balcony overlooking the cathedral roof. Large bathroom. No lift, but worth the walk up. Delicious breakfast and a generous pack up when we had to leave early one morning. The cathedral bells start at 5 am when most locals get up. Do the same and join in the Tai Chi on the doorstep or by the lake. I slept on, but witnessed the city coming to life on another occasion when I got back into Hanoi at 5:30 on the sleeper train from Lao Cai.', "Lovely staff, great breakfast, fabulous location. The one downside: the bells of the church across the street peal every 15 minutes. And the 5am ringing goes on for several long minutes.Also, the safe in the room is not attached to anything. Anyone can potentially lift it and walk away with it. :) I didn't worry that this might happen (and clearly, it never has), but it would be a little more reassuring if they bolted it to something.But the niggles aside, this was a very cute place and was great value for money. I will be back.", 'Wonderful staff throughout our stay! Thuy, May and Phoenix are wonderful ladies with big smiles and lots of energy! They really got to know us and look after us. Lovely rooms and very well situated hotel.', "We were a group of 4 who stayed as 2 couples. The staff were so lovely and attentive. Especially Tracy and Phoenix who were so friendly and couldn't do enough for us. We had a great stay and would certainly recommend this hotel.", 'Delighted to have had the opportunity  to enjoy the delights of this hotel and to experience the staffs willingness to assist where ever they could with a special word for Stacey and Kim., I should note all the staff I came in contact with were a delight .', 'Rreally enjoyed staying at cinnamon hotel. Hotel staff were always nice to me and helped me so much to find location etc. Their towel arts on the bed were cute and breakfast was lively. It is located in a popular area, where church, restaurants and cafes are around, so I heard noise during night though. Was fortunate that I found this hotel in Hanoi.', "Overall, our stay was very pleasant. The staff spoke good English and were very helpful and accommodating. The room we stayed in was big and very comfortable. Cinnamon Hotel's location is great -- beside St. Joseph's Cathedral, surrounded by interesting shops and restaurants, and just walking distance to the lake. I would definitely recommend staying here when in Hanoi.", 'I enjoyed the stay, it was good value for money and the staff were very friendly and engaging.  The bells of the cathedral are noticeable at first (especially at 0500!) but you just get used to them, & they supply earplugs if you need.  the room was large, cool & dark when required & bright when not.  The bed was huge, enough to squeeze in a small family.  Madame Hien around the corner, night market a short stroll away & Ta Hien bars too.  Represents excellent value for money & will recommend to friends.', "We can't speak highly enough of our stay at the Cinnamon. Our room was beautifully presented and clean, Ms Nguyen and her team were very welcoming and helpful and even changed our room when the wifi wouldn't work. It was no trouble for us to leave our suitcases when we went to Halong Bay; then when we got back upgraded us to their new hotel two doors down at 38 Au Trieu. The cathedral bells didn't bother us at all. If we ever go back to Hanoi we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.", 'Staff at hotel were amazing, made our first night in Vietnam an experience to remember. Helpful tips about where to eat, booked train tickets and even left weather forecast for us. On our return from a trip on the night train they happily welcomed us back at 5.30am and gave us a room to shower and sleep. Lovely designed rooms in superb location. Would definitely come back.', 'We loved our stay at the Cinnamon Hotel . We extended by three nights because the location and staff were so good . The church bells do chime regularly, but if you are staying next to a Cathedral it is what you would expect.', "Everything was great! Included breakfast was good and more than enough food. The rooms were clean and next to the cathedral to hear the bells if you choose not wear the eearplugs. The only thing I would be wary of is using the staff as your travel agent. I had a couple of issues and wasn't totally satisfied with their travel arrangements l. I do think this maybe dependent on which staff member you work with. However there are plenty of travel agencies around the city that can provide this service.", "Very comfortable. The bells of St Joseph's ring matins at 5am which can be a little disconcerting. But the location is very charming. A few hundred metres to Hoan Kiem lake and very close proximity to 2 of Didier Corlou's fantastic restaurants. Try both - Madame Hien's is a treat. Great Pho for breakfast and kids will love the pancakes. Very big breakfast. Bar fridge prices very reasonable. They are opening a bigger version of the hotel a few places up the street and it looks as if it will be great too. Bathrooms are very basic - but the ambience and charm of the place works. Don't stay here if you want 5 star luxury - but for comfort and value it cannot be beaten. And the staff are the nicest people you will ever meet. When my daughter got a little sick they offered to send up a ginger tea and take me to the pharmacy. It feels like being a guest in a home. The design is elegant and simple."]

Bá»¯a sÃ¡ng náº¥u ráº¥t ngon, vá»‹ trÃ­ gáº§n nhiá»u quÃ¡n Äƒn.', "The staff were really attentive and friendly .Special thanks to Ms Apple she is realky charming ,knowledgable  she always smile and welcomed us she made our stay pleasurable .She also helpd us arranged a very nice  Ha Long Bay Cruise with breathtaking scenery and bus to Phong Nha and Binh Binh with a very competative prices.....we did have an awesome trip when we decided to book a trip with her. our hotel's bed is very comfy,room really clean and spacious .I did a great sleep here.Thank for all staff made our trip become safer and perfect.Highly recommended Hanoi Oriental Pearl Hotel !!!!", 'KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n Ä‘áº§y Ä‘á»§ tiá»‡n nghi, nhÃ¢n viÃªn ráº¥t nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh, trong suá»‘t thá»i gian á»Ÿ khÃ¡ch sáº¡n, nhÃ³m chÃºng tÃ´i cáº£m tháº¥y ráº¥t thá»ai mÃ¡i. Thanks you so much', 'Má»i thá»© tháº­t sá»± quÃ¡ tá»‘t. Vá»‹ trÃ­ tuyá»‡t vá»›i ngay gáº§n ga HÃ  Ná»™i, nhÃ¢n viÃªn nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh. Trang thiáº¿t bá»‹ ná»™i tháº¥t hiá»‡n Ä‘áº¡i. PhÃ²ng ráº¥t sáº¡ch sáº½', 'Vá»‹ trÃ­ gáº§n Há»“ , phá»‘ Ä‘i bá»™. PhÃ²ng rá»™ng rÃ£i. Thiáº¿t káº¿ Ä‘áº¹p. Sáº¡ch sáº½', '+ Hotel was situated in an area within a walking Distance to load of eateries, shops and attractions + Room was clean and reasonably equipped + Filling breakfast with choices of5-6 freshly cocked hot dishes and some snacks to grab+ Staffs were very kind and attentive. My mum has forgotten a mobile phone on the vn flight to Hanoi. The receptionist offered a hotel phone to call lost&found office and kept contact with them. They found it at last. Big thanks!- Slight issue for a rattling aircon which made some noise.', 'Staff was very nice and helpful. The building is a bit old but contains an elevator. The room is clean. Breakfast is serve 7 to 10 am and you can order as much as you can. Overall staying here is worth the money and suitable for those who not fussy.', 'Staff remembered us from our previous stay and ensured we were really happy with our room and had everything we could ever want/need! Staff, especially Ms Apple, were always so happy to help with any queries, always going above and beyond with recommendations, helping us book a bus to Dien Bien Phu, giving directions and advice on what to see & do, etc. Ms Apple let us keep our bags at the hotel whilst we were away in Ha Long Bay for 2 days (hotel does trips but we had organised on our own) and then she anticipated the time of our return and put the aircon on in our room (just the little things)! At breakfast there is a wide variety of Vietnamese and western foods and you can order more than one option! There is also fresh fruit, juice, toast & tea and coffee that you can help yourself to. Staff take into consideration what you want to eat and can adapt the breakfast to suit your taste. Thank you to all staff for making the hotel feel like a home away from home!', 'Staff friendly, rooms clean (holidaying with another couple), location great (right next to train street, on the edge of the old quarter). We arrived early at around 6am and we were able to check in early without the fee because our train was unexpectedly early and staff were kind. Really loved our stay! Breakfast was delicious.', "Triple sharing room, given 1 queen+1 super single bed, no window. Good TV programs with some international channels. Breakfast average, may order from list for individual & they prep. The common buffet is basic & very limited. Pros: Cleanliness of room was superb. Front desk staff were English speaking, really friendly & helpful. Even received acknowledgement email from hotel personally before arrival, to offer recommendation  & help. Quite accessible location yet away from buzz; near eating street, train street, weekend night market, massage, food & bar street, walkable to St. Joseph's cathedral & lake. Cons: bathroom shower can be challenging with quite weak pressure. Toiletries provided but dispenser not working. I've always brought mine.", "Just got back from a 5 days 4 nights in Hanoi, where we stayed at the Hanoi Oriental Pearl. Very conveniently located near the Old Quarter and several Embassies (including Canada, and Thailand, in our case). The hotel is very close to the railroad, and rooms with balcony face busy streets, so if you have light sleep and require quietness, you might want to look for something else. However, if you enjoy this busy city's sounds and you can sleep through it, the rooms were very clean (although they show a little age), comfortable, and the service was simply amazing.  Everyone in the hotel went out of their way to assist us and share their knowledge about the city.  A very cheap but extremely enjoyable stay with the nice staff at Oriental Pearl. Will definitely consider next time we travel to beautiful Hanoi!", 'The hotel is quite far from the city center but the walk was tolerable. The room was spacious for the group. The bed was comfortable. Breakfast had a good variety. Good value for money.']

reviews: ['TÃ´i Ä‘á»ƒ báº£ng nhá» dá»n phÃ²ng nhÆ°ng nhÃ¢n viÃªn chá»‰ dá»n Ä‘Ãºng toilet. GiÆ°á»ng ngá»§ 3 Ä‘Ãªm váº«n Ä‘á»ƒ ráº¥t báº©n. Má»n Ä‘áº¯p chá»‰ lÃ  1 miáº¿ng dra má»ng. Äá»‹a Ä‘iá»ƒm thuáº­n tiá»‡n nhÆ°ng cÃ¡ch phá»¥c vá»¥ vÃ  tiá»‡n nghi khÃ´ng tá»‘t.', 'Chuyáº¿n bay cá»§a tÃ´i Ä‘áº¿n trá»…, vÃ  khi Ä‘áº¿n khÃ¡ch sáº¡n bÃ¡o lÃ  Ä‘Ã£ khÃ´ng giá»¯ phÃ²ng cho tÃ´i. Sau Ä‘Ã³, há» chuyá»ƒn tÃ´i sang 1 khÃ¡ch sáº¡n khÃ¡c vÃ  nhÃ¢n viÃªn á»Ÿ khÃ¡ch sáº¡n Ä‘Ã³ ráº¥t trá»‹ch thÆ°á»£ng, sau khi tÃ´i á»Ÿ Ä‘Ã³ 1 ngÃ y vÃ  quay láº¡i há»i xem Ä‘Ã£ cÃ³ phÃ²ng chÆ°a, thÃ¬ tÃ´i láº¡i Ä‘Æ°á»£c chuyá»ƒn sang 1 khÃ¡ch sáº¡n khÃ¡c ná»¯a. Tuy chuyáº¿n Ä‘i cá»§a tÃ´i Ä‘Ã£ qua lÃ¢u, nhÆ°ng tÃ´i váº«n muá»‘n viáº¿t vÃ¬ Ä‘Ã³ lÃ  1 áº¥n tÆ°á»£ng khÃ´ng Ä‘áº¹p cá»§a tÃ´i vá» cÃ¡ch lÃ m viá»‡c.', 'NhÃ¢n viÃªn thÃ¢n thiá»‡nGáº§n khu phá»‘ cá»• thuáº­n tiá»‡n tham quan ngáº¯m cáº£nhPhÃ²ng á»‘c tÆ°Æ¡ng Ä‘á»‘i nhá», nÃªn chá»n phÃ²ng 3 ngÆ°á»i á»Ÿ ngoÃ i sáº½ thoÃ¡ng mÃ¡t vÃ  cÃ³ ban cÃ´ngTiá»‡n nghi má»™t sá»‘ cÃ¡i Ä‘Ã£ xuá»‘ng cáº¥p, khÃ¡ch sáº¡n cáº§n sá»¯a chá»¯a nhiá»u nÆ¡i Ä‘á»ƒ lÃ m má»›i láº¡i', 'tá»‘t, gan ho hoan kiem, thaun loi cho ai di du lich, gan cac dia die, du lich', 'This is the worst place I ever stayed. I stayed in a single room, which looked nothing like the pictures. A total flop house with two old televisions and a door that opened up to the water boiler and an air con that made noises intermittently all night. Stained bed sheets and bed bugs. I was moved to a slightly less dire room the second night. The place is cluttered and dirty, was glad to leave. The manager in bizarre contrast is immaculately presented and overly friendly. Odd.', 'I booked this room a month and half before going to Vietnam and directly got contact with Anna, who managed and helped me to get cheap and very great trips (specially around Hanoi and Ha long Bay) with discounts as well. I and my family really enjoyed all the stay; I hope someday to get back again', 'The stay was good for the helpful staffs and convenient for the prime location. However before booking any day trip from here try to take a look at some other places as my Halong bay 1 dat trip was not so good. The hotel itself is worth staying and totally value for money.', "i've got a private triple room. It's run by a family (I guess?), cheap, centrally located in the heart of Hanoi city. Dong Xuan market is just behind the street. We requested airport transfer through agoda.com but the hostel was not notified about this. So we had to take cab to the hostel. However the staffs are very friendly and helpful. They will try their best to serve us the best. A very pleasant stay.", "Anna is very helpful, gives good tips and is even available on Whatsapp. Well located hostel, perfect from the bus station to/from the airport. Make sure you get a room opposite to the street to avoid the noise. Very affordable and clean. I booked there for 2 nights and I'd recommand it for a short stay or if you are in transition.", 'The room was very dirty, fungi on the wall, AC did not work properly. Besides we even had cockroaches (room, kitchen area).Staff was very friendly and helpful.', 'Receptionist who didnt speak english showd us through google traslator "we got bed bugs in your room, we need to spray it - you will have diferent hotel"(way better than room with bed bugs, Im alergic for insect bite) ....... so after few minutes we have endend up in "Charming Hotel" where bathroom was falling apart becose of rust and smell of mold was realy strong. But the night was good, shower was working and when I turn up aircon to Heating you could breath it without mold smell.... but anyway for what i saw from Kangaroo for me no thanks :)', '1. Halal food is just a few meters walk (at the same street) -zainab restaurat..beside the Noor Mosque Hanoi\r2. Walkin distance to Dong Xuan Market\r3.Just walking dist to Hanoi Night Market (Fri-Sat-Sun)\r4. Near wet market\r5.Booked day trip at the counter\r6.Breakfast included\r7.Most of all - Lucy is ever ready to assist  - Tq for your hospitality!', "The room are nice and clean\rIt's quiet and you can sleep very well \rBreakfast is delicious! \rThe location in near everything you need \rAnd the staff is very kind, helpful and friendly !! \rI recommend you to book at kangaroo they are perfect !!", 'We stayed here for 5 days in total and were very satisfied with our stay. Both receptionists, Anh and Lucy, were tremendously helpful and assisted in booking our trips to Sapa and Halong Bay. The breakfast was delicious and filling as well.The hotel is also centrally located and is a 5 minute walk from the lakeside. There are convenience stores and an ATM located on the main street outside of the hotel.My only gripe with the hotel was that there was no lift. We had to walk up several flights of stairs to reach our room, so request a room on the lower floor if you can.All in all, a great stay!', "The friendly and helpful stuff really makes it up for a rather old hotel. The hotel itself could use a makeover, but if you're not looking for high class, this is a good place with all the basics. The rooms are well equipped with aircon, tv, fridge, kettle, hairdryer. Not really a hostel, it's actually a 2 star hotel.", 'This hotel is quite good hotel with good price. First time when we came, we got very nice room and we were very satisfied, but second time.. Our room had smoke smell in the evening and in the morning from the kitchen came fried eggs smell :) so.. but with that price this hotel is really very ok :) by the way service and location is perfect ;)', "We had excellent experience here. Our flight landed too late, about 2AM, but their driver was there when we came. We booked triple room with 2 beds for 3 persons and it had anything you need with air conditioner, hot water, bathtub, refrigerator, cable TV, tables. Their furniture is seem to be old but they're still good to use.Breakfast is not really tasty but it's included in room price, so you can save more money for your trip.Staff are very friendly and willing to help. They speak English very well, so you will not worry about that.One thing not good, I think, is Wifi. We cannot connect their Wifi everytime. But it's okay, not a big deal :)", 'It was alright. Ms moon is very caring and i feel pampered because of her assistance. She patiently assisted me in every ppssible way she can. She even help me deliver my passport when i left it when i was to board the bus to laos. Though there isnt a lift, i still enjoyed my time there. Thanks ms moon. I will surely recommend your hostel to my backpacker friends.', 'The people at the Kangaroo Hostel are very friendly, the food is good, and it is located in the old quarter about a 10 minute walk north of Hoan Kiem Lake. The room was comfortable. The shower drain was slow, yet, overall, very good value for money.', 'We had 3 great stays at this hostel. We left our big bags here as we travelled to Cat Ba and Bac Ha. Each time the staff were very helpful and welcoming. They have great tours on offer and helped with our onward travel. The hostel is clean and if you get a back room it is also very quiet. Thank you Kangaroo']

address: 73 MÃ£ MÃ¢y, HoÃ n Kiáº¿m, Phá»‘ Cá»•, HÃ  Ná»™i, Viá»‡t Nam, 1000000
reviews: ['Äá»‹a Ä‘iá»ƒm Ä‘áº¹p vÃ  háº¥p dáº«n cho giáº£i trÃ­ vá» Ä‘Ãªm, 2 phÃºt Ä‘i bá»™ Ä‘áº¿n táº¡ Hiá»‡n, 7 phÃºt Ä‘áº¿n há»“ GÆ°Æ¡m.Sáº¡ch sáº½, ngÄƒn náº¯p vÃ  gá»n gÃ ng, internet tá»‘t. NÃ³i chung lÃ  Ä‘Ã¡ng giÃ¡ tiá»n.Náº¿u nhÃ¢n viÃªn Ä‘Æ°á»£c Ä‘Ã o táº¡o ká»¹ hÆ¡n, giao tiáº¿p tá»‘t chÃºt ná»¯a, nhÆ°  nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh, tinh táº¿ vÃ  khÃ´ng nÃ³i chuyá»‡n nhÆ° "la, hÃ©t, thÃ©t" vÃ o máº·t khÃ¡ch hÃ ng nhÆ° má»™t sá»‘ hotgirl thÃ¬ Ä‘Ã¢y sáº½ lÃ  thiÃªn Ä‘Æ°á»ng cá»§a dÃ¢n balo bá»¥i.', 'Lá»… tÃ¢n xáº¿p chung phÃ²ng cá»§a chÃºng tÃ´i vá»›i ng láº¡ máº·c dÃ¹ tÃ´i Ä‘Ã£ book riÃªng full Ä‘á»§ giÆ°á»ng.', 'Dirty', 'Right in the heart of Old Quarter. Close to bars and clubs, but still very quiet. The mattrasses and service are not mind-blowing but considering the price it is all very good. The breakfast is very good. One of the cheapest Hotels that i have been to ...but by faaaaar NOT one of the worst! I would come again and recommend it to friends who travel on a short budget!', "The location of this hostel is good, in the city center, every places are walkable, the staff was nice, they speak good english and so helpful, i only stay there for 1 night but everything was good, a bar downstairs was quite nice also, wasn't too many people there but there are always people hanging out there so you can talk with people surrounding you", 'We stayed in a private room on the fourth floor for two night right before flying back home. On the second night we found huge bedbugs in our bed. They did immediately give us some beds in a dorm room and apologized, but as I can understand from the other reviews, this is a general problem in this hostel. Definitely not okay!We have them in all our clothes and now have to freeze or hot wash everything from our bags, just to not infest our home with them. Such a bad experience.', 'Which is a good thing, imo. Stayed on the fourth floor, which was quiet at night. The ground lobby and bar is more of a place to hang out than to party. The free beer during certain periods is nice. The breakfast is great, with plenty of options to choose from. I had to print quite a lot of documents for my Chinese visa. Some of the staff were willing to help, some less so. All in all, recommended.', "Took around 9minutes to walk to the giant river and around 5-6 minutes with a skateboard, plenty of places to eat I also saw some market stand where they would sell clothes and food.The bad part is there's no AC but at that pricepoint it was a nobrainer for me.", 'Sometimes is good and something is not so good.\rGood:\rLocation for nightlife \rBest choice for saving money \rFree beer\rIncluding breakfast \rAir conditioner, hot shower and fans in the room.\r\rNot so good\rInternet, sometimes good sometimes not good\rStaff always makes noise when they have communicated.', 'You get what you paying for. Basic room with strong AC and fan. Small locker for belongings. Breakfast is free, but small. Wifi works great. Have a happy hour beer deal! Good wandering around location.', "I've stayed here for a few night to take a break from traveling. The down stairs has pads of sofas for relaxing and meeting me people, the dorm was clean with comfy beds and with on shower and toilet. Breakfast was included which wasn't just eggs and bread for once. In the even there was free beer so people gather down stair for that, which I felt was a really good touch as I'm a solo traveler and find it hard to meet people sometimes this just made it so worth while choosing this hostel. Me and someone I met did the sapa tour together, which was incredible they gave us loads of information, stored our big backpacks for free. The tour bus picked us up from the hostel and dropped us back right out side. Next time I'm in Hanoi I will be coming back here", "Amazingly friendly staff, always there to help and meet your needs - don't be scared to ask to change something as if they can they will.The tour to Halong Bay (2 days 1 night) was really good and similar price but Tam Coc was more expensive so just check stuff out first.Breakfast was great everyday! A lot more food than I had expected.Overall, really satisfied and I would recommend this place if you don't mind a bit of noise from the parties downstairs.", 'This place is probably the best Backpacker hostel I ever seen.The dorm was very basic, but the services are unique.A very rich free breakfast, free flow beer, super kind staff, and more of it, an excellent atmosphere where meeting new people is super easy.I loved this hostel. Super recommended!!', "Fun, happening hostel right in the center of it all! Always a party in this hostel including free beer at night! Nice thing is even through there's a party downstairs, I was on the 3rd floor and couldn't hear it.", "We love Funky Jungle hotel, we even stayed again when we stopped in Hanoi for 2 nights before come back home. It''s a great place to meet other travelers. The bar area downstairs has great deals ( Free beer from 6 - 7pm and 8pm until the keg runs out ). The staff was friendly and helpful. The tours were really good. Location is perfect, close to everything! We could definitely recommend this hostel.", "if you 're looking for an affordable hostel with a lot of fun for you and your friends then this in the one. We had a lot of fun. There's plenty of drinks offers and great music. The atmosphere is relaxed but everyone is up to party. With a pool table. Bar . Beds are super comfotable. FREE beer everyday from 6-7pm and again 8:30pm.  They have a lot of different tours to Sapa and Halong bay and other places. The staff are very helpful and freindly. ( Charlie is the best ). Highly recommended.", "We stayed here for a couple days, as soon as we entered the building we felt that the staff was very open and inviting, and tried to make our stay as smooth as possible without any hassle.The beds in the dorm room were great, haven't had a bad night's sleep in this hostel, and the breakfast in the morning, although basic, was a welcoming sight in the morning after enjoying all the free beers the previous night. They offer 3 kegs of beer per night, for an hour at 6 o'clock, and again at 8:30pm until the kegs are all empty. The staff speaks very good English, and can assist you from getting your sim card if you're a new arriver, to booking tours all over Vietnam. They are very welcoming and warm towards everybody including each other. At night, everybody is sitting in the common room having fun and chatting with one another. Food can also be ordered here, which they buy from outside and serve to you to make life easy.Excellent stay for backpackers, as every night you get the opportunity to meet new people. And as mentioned before, they offer great assistance in trying to get your itinerary for Vietnam sorted out by the best of their knowledge.In conclusion, I would recommend this hostel to everybody who wants to have a good time, and who wants to make new friends. While still having an excellent stay. Even though the hostel is relatively new, the quality of the service and facilities are up there: pool table, table football, a bar, public bathrooms on the ground floor, and fans everywhere.", 'Just backpackers there and every night free beer and it was clean. Staff was always more than helpful. \rBut we lost some things with the laundry service \rIts good to book tours there, we did the halong bay with a night on the sea and it was great', "Amazing stay at Funky Jungle  Hostel, we stayed in a dorm room which was a good opportunity to meet other people. It is a great place to meet people due to the daily pub crawls which start in the bar downstairs with lots of good drinks deals! The staff were fantastic - especially Steve and Hue ( travel desk ) . The tours that you can book at the travel desk are also very nice. You'll probably pay a bit more than across the street, but you certainly get what you pay for. We booked the tour to Sapa, Ha Long Bay with this hostel which was also awesome! Overall, I wouldn't recommend this hostel, as there are many choices that are just as affordable in the area.", "For $5 a night I'm yet to encounter a hostel which represents better value for money than Funky Jungle Hostel. The beds are seriously the best I've slept in whilst travelling, actually better than my bed back home, I never wanted to leave it. The staff are incredibly friendly and the social environment is tip top with free beer, foosball, pool, it really is a great place to socialise and treat as a base to enjoy Hanoi from... they even throw in free breakfast.Wonderful."]

PhÃ²ng á»Ÿ yÃªn tÄ©nh, sáº¡ch sáº½.', 'vi tri dong vui', 'I am from Singapore and I worked in the hospitality industry before, currently in the luxury retail trade. Therefore, I believed I knew what is professionalism and excellent customer service when I experience one.Front Office Reception: They have an amazing team of service staff. Almost everyone speaks good English and has a high energy level whenever guests approach them for assistance. The MVP among them has to be Jack, one of the most helpful and professional gentlemen with a big warm smile and enthusiasm in providing advice and local recommendations for the best of our experience in Hanoi. He even created a GROUP CHAT in Whatsapp for us, so as to allow us to text him should we ever need help or got lost in the City... how amazing is that!!! He went over and beyond in terms of service level for a 3-4 stars hotel! Essence Cafe: Both Annie and Alex(female) provided superb service during our dinner at the cafe. Smiley, patience, professional, attention to details. Food was YUMMY!', 'I am from Singapore and I worked in the hospitality industry before, currently in the luxury retail trade. Therefore, I believed I knew what is professionalism and excellent customer service when I experience one.Front Office Reception: They have an amazing team of service staff. Almost everyone speaks good English and has a high energy level whenever guests approach them for assistance. The MVP among them has to be Jack, one of the most helpful and professional gentlemen with a big warm smile and enthusiasm in providing advice and local recommendations for the best of our experience in Hanoi. He even created a GROUP CHAT in Whatsapp for us, so as to allow us to text him should we ever need help or got lost in the City... how amazing is that!!! He went over and beyond in terms of service level for a 3-4 stars hotel! Essence Cafe: Both Annie and Alex(female) provided superb service during our dinner at the cafe. Smiley, patience, professional, attention to details. Food was YUMMY!', 'Everything was perfect.- Location in old town is perfect for sight seeing-Best staff I have had attend to me, especially Christine- One of the best mattress I have slept on- AC works perfectly- Sumptuous breakfast spread that changes day to day- Afternoon tea. Need I say more. Cherry on top of an already perfect cake. Highly recommended. Lived up to the hype.', 'The hotel can consider having more hooks to hang the towels, clothes, etc.  Perhaps have more switches to control the lights instead of just 1.  This family room is very good, very comfortable.JOE, who is at the front desk, is exceptionally fantastic.  He is not only very helpful and kind with my family and I.  He is very good with all the guests as well.  He is exceptionally smiley, always.  I hope JOE can be rewarded and appreciated by the company.  He is a role model to his co-workers.  Christine, who is also at the front desk, had been helpful.  Thank you very much for the few days of stay with ESSENCE.', "Worth the money anyways, however, don't pick it if you want to get rest early at night. Location is surrounded by many local street beer restaurants and pubs, which attracts many tourists and local at night.", 'Pros:  staff friendly, professional and overall excellent.  Nice quiet, clean rooms.  Great location for nightlife.Cons:  watered down orange and other fruit juices for breakfast.  Really it was just flavoured water and a very insipid colour - a bit pathetic.  I only mention it as it was so laughable.  No ironing facilities, no gym.', 'Nothing quite beats the warmth and helpfulness of the staff here. Excellent location in the heart of Old Quarter, but that also entails quite about of noise before 12 MN when the streets in front are packed with diners. Highy recommend the suite with balcony as its away from the noise and very cozy. The breakfast is superb. Thanks again for the amazing warm welcome!', "Our connectung room aircond had some problem and staff came with technician to fix even though it's midnight. They provided a fan because the are not able to fix. Staff also provided complimentary fruits and juices due to aircond problems. They fix the aircond next day and called us in the evening to check with us on the condition of room.", "Staff were friendly and breakfast spread were adequate. We stayed in a connecting room, size was reasonable. However, the design of the bedframe was those oversize wooden frame which was bigger than the mattress, resulting my wife and kids knocking onto them on a few occasions. One room didn't have any window while the other came with a small window without any view. Hotel is located along a fairly busy street, but we hardly hear any noise during the night.Overall, my family enjoyed our stay at the hotel and will be back again.Regards,WeeOverall, we did enjoy our stay", "It's centrally located, and the room is very comfortable! The staff were friendly and very welcoming.", "Nice accommodation, it's the one of a few nice experience in my first Vietnam travel. There are many kindly attendant, especially Christine, she always provide nice service and answer my question as much as possible, thanks.", "If you are looking for hotel in central location, food and drink at door step, with exceptional customer service. This will be the hotel you should consider. On the other end, hotel room is not impressive and bathroom is small and old, despite staying in a junior suite. It didn't even come close to North American standard. There are many newer hotel around, with larger room and way cheaper rate. Calling taxi or grab is also challenging due to street closure during weekend evening.", 'We are very happy to stayed in the Essence Hotel during our holiday.  Their location is good, the hotel is clean & comfortable, the restaurant served nice breakfast, lunch and dinner. We are no regret to have our lunch & dinner during our short stay. The staff are always happy to provide any support during our stay in Hanoi. Last but not least, many thanks to Tom from buying tickets, allow us to shower before we ahead to train station, arranging taxi and guide us to the train cabin. Many thanks to Sarah Bui of all the kind assistance & tour suggestion during our stay.  We enjoyed the water puppet show. We will never forget their smiling faces & definitely will return when we back to Hanoi.']

address: 91C HÃ ng MÃ£, Quáº­n HÃ²an Kiáº¿m, Phá»‘ Cá»•, HÃ  Ná»™i, Viá»‡t Nam
reviews: ['PhÃ¹ há»£p cho nhá»¯ng nhÃ³m báº¡n Ä‘i du lá»‹ch bá»¥i, giÃ¡ cáº£ pháº£i chÄƒng.', "There was no one there most of the time. No amenities, not even water. I booked with the option to pay in cash on the property, but they charged my card for the room without asking me first to verify my payment choice. I'm furious about the lack of communication and service. The room itself was unimpressive and there was no soap in the dispenser to wash my hands, and barely any toilet paper. There were also few easy to reach electrical outlets. An extension cord should have been provided.", 'bed is comfortable and hostel not far to resteran, night club and mart. i like this place', "I stayed in a private with two friends and the beds were so comfortable compared to all beds I've slept on in the last few months! The room is nice and cozy but the bathroom is pretty tiny. Breakfast is decent. The staff is very helpful. I would definitely stay again!", "I only stayed here two nights as my roommates were quite noisy and made a mess in the bathroom every day. The staff was very friendly overall but their cleaning needs to be improved. After a day the floor in the bathroom was very dirty and full of hair so was the floor in the room. That is not the staff's fault but they didn't clean the bathroom properly in the morning. There was still hair in the sink and on the floor. The shower was broken when I first arrived. However the beds are very comfortable and breakfast is nice with toast eggs and fresh fruits. Also the place is quiet and as a solo traveller I felt a little lonely at times. I appreciate the free maps. Overall the stay was good.", 'as advertised, a simple hostel.  perfect for budget travelers, or a quick overnight between connections.  clean bathrooms, cold dorm rooms (with thick comforters), provided lockers with keys.', 'enjoyed it very much', 'Quiet Room, Local Food', "The dorm was ok, good lockers for your bags. Staff were really helpful, they let me change my booking for no extra cost when I realised I would miss the Sunday market at bac ha if I stayed when I'd originally booked for. The also helped my work out itinerary and bookings for my travel to sapa and halong bay as I was on restricted time and I also received free breakfast on a day when I was just passing through and not staying at the hostel that day. Very helpful and made the stay easy. Good location too", 'Enjoyable stay, Friendly and very helpful staff, nice atmosphere!!!', "The rooms were nice here and the staff are really helpful. It isn't as easy to meet lots of people here so Hanoi backpackers is probably better for young solo travellers wanting to party, but I still met lots of people in the bar for free beer at 6pm every day! And it was nice and quiet, whilst still being walking distance from the 'beer corner' in the city.", 'Probably, the breakfast provided from them is the bestI have had in a budget hostel, in addition to providing free beer for one hour in every evening. But the noise from the neighbours lasting till the mid night is the only thing negative. Overall I would still give them A', 'Initially I admitted I was abit skeptical due to some negative reviews left in Agoda and wondered if they are true to the words. Weighing on its positive reviews, I decided to bet my dollars on it. It turned out that the negative reviews here are baseless and perhaps prejudice to some point of the unrealistic expectations that they thought they deserved when the price is already low.Hanoi Hostel gives me an affordable stay with values that far exceeds the inexpensive price tag. Especially the kind female coordinator who always responds emails within 24 hours, she offers kind advice, patience and being helpful in all arrangements and enquiries. She reminds me of the Greek story of Odyssey and the hospitality code, Xenia. Other staffs have also been extremely attentive and helpful.My helpful advice to other Agoda users is, what you pay is what you get. Thatâ€™s the universal truth in life. If you want a better room or tour package, be prepared to pay for more.Choices are given to you so that you have the freedom to choose.', 'Hanoi hostel is for budget backpackers. Cheap rate, perfect for short stay. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Room cleaness needs some improvement tho.', 'My stay suited my needs perfectly. My boyfriend and I stayed in the dorm room for a day. We had a day in Hanoi between two overnight trains and decided to book a place where we could shower, escape the heat and keep our bags. For that, this hostel was perfect.', 'The rooms were dirty, especially the bathroom. Sharing with 8 people requires daily thorough cleaning. Breakfast was disappointing. Unlimited, but no choice, one egg and only jam and butter after that. Location was good, and people in my room were really nice.', 'I think u should not choose this hostel, the staff here is very terrible, she is not willing to help us, and she is very rude and impolite, i think i would not suggest anyone to stay.Also, the toilet is not clean as well.']
